loans.name: Phonkham Group

texts.en: Somphone is excited the filter was available on an affordable payment plan.  Somphone and her group, along with other villagers, participated in a village meeting where they discussed the costs of treating local water supplies.  Charcoal, firewood, even bottled water were discussed and priced out over two years. The water filter Somphone and her group purchased is guaranteed for two years but is known to function for up to five years.  Somphone and her group also discussed the cost of medical care for water-borne disease. And after totaling up the costs, Somphone and her group recognized the substantial financial savings the water filter will have for them and their families.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so shevcan have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy plastic kitchen utensils

loans.name: Mujeres Alegres Group

texts.es:
El grupo se llama Mujeres Alegres, forman parte del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, donde cada una está haciendo la encuesta lo cual les permite poder conocer la situación de vida de cada una y poder mejorarla por medio de su trabajo.
La Sra. Juliana, es una de las integrantes, es una persona muy trabajadora y luchadora, que está poniendo todo de sí para poder mejorar su situación de vida y  las de su familia. Ella es la presidenta, y comenta que siempre trata de motivar a sus compañeras para que crezcan cada día, todo esto por medio de la venta de prendas varias que viene haciendo.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar jeans, remeras, camisas, pantalones, y otros, de manera a poder seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y las de su familia.
texts.en:
The group named “Mujeres Alegres” (Cheerful Women) was formed so that it could take part in the poverty elimination program. All of the members have taken the survey so that they could become familiar with their living situations and make improvements through their work.

Sra. Juliana is one of the members. She is a hardworking and determined individual who is doing everything she can to improve her living situation and that of her family. Juliana is the president of this group and says that she tries to motivate her fellow group members to grow each day. She puts all of this into practice with her business of selling various types of clothes.

Juliana is requesting a loan in order to buy jeans, T-shirts, shirts, trousers, and other garments so that she can continue her sales just as before. She appreciates the opportunity she has received so that she can improve her living conditions and those of her family.

loans.use: to buy jeans, T-shirts, shirts, trousers, and other garments to sell.

loans.name: Sara

texts.pt:
O senhor  Alberto è Jardineiro,casado pai de 4 filhos dos quais 1 frequenta o ensino tecnico medio, outro no secundario 1dependente vive em casa própria sustenta uma sobrinha qure vive com ele.
Com o valor do ultimo empréstimo conseguiu concluir o rebouco da sua casa, e com este pretende comprar, cimento, arreia, pedra, ferros, areia,  e chapas para dar continuidade da sua obra.  
Diz ter como sonho concluir a sua obra ver seus filhos formados e adiquirir uma viatura para uso pessoal e para lhe ajudar no dia a dia..
Os principais desafios que o ele enfreta são financeiros, ele tem recorrido ao xitique e pretende tomar mais créditos para poder alcancar os seus objectivos e suprir as suas necessidades.
texts.en: Alberto is a gardener and a married father to 4 children: 1 of whom attends a college course, another is at secondary school and one more dependent lives in his own home and cares for a young niece who lives with him. He used his last loan to finish the plastering work on his home and he plans to use this loan to buy cement, sand, stone, building rods and roof sheeting to continue with the building work. He tells us that his dreams include finishing the building work on his home, seeing his children finish their education and buying a vehicle for personal use and to help him in his daily life. The greatest challenges that he faces are in relation to his finances, although he relies on a xitique, an informal credit and savings group, and he hopes to apply for further loans so that he can achieve his objectives and provide for his needs.

loans.use: to buy cement, stone, building rods, sand and roof sheeting

loans.name: Darwin Alexander

texts.es:
El Joven  Darwin  de 23 años de edad es soltero se dedica desde hace 4 años a la venta y elaboración de ladrillos y tejas, su negocio está ubicado en una  aldea  de San Lorenzo al sur de Honduras.
Darwin sus clientes son las personas de otras aldeas o comunidades que están en proceso de construcción de sus viviendas quienes le visitan para comprar ladrillos o tejas, es conocido por ser un joven luchador y emprendedor con el deseo de seguir  adelante.
Darwin está solicitando el préstamo para la compra de cemento, arcilla, barro, etc. que son la materia prima para la elaboración de su producto,  con las ganancias y el apoyo de este préstamo  espera que sus ventas aumenten y poder seguir apoyando a su familia en el hogar.
Su sueño es seguir obteniendo mejores clientes y con las ganancias mejorara sus casas.

San Lorenzo, Honduras – Enero del 2015
texts.en:
Darwin is a single young man who is 23 years of age. For the past four years, he has been in the business of producing and selling bricks and tiles. His business is located in the neighborhood of San Lorenzo in southern Honduras.

Darwin’s customers are people from other neighborhoods and communities who are in the process of building their homes. They visit him in order to buy bricks and tiles. He is known for being a determined and enterprising young man who has the drive to continue forward.

Darwin is requesting a loan in order to buy cement, clay, dirt, and other supplies that make up the raw materials used in making his products. With his earnings and the help of this loan, he hopes to increase his sales and continue supporting his family at home.

His dream is to continue attracting more customers and use his earnings to improve their houses.

San Lorenzo, Honduras – January 2015

loans.use: to buy cement, clay, dirt, and other supplies for making bricks and tiles.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn sells various kinds of vegetables, meat and seafood. She has been engaged in this kind of business for 10 years. Marilyn also cultivates her rice field which is one hectare. 

Marilyn is on her second loan cycle. Her previous loan made a great contribution to running her business well. With her determination to keep her business profitable, she is requesting a loan of PHP 10,000. Marilyn will use this loan to buy a variety of vegetables, meat and seafood to sell within her locality. She would be grateful if she could obtain this loan amount.

loans.use: to buy a variety of vegetables, meat and seafood to sell

loans.name: William

texts.en:
William is a married man. He has 3 children aged 1 to 8 years old. He describes himself to be loyal. 

He operates a farm where he grows vegetables. He has been involved in this business for 6 years. His business is located in an area with potential and his primary customers are loyal. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate rain. 

He will use the KES 10,000 loan to buy farm inputs. This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. His previous loans were repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy building materials.

loans.name: Ann

texts.en:
Ann is a married woman. She has 1 child. She describes herself to be industrious. 

She operates a retail business where she sells cereals. She has been involved in this business for 13 years. Her business is located in an area with potential and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate capital. 

She will use the Kes 80,000 loan to buy more stock of cereal. This is his fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loans were repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to improve her living standards. She hopes that in the future she will be successful.

loans.use: to buy more stock of cereal.

loans.name: Nasavanh Group

texts.en: Hong’s village sources much of the drinking water from local wells, streams, and collected rainwater.  These sources of water are not safe to drink without treatment by boiling.  Hong and her group are excited that the filter was available on a payment plan that made it much more affordable.  Treating drinking water requires cash and time, which now she can shift to other pursuits.  Hong and her village also understand the impact unsafe drinking water has on their family’s budgets. The filter is guaranteed for two years; within this two years, filter users, like Hong’s family, identify a substantial decrease in illness and associated medical costs.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so she can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Somsawad Group

texts.en: Khan understands the difference the water filter can make for her family and for her group’s families.  Khan knows that local water sources require boiling before consumption and boiling water consumes natural and financial resources.  The water filter Khan purchased will increase her family’s disposable income by substantially decreasing money spent to buy charcoal or decreasing the time and cost foraging for firewood.  The filter also eliminates the need to purchase bottled water if it is available.  Khan is excited that the filter was purchased on an affordable payment schedule and the filter is guaranteed for two years so she and her group can continue to receive the many benefits of clean water for many months to come.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so she can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Phonsee Group

texts.en: Vaomanee is excited the filter was available on an affordable, payment plan.  Vaomanee and her group, along with other villagers, participated in a village meeting where they discussed the costs of treating local water supplies.  Charcoal, firewood, even bottled water were discussed and priced out over two years.  The water filter Vaomanee and her group purchased is guaranteed for two years but is known to function for up to five years.  Vaomanee and her group also discussed the cost of medical care for water-borne disease. And after totaling up the costs, Vaomanee and her group recognized the substantial financial savings the water filter will have for them and their families.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so she can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Thongnoy Group

texts.en: Bualapha’s village sources much of the drinking water from local wells, streams, and collected rainwater.  These sources of water are not safe to drink without treatment by boiling. Bualapha and her group are excited that the filter was available on a payment plan that made it much more affordable.  Treating drinking water requires cash and time, which now she can shift to other pursuits.  Bualapha and her village also understand the impact unsafe drinking water has on their families' budgets. The filter is guaranteed for two years; within this two years, filter users, like Bualapha’s family, identify a substantial decrease in illness and associated medical costs.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so she can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Upendo Kerwa Women Group

texts.en:
Upendo Kerwa Women Group joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2014 to get training on enterprise development and management. The group has also learned how to manage their income. The lady raising her hand in the photo is Margaret. She is 31 years old, married and blessed with two children.

Margaret does poultry farming. She also runs a tailoring business, which she is proud of for giving her a financial breakthrough.  She is borrowing a Kiva loan to buy poultry feed that will boost productivity and add more income to cater to the family's needs. 

She is grateful to Kiva for the financial assistance.

loans.use: To buy poultry feed to help boost productivity and her income.

loans.name: Alzira

texts.pt:
Nasceu em Namaacha província de Maputo tem 38 anos de idade, solteira mãe de 3 filhos, todos menores de idade apenas 2 frequentam a escola, responsabiliza-se pelas suas 3 sobrinhas que vivem em sua casa.
É negociante a mais de 10 anos onde ganha um valor que aplica nas despesas da sua casa. Na tentativa de satisfazer os seus clientes solicita um empréstimo para aumentar o volume do seu negócio adquirindo produtos como feijão, arroz, farinha de milho, carne e outros que forem necessário. Este é o seu 6º empréstimo na Hluvuku.
Futuramente pretende terminar a sua obra de residência, ampliar o seu negócio e garantir o ensino dos seus filhos até ao nível superior.
texts.en: Alzira was born in Namaacha province and is 38 years old. She is a single mother to 3 young children, only 2 of whom currently attend school and she is also responsible for caring for 3 young nieces who live with her. She has been a business woman for more than 10 years and she uses her income from her business to cover her household expenses. In an attempt to satisfy her customers, she is applying for a loan so that she can increase her sales by buying products such as beans, rice, cornflour, meat and other items as required. This will be her sixth loan with Hluvuku. In the future, she hopes to finish the building work on her home, expand her business and ensure that her children finish their education.

loans.use: to buy products such as beans, rice, cornflour and meat

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita, in her sixties, continues to have the passion to grow her business. She is engaged in a direct selling business in which she sells a variety of ready-to-wear clothes, shoes and many other articles of clothing. Lolita offers cash or credit to her regular customers which is payable within one month. She started the business 40 years ago and hopes to operate it as long as she can manage to do so. Lolita has many customers to serve, but sometimes she can’t provide all her customers' orders because she only has limited stocks. 

Thus, Lolita is requesting a loan of PHP 50,000 to buy blouses, shoes, underwear and many other articles of clothing. Lolita hopes that some day one of her children will continue what she has started and continue growing her business.

loans.use: to buy blouses, shoes, underwear and many other articles of clothing.

loans.name: Erkingul

texts.ru: Эркингул 21 год, замужем, детей нет. У Эркингул - среднее образование, с 2013 года в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, она занимается животноводством и земледелием. Благодаря упорному труду, в хозяйстве Эркингул на сегодняшний день имеется 2 коровы и 0,71 Га земли, где она выращивает картофель для реализации. Эркингул обратилась в Банк «Бай–Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку семян картофеля и минеральных удобрений. Доходы от кредита Эркингул планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие ее бизнеса.
texts.en: Erkingul is 21 years old, married and does not have children. Erkingul has a secondary education and, to provide the primary education for her family, she has been involved in animal husbandry and farming since 2013. Thanks to her hard work, today Erkingul's business contains 2 cows and 0.71 hectares of land, where she grows potatoes for sale. Erkingul requested a loan in the amount of 50,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum" Bank to buy potato seeds and mineral fertilizers. Erkingul plans to invest the earnings from the loan into further developing her business.

loans.use: to buy potato seeds and mineral fertilizers in order to grow organic potatoes

loans.name: Magdalena Antonia

texts.es:
El cantón del Carmen posee una considerable riqueza en flora y fauna, siendo una de las fuentes principales de ingreso el cultivo del plátano de la variedad Barraganete, en este lugar se reúnen las socias del Grupo De Crédito El Palmar.
En este lugar vive la señora Magdalena, tiene 48  años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen 3  hijos, dos mayores de edad y una de 15 años que estudia en colegio. Su esposo es emigrante vive en España.
Doña Magdalena para salir adelante junto a su familia tiene una tienda de víveres en su casa,  ahí vende todo tipo de productos como arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes, legumbres, verduras y frutas,  trabaja todos los días desde las 8h00 hasta las 20h00 y a veces hasta más tarde, su hija y su hijo le ayudan en su trabajo cuando ellos pueden y están desocupados pero por lo general es ella la que más pasa en su negocio ya que es ahí donde le gusta estar ya que además de ganarse la vida se entretiene y se informa de las novedades que pasan a su alrededor.
Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir más su tienda, va a comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, detergentes, embutidos y otros productos de primera necesidad. Está en el Grupo De Crédito  hace 4 años y le gusta porque le dan la oportunidad de crecer. Sus metas son seguir adelante en su negocio y que su tienda crezca cada día más.
texts.en:
The canton of El Carmen has a wealth of flora and fauna. One of the main sources of income in this area is the cultivation of bananas of the Barranganete variety. The members of the Communal Bank “El Palmar” meet in this place.

It is here that one can find Sra. Magdalena. She is 48 years old, married, and has three children. Two of her children are grown and her 15-year-old daughter attends high school. Her husband is living in Spain.

Doña Magdalena is able to help her family get ahead because she manages a provisions store from her home. She sells all types of products such as rice, sugar, oil, detergents, legumes, vegetables, and fruit. Magdalena works every day from 8:00 A.M. to 8:00 P.M. and sometimes much later. Her daughter and her son help her with the work whenever they are able and not occupied with other things. However, she is the one who spends the most time at her business since she enjoys being there. In addition to earning a living, her business keeps her busy and she is able to stay informed with the news that is happening in her neighborhood.

This loan will be used to acquire more inventory for her store. She will buy rice, oil, detergents, cured meats, and other basic necessity products. Magdalena has been with her Communal Bank for four years and enjoys being a member because she has been given the opportunity to grow. Her goals include moving forward with her business and growing her store each day.

loans.use: to buy rice, oil, detergents, cured meats, and other basic necessity products.

loans.name: Joeylito

texts.en:
Joeylito, aged 46 years of age, is married and has two children who attend school. He loves to cook: that’s why he decided to run a restaurant business which he has done for almost four years. Joeylito employs four staff to assist him in running the business. They serve different dishes to their customers. He said that his earnings from his business are a big help in sustaining his children's school allowances. 

Joeylito’s goal is for his children to finish their studies and to become professionals some day. However, he can’t attain this goal if he does not continue to grow the business. Hence, Joeylito is asking for a loan of PHP 30,000 to buy raw meats and ingredients to cook and sell. He will do his best and hope his goal becomes reality.

loans.use: to buy raw meats and ingredients to cook and sell.

loans.name: Deolinda

texts.pt:
Nasceu na Província de Maputo tem 32 anos de idade, solteira mãe de 2 filhos menores de idade apenas 1 frequenta a escola. Responsabiliza-se pelos 2 sobrinhos que vivem em sua casa.
Trabalha numa Empresa Água a mais de 8 anos onde aufere um valor que aplica nas despesas da sua casa. Com o valor solicitado pretende dar continuidade a sua obra de residência adquirindo material de construção como areia, cimento, chapas, pedra e tijoleira. Este é o seu 4º empréstimo na Hluvuku.
Futuramente pretende terminar a sua obra de residência, abrir uma mercearia e salão de beleza.
texts.en: Deolinda was born in the province of Maputo and is a 32 year old single mother to 2 young children, of which only one currently attends school. She is also financially responsible for 2 of her nieces and nephews who live with her. She has been working for more than 8 years for a water company, where she earns an income which covers her household expenses. She plans to use this loan to continue with building work on her home and she will buy building materials such as sand, cement, roof sheeting, stone and bricks. This will be her fourth loan with Hluvuku and, in the future, she hopes to finish her building work and to open a grocery shop and beauty salon.

loans.use: to buy building materials such as sand, cement, roof sheeting, stone and bricks.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is a married woman. She has two children. She describes herself as honest and humble. She operates a chemist. She has been involved in this business for two years. Her business is located in a marketable place, and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge as insufficient working capital. She will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more medicine. 

Judith's business goal is to expand into a reliable medical clinic within five years. She hopes that in the future she will generate wealth and raise the family's standard of living. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. She will use the anticipated profits to start other income generating activities.

loans.use: to buy more medicine.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy various items

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy general clothing and accessories

loans.name: Rogelio Del Carmen

texts.es: Don Rogelio nació en una comunidad llamada Pavona en el año de 1963 este lugar queda en el municipio de El Cuá Bocay.Solo pudo estudiar hasta cuarto grado de primaria para luego ayudarle a su papá en actividades de campo así fue que aprendió a trabajar en actividades agrícolas y luego en cortes de café. Actualmente don Rogelio está casado y tiene 7 hijos. Tiene una propiedad en la que tiene sembrado café y siembra granos básicos, trabaja su tierra con sus hijos. En este lugar no hay luz eléctrica es por eso que solicita un préstamo para la compra de un sistema solar y así poder alumbrarse en su casa y así ya la señora y los que habitan ya vivirán diferente la señora se podrá levantar por las madrugadas a hacer la comida en los tiempos de corte y los hijos que están en clase podrán hacer las tareas por las noches. Don Rogelio estaría muy agradecido si le brindan la oportunidad de este préstamo para la compra de este panel solar.
texts.en:
Rogelio was born in a community called Pavona in 1963. This place is in the city of El Cuá Bocay. He was only able to study through the fourth grade of elementary school to then help his father work in the fields. This is how he learned to do farming work and then to harvest coffee. 

Rogelio is currently married and has 7 children. He has a plot on which he has coffee planted and he plants basic grains. He works his land with his children. 

There is no electricity in this place and that is why he is requesting a loan to buy a solar system to light up his home in that way. The lady and those who live there would then live differently. The lady would be able to wake up in the early morning to make food during the harvest time and the children who are in school would be able to do their homework at night. Rogelio would be very thankful to be provided the opportunity for this loan to buy a solar panel.

loans.use: to buy a solar system.

loans.name: Batmakan

texts.ru: Батмакан, 37 лет, замужем. У нее среднее образование, уже 17 лет в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, она занимается животноводством. Благодаря упорному труду, в хозяйстве Батмакан на сегодняшний день имеется 1 корова, 10 овец. В целях увеличения своего бизнеса она обратилась в Банк «Бай–Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 30,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота. Доходы от кредита Батмакан планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины.
texts.en: Batmakan is 37 years old, married. She has a secondary education and, to provide the primary income for her family, has been involved in animal husbandry for 17 years. Thanks to her hard work, today Batmakan's farm contains 1 cow and 10 sheep. In order to grow her business, she requested a loan in the amount of 30,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum" Bank to buy livestock. Batmakan plans to invest the earnings from the loan into further increasing her livestock quantities.

loans.use: to buy livestock in order to grow her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy consumer electronics

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 37 years old and married with four children. She works hard to provide for her family. Evelyn has run a general store in the Philippines for the past 11 years and also earns an income from rice retailing.

Evelyn has borrowed and repaid nine loans from NWTF before this loan. She has now requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more grocery items like soft drinks, canned goods, noodles, etc. to sell.

Evelyn aspires to save enough money to expand her business and to continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery items like soft drinks, canned goods, noodles, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Natercia

texts.pt:
Nasceu em Inhambane tem 35 anos e idade vive maritalmente mãe de 1 filha menor de idade, não responsabiliza-se por ninguém. 
Trabalha no Ministério de Saúde a mais de 6 anos onde aufere um valor que aplica nas despesas da sua casa. Com o valor solícitado pretende legalizar um espaço para erguer dependências para aluguer. Este é o seu 5º empréstimo na Hluvuku.
Futuramente pretende dar continuidade com os seus estudos e mais tarde contrair matrimónio.
texts.en: Natercia was born in Inhambane and is a 35 year old mother to 1 young child. She lives with her partner and is not financially responsible for anyone else. She has been working for the Ministry of Health for more than 6 years and she uses her income from this work to cover her household expenses. She plans to use this loan to licence a piece of land where she can build outbuildings to rent out. This will be her fifth loan with Hluvuku and, in the future, she hopes to continue with her studies and then to get married.

loans.use: to licence a piece of land where she can build outbuildings for rental purposes.

loans.name: Saugina

texts.pt:
Nasceu na Província de Maputo tem 26 anos de idade, vive maritalmente mãe de 1 filho menor de idade, responsabiliza-se pelos seus 4 sobrinhos que vivem em sua casa.
Trabalha nas Bombas como Supervisora a mais de 6 anos onde aufere um valor que aplica nas despesas da sua casa. Com o valor solicitado pretende dar continuidade a sua obra de residência adquirindo material de construção areia, cimento, varões e chapas. Este é o seu 1º empréstimo na Hluvuku.
Futuramente pretende terminar a sua obra de residência, dar continuidade com os seus estudos e garantir o ensino do seu filho até ao nível superior.
texts.en: Saugina was born in the province of Maputo and she is a 26 year old mother to a young son. She lives with her partner and is also responsible for her 4 nieces and nephews who live with her. She has been working as a supervisor in a petrol station for more than 6 years where she earns an income which she uses to cover her household expenses. She plans to use this loan to continue with building work on her home by buying materials such as sand, cement, building rods and roof sheeting. This will be her first loan with Hluvuku and, in the future, she hopes to finish the building work on her home, finish her studies and ensure that her son finishes his education.

loans.use: to buy building materials such as sand, cement, building rods and roof sheeting.

loans.name: Kuña Aty Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado kuña aty, está en su ciclo número 2 del programa de comité de mujeres, son de la ciudad de Curuguaty, una zona aun en crecimiento, donde la mayoría de las integrantes se dedican a actividades rurales como cría de animales y agricultura. 
La Señora Margarita, es una de las integrantes, ella tiene un copetín donde vende comidas rápidas y bebidas de todo tipo. Con este trabajo ella ayuda a su familia a salir adelante, desea que  por medio del programa de capacitaciones vaya mejorando cada día.
Ella pide este préstamo para poder comprar bebidas como gaseosas, agua, jugos, como de comestibles para poder vender. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder seguir con sus sueños de salir adelante.
texts.en:
The group named Kuña Aty is in its 2nd cycle with the Women's Committee program. They are from the city of Curuguaty, a still growing area, where the majority of residents work rural jobs like raising animals and farming. 

Margarita is one of the members. She has a small shop where she sells all types of quick food and drinks. With this work she helps her family to move forward. She hopes to keep improving everyday through the training program. 

She is requesting this loan in order to buy drinks like soda, water and juice and food to sell. She is thankful for the opportunity received to be able to continue with her dreams for success.

loans.use: to buy soda, water and juices and food for sale.

loans.name: Las Residentas Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Las Residentas está en su ciclo número 1 del programa de comité de mujeres, es de la ciudad de  Curuguaty, todas ellas son de una zona rural aun en crecimiento, donde todas las integrantes luchan por mejorar y también porque sus zonas mejoren. 
La Sra.   Maria es una de las integrantes, ella es docente, también tiene su pequeño trabajo de crías de animales, comenta que su trabajo es muy sacrificado, pero que se esfuerza cada día para poder ayudar a su familia y a sus seres queridos.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar animales para la cría, como ser gallinas, cerdos y otros. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe para poder seguir creciendo.
texts.en:
The group 'Las Residentas' is in its first cycle of the womens' committee programme in the city of Curuguaty. All of them come from a rural area which is still developing. All of the members of the group work hard to help develop both the area and themselves.

Maria is one of the members of the group. She is a teacher and she also has a side job breeding animals, She says that her job requires her to make lots of sacrifices but she makes the effort to work hard every so she can help her family and her loved ones. 

She is requesting this loan to be able to buy animals to breed like hens, pigs and others. She is grateful to be receiving this opportunity to keep developing.

loans.use: to buy animals to breed like hens, pigs and others.

loans.name: Hugo Amilcar

texts.es: Hugo de 39 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus cuatro hijos, el posee un negocio de venta de productos de primer necesidad azúcar, maíz, frijol, gaseosas, detergentes, papel higiénico, etc. tiene muchos clientes por la variedad de productos que comercializa, con las ganancias que obtiene es como logra salir adelante con su familia, el esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas mercadería por mayor y así seguir con sus ventas que le generan buenas ganancias.
texts.en:
Hugo is 39 years old and lives in his own house with his four children. 

He owns his own business selling grocery products like sugar, corn, beans, soda, detergents, toilet paper, etc.

He has a lot of clients because of the variety of products he offers and he uses his earnings to support his family.

He is requesting a loan to buy more wholesale merchandise so he can continue to make sales which make him a good profit.

loans.use: to buy wholesale sugar, corn, beans, soda, detergents, toilet paper, etc.

loans.name: Maria Laura

texts.es: Maria de 56 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y su hijo, ella posee se dedica al transporte de carga desde hace 10 años, su esposo es quien maneja y ella administra el negocio, tiene muchos clientes por la responsabilidad que tienen y por los precios accesibles, con lo que obtienen de su trabajo logran solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, Maria está solicitando un crédito para la compra de llantas y darle mantenimiento a su vehículo para poder continuar con su trabajo y así tener mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
Maria is 56 years old and lives in her own home with her husband and son. She has worked transporting freight for 10 years. Her husband drives and she manages the business. She has many customers due to the responsibility they show and their affordable prices. They manage to cover some of the household costs with what they earn from their work.

Maria is requesting a loan to buy tires and to tune up her vehicle in order to continue working and in that way to have better earnings.

loans.use: to buy tires and to tune up her vehicle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Minozhatkhon

texts.ru: Миножатхон, 22 года, замужем, есть сын. У Миножатхон среднее образование. Миножатхон занимается сельским хозяйством, на сегодняшний день в ее хозяйстве есть корова. Также есть земельный надел мерою 0,82 ГА, где Миножатхон и ее муж выращивают картофель и кукурузу. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Миножатхон обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на покупку семян картофеля и удобрений. Доходы от кредита Миножатхон планирует вложить в постройку теплицы во дворе ее дома.
texts.en: Minozhatkhon is 22 years old, married and has a son. Minozhatkhon has a secondary education. She is involved in agriculture and currently has one cow on her farm and 0.82 hectares of land, where Minozhatkhon and her husband grow potatoes and corn. In order to further develop her business, Minozhatkhon requested a loan in the amount of 150,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum" Bank to buy potato seeds and fertilizers. Minozhatkhon plans to invest the earnings from the loan into building a greenhouse in the yard of her house.

loans.use: to buy potato seeds and fertilizers in order to grow organic vegetables

loans.name: Nhóm 24 Yên Bằng Group

texts.en:
Thảo is the group leader of the Nhóm 24 Yên Bằng solidarity group, which consists of 8 members. This is Thảo's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

Thảo is 36 years old and married with 2 children. She has a retail business selling cake, sweets, sugar and milk. She is requesting a loan to purchase more of these products to resell.

Thảo has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that she faces in her business is lack of capital.

In the future, Thảo hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to find good jobs.

loans.use: to purchase more cake, sweets, sugar and milk to resell

loans.name: Almagul

texts.ru: Алмагул, 30 лет, замужем, мать 3 детей, образование у Алмагул среднее, с 2007 года она занимается животноводством и полеводством. Алмагул добилась очень хороших результатов, у нее есть 6 коров. Также на 4,55 ГА поливной земли, она выращивает картофель, люцерну, пшеницу. Ежедневно Алмагул реализует молоко. Ежемесячный доход составляет около 15,000 сом (KGS). Для дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, она обратилась в Банк «Бай - Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 130,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дойных коров для увеличения объемов реализации экологически чистого молока. На прибыль от кредита Алмагул планирует увеличить своё хозяйство и построить сараи для скота.
texts.en: Almagul is 30 years old, married and a mother of 3 children. She has a secondary education and has been involved in animal husbandry and farming since 2007. Almagul achieved very good results. She has 6 cows and also 4.55 hectares of irrigated land, where she grows potatoes, alfalfa and wheat. Almagul sells milk daily. Her monthly income amounts to about 15,000 som (KGS). To further develop her business, she requested a loan in the amount of 130,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum" Bank to buy dairy cows in order to increase the sales volumes of ecologically clean milk. Almagul plans to use the earnings from the loan to grow her business and build barns for the livestock.

loans.use: to buy dairy cows in order to increase the sales volumes of ecologically clean milk

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: Maria de 57 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y su hijo, ella se dedica desde hace 20 años a la elaboración y venta de pupusas su negocio está ubicado en su lugar de residencia en una zona muy transitada, con lo que obtienen de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de chicharrón, quesillo, frijoles, maíz y demás ingredientes y asi poder seguir con su trabajo que le genera buenos ingresos.
texts.en: María is 57 years old and lives in a privately-owned house with her husband and son. She has made a living preparing and selling “pupusas” (a thick corn tortilla stuffed with cheese, fried pork rind, chicken, or refried beans) for 20 years. She runs the business out of her home, which is in a very busy area. María is able to cover some household costs with her profits. She is applying for a loan in order to buy pork scratchings, fresh cheese, beans, corn, and other ingredients. She can thus continue with her work, which provides her with a good income.

loans.use: to buy pork scratchings, fresh cheese, beans, corn, and other ingredients.

loans.name: Mujeres Al Poder Group

texts.es: La Alcancía Comunal “Mujeres al poder” está conformada por 06 socias responsables. Este es el caso de Francisca de 69 años de edad, separada con 08 hijos, todos independientes. La Sra. Francisca es una madre empeñosa que con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación ha logrado apoyar a sus hijos con los gastos de sus estudios. Actualmente se dedica  a la venta de café, la cual lo realiza ambulatoriamente. Se siente feliz pues cada vez mejora su economía. En esta oportunidad solicitó el crédito para la compra de más café. El anhelo de Francisca es tener su propio local. El grupo “Mujeres al poder” agradece a Kiva por la ayuda brindada. Francisca es la primera del lado derecho, viste blusa blanca y pantalón negro.
texts.en:
The “Mujeres al poder” communal bank has six responsible members, including Francisca. 

Francisca is 69 years old, separated and has eight children, all now independent adults. Francisca is a determined mother who, with a lot of hard work and dedication, has supported her children with the costs of education.  Francisca currently makes a living selling coffee as a street vendor and is happy as her financial situation is improving. On this occasion, Francisca is applying for a loan in order to buy more coffee. Francisca’s dream is to own her own premises.

“Mujeres al poder” thanks Kiva for this support. In the photo, Francisca is the first on the right, wearing a white blouse and black trousers.

loans.use: to buy more coffee.

loans.name: Ilda Antonia

texts.es: Ilda tiene 57 años de edad y vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de pupusas su negocio está ubicado en su lugar de residencia en una zona muy transitada desde hace 20 años, con lo que obtienen de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, Ilda esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de chicharrón, quesillo, frijoles, maíz y demás ingredientes y asi poder seguir con su trabajo que le genera buenos ingresos.
texts.en: Ilda is 57 years old and lives in a privately-owned house with her family. She has made a living preparing and selling “pupusas” (a thick corn tortilla stuffed with cheese, fried pork rind, chicken, or refried beans) for 20 years. She runs the business out of her home, which is in a very busy area and is able to cover some household costs with her profits. Ilda is applying for a loan in order to buy pork scratchings, fresh cheese, beans, corn, and other ingredients. She can thus continue with her work, which provides her with a good income.

loans.use: to buy pork scratchings, fresh cheese, beans, corn, and other ingredients.

loans.name: Ana Cecilia

texts.es: Ana de 46 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo, sus tres hijos y su nieto, ella se dedica a la venta de productos de uso personal desde hace varios años, su negocio está ubicado en su lugar de residencia y también vende de forma ambulantes por las diferentes colonias, con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de perfumes, lociones, cremas, shampoo, desodorantes etc. todo por mayor y así poder seguir con su trabajo para tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Ana is 46 years old and lives in a privately-owned house with her husband, three children, and grandson. Ana has been making a living selling personal products for a number of years. Her business is in her home but she also sells as a street vendor in the local area. Ana is able to use her profits in order to cover some household costs. 

Ana is applying for a loan in order to buy perfumes, lotions, creams, shampoo, deodorants and more in bulk. She can thus continue with her work and earn a higher income.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, lotions, creams, shampoo, deodorants and more in bulk.

loans.name: Kuña Guapa Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado "Kuña Guapa" esta en su ciclo número tres, del programa de comité de mujeres, donde tienen su actividad individual y procuran por salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde  todas las integrantes se encuentran en una pobreza extrema.
Una de las integrantes es la Señora Nidia quien se dedica con la venta de bebidas en general, como por ejemplo: bebidas alcohólicas, agua, gaseosas, jugo, etc., es por medio de este trabajo que tiene los medios para poder ayudar a sus seres queridos y a su familia. Es una mujer muy trabajadora y por sobre todo luchadora, que no teme al trabajo y al sacrificio. También se debe destacar el trabajo de la fundación paraguaya, quien hace un seguimiento permanente de capacitaciones y verificaciones.
Pide este préstamo para la compra de más bebidas, como  bebidas alcohólicas, agua, gaseosas, jugo, etc.  lo que le ayudará a tener a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
The “Kuña Guapa” group is on its third loan cycle as part of the women’s committee programme, where each member has her own business and is working to get ahead. The members have undergone the poverty elimination survey and have all been found to be living in extreme poverty.

One member of this group is Nidia, who makes a living selling drinks, such as alcoholic drinks, water, fruit juices, fizzy drinks, and more. This job provides Nidia with the means to help her family and loved ones. Nidia is hard-working and plucky; she is not scared of work or of sacrifice.  Fundación Paraguaya is following the “Kuña Guapa” group members, offering training and doing checks on the women.

Nidia is applying for this loan in order to buy drinks, such as alcoholic drinks, water, fruit juices, fizzy drinks, and more. This will help her to realise her business plan and to increase her income.

loans.use: to buy drinks, such as alcoholic drinks, water, fruit juices, fizzy drinks, and more.

loans.name: Nhóm 3 Thôn 3 -Quảng Thái Group

texts.en:
Hạnh is 34 years old and married with 2 children. She is the leader of a 3-member group, the Nhóm 3 Thôn 3 -Quảng Thái solidarity group. She lives and works in Quang Xuong district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa Province.

Hạnh works in agriculture, raising poultry. She is requesting a loan to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in the future. This is Hạnh's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

Hạnh has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that she faces in her business is lack of capital.

With her business profit, Hạnh hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in the future

loans.name: Walter Antonio

texts.es:
El señor  Walter de 30 años de edad es casado se dedica desde hace 9 años a la venta y elaboración de ladrillos y tejas, su negocio está ubicado en una  aldea San Lorenzo al sur de Honduras,  sus clientes son las personas de otras aldeas y comunidades  que viajan para la capital personas que están en proceso de construcción de sus viviendas quienes le visitan para comprar ladrillos o tejas,.
Don Walter es conocido por ser un joven luchador y emprendedor con el deseo de seguir  a delante esta solicitando el préstamo para la compra de arcilla, cemento, barro, etc. Que son la materia prima que necesita para elaborar su producto.
 Con las ganancias que obtenga espera seguir invirtiendo en su negocio y también seguir apoyando a su familia en el hogar, uno de sus sueños es seguir obteniendo mejores clientes y con las ganancias mejorara su casa.

San Lorenzo, Honduras  – Enero  del  2015
texts.en:
Walter is 30 years old, married, and, for nine years, has made a living producing and selling bricks and roof tiles. His business is in a village in San Lorenzo, in the south of Honduras. His customers are inhabitants of local villages and communities who travel to buy the products. These people are in the process of building houses and so come to buy bricks or tiles.

Walter is known to be a hard-working and enterprising young man. He wants to get ahead and so is applying for this loan in order to buy clay, cement, mud and more. He needs these basic materials to make his products. 

Walter hopes to use his profits to continue investing in his business, and to support his family at home. One of Walter’s dreams is to continue gaining better customers and to make improvements to his own house with his profits.

San Lorenzo, Honduras; January 2015

loans.use: to buy clay, cement, mud and more for his business.

loans.name: Sandra Lizeth

texts.es: Sandra, tiene 34 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene dos hijos a su cargo y reside en el municipio de Azacualpa, Santa Barbara. Sandra realizaba trabajos varios y hace 7 años decidió vender mercadería como camisas, pantalones, faldas, blusas y accesorios para damas en enchape de oro y plata como es aretes, anillos, cadenas y pulseras. Esta mercadería la vende en forma ambulante y por encargo. El prestamo que esta solicitando es por 25,000 lempiras para compra de mas mercadería como aretes, anillos y pulseras de enchape en oro y variedad de ropa para vender. Su propósito es tener mucho inventario para ofrecer a sus clientes y obtener mejores ganancias y hacer crecer su negocio.
texts.en:
Sandra is 34 years old and a single mother. She has two children in her care. Sandra lives in the Azacualpa municipality in Santa Barbara. She used to do various kinds of jobs but seven years ago decided to sell merchandise such as shirts, blouses, trousers, and skirts. She also sells gold-plated accessories for women, such as earrings, rings, chains and bracelets. Sandra sells her products as a street vendor, and takes orders from customers. This loan is for 25,000 Lempira and will be used to buy merchandise, such as gold-plated earrings, rings, and bracelets, and clothes to sell.

Sandra’s goal is to have a lot of stock to sell to her customers. She can then earn higher profits and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy merchandise, such as gold-plated earrings, rings, and bracelets, and clothes to sell.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with five children and all go to school. She also supports additional family members. She resides in the family house with access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

Grace sells charcoal at the market on both a retail and a wholesale basis, and she has been in this business for 12 years. She also gets additional income from rental houses.

She has applied for a loan of 3,000,000 Uganda shillings (UGX) from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bags of charcoal. She works seven days a week, and her major business challenges include seasonality and transportation. 

In future she would like to increase her capital so that she can serve more customers.

loans.use: to buy bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Hector

texts.es:
Hector es un hombre joven de 23 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene un hijo de 1 año, y su negocio es la pesca artesanal.
Él es buen padre, emprendedor, paciente, constante, responsable y trabajador. Su labor la realiza en la comunidad ‘Isla Suriqui’ que se encuentra ubicada en el sector del Lago sagrado Titicaca, a una altura aproximada de 3,800 metros sobre el nivel del mar, es un sitio turístico donde se fabrican las balsas de totora, recurso natural que permitió al hombre andino navegar en el lago desde épocas remotas, se encuentra a 87 kilómetros de la ciudad y su medio principal de transporte es la lancha y otros medios de navegación, de clima frío y seco.
Hector es de tez morena, cabello negro corto, ojos obscuros, baja estatura, complexión física delgada. Su vida la realiza con su pareja que se dedica a la agricultura y con su bebé que está aprendiendo a caminar, viven en una casa propia construida de adobe con techo de calamina y cuenta con agua de pozo y electricidad. Su actividad es la pesca, anteriormente pescaba con su padre, luego se independizó y actualmente pesca solo. Las variedades de pesca del lugar son; mauri, carachi, pejerrey y trucha. “la cultura de los pobladores nos hace cuidar nuestro lago, tenemos épocas de pesca y otras que guardamos nuestras redes y nos dedicamos a otras actividades, así el lago nunca deja de producir peces…” comenta. Su sueño es construir una casa de ladrillo para que su hijo no sufra las inclemencias del estado del tiempo, él desea realizar la compra de un bote y redes de pescar para realizar su labor en mejores condiciones de seguridad. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 3 años que viene realizando esta actividad. 
Es por esos motivos que Hector solicita un préstamo para la compra de un bote y redes de pesca para pescar con mayor seguridad y darle un hogar seguro a su bebé.
texts.en:
Hector is a young man of 23. He lives with his partner and he has a one-year-old baby. His business is traditional-style fishing. He is a good father - enterprising, patient, persevering, responsible and hardworking. 

He works in the Suriqui Island municipality, which is in the region of the sacred Lake Titicaca at approximately 3,800 meters [12,500 feet] above sea level. It is a tourist destination where they make reed boats and it is a natural site where Andean men have been sailing the lake since far-off times. It is 87 kilometres [54 miles] from the city and the principal means of transport is the motorboat, amongst other types of boat. The climate is cold and dry. 

Hector is brown-skinned with short, black hair and dark eyes, small in stature and slim built. He shares his life with his partner, who works in agriculture, and his baby, who is learning to walk. They live in their own adobe-built house that has a corrugated iron roof and they have water from a well and electricity. 

Hector is in the fishing business; he previously fished with his father now he has his own business and fishes alone. The different species of fish in his area are: mauri, carachi, pejerrey and trout. "The culture adopted from the settlers means that we look after our lake; we have fishing seasons and other seasons when we pack away our nets and do other things, in this way the lake never stops producing fish," he said. 

His dream is to build a brick house so that his son doesn't suffer from changing weather conditions. He would like to buy a boat and fishing nets to be able to do his job in better conditions of security. It is his first loan cycle with the institution in the 3 years that he has been running this business. It is for this reason that Hector is requesting a loan to buy a boat and fishing nets to be able to fish in great security and also to provide his baby with a safe home.

loans.use: to buy a boat and fishing nets for fishing in greater security and to provide a safe home for his baby.

loans.name: Rosa Emelina

texts.es: Rosa de 63 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, ella posee un pequeño súper donde vende una variedad de productos de primera necesidad así como también productos para el hogar, su negocio está ubicado en el mercado municipal y posee muchos clientes, con las ventas que realiza logra solventar algunos gastos que se le presentan en el hogar, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de sopas, huevos, detergentes, azúcar, maíz, frijol, gaseosas, desechables, etc. y asi poder seguir con sus ventas para tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Rosa is 63 years old and lives in her own house with her family. 

She owns a small grocery store where she sells a variety of staple goods as well as products for her house. Her business is located in the regional market and she has lots of customers. She uses the income she makes from sales to pay for some household expenses. 

She is requesting a loan to buy soup, eggs, detergents, sugar, corn, beans, soda and disposables etc, so that she can keep making sales to improve her income.

loans.use: to buy soup, eggs, detergents, sugar, corn, beans, soda and disposables etc.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is married and has two children, both of her children go to school. She also takes care of additional family members. She sells charcoal from home on both a retail and wholesale basis. She has applied for a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy bags of charcoal. She has been in this business for seven years. She generates additional income from selling piped water and from rental houses.

Elizabeth works seven days a week. Her major business challenges include transportation and seasonality. She is aspiring to build more rental rooms. She resides in her own home and her family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: to buy bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to maintain his dragonfruit and pineapple crops.

loans.name: Virgen De Guadalupe Group

texts.es:
El grupo se llama "Virgen de Guadalupe" forma parte del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, todas ellas están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de la pobreza, para poder conocer la situación de vida y conforme a ello trabajar e ir mejorando sus condiciones de vida y las de su familia.
Una de las integrantes es la Señora Buena, quien en su última encuesta mostró un nivel 2, es decir en un nivel medio, ella por medio de la venta de pescados tiene los medios para poder ayudar a su familia, ella siempre tiene productos frescos con los cuales da a sus clientes todo lo que piden. Ella es una mujer muy luchadora y trabajadora que quiere crecer, es por eso que se esfuerza siempre.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar pescados frescos, de manera a poder seguir con sus ventas y con ello poder cumplir con los pedidos de sus clientes.
texts.en:
The group is called 'Virgen de Guadalupe' and it is part of the Poverty Elimination Program. All its members are taking the program's survey, which will allow the field partner to know their life situations and, based on that, work to improve their living conditions and those of their families.

One of the group's members is Buena. In the last survey she showed a level 2, which is a medium level. Thanks to her fish selling activity, she has the means to be able to help her family. She always has fresh products to meet her customers' demands. She is a determined and hardworking woman who seeks personal growth and is always endeavoring to achieve it.

She is requesting this loan to buy fresh fish, so that she can go on with her sales and comply with her customers' requests.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell

loans.name: Elis Yovany

texts.es: Elis de 32 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, el posee una farmacia desde hace varios años, donde vende todo tipo de medicina popular, tiene muchos clientes por la calidad del producto y los buenos precios, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas medicina popular por mayor para poder continuar con sus ventas y así poder tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Elis is 32 years old and lives in his own house with his family. 

He has had a pharmacy for several years and has many customers thanks to the quality of his products and the good prices he charges. With the revenue that he obtains from his sales he is able to pay for some of his household expenses. 

He is requesting a loan to buy some more traditional medicines to be able to continue his sales and improve his revenues.

loans.use: to buy some more traditional medicines from wholesalers

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is married with four children; all of her children go to school. She has no additional family members. She sells green bananas at the market on a retail basis. She has been in business for five years. She works seven days a week. She gets additional income from selling charcoal at the market. 

She has applied for a loan of UGX 1,000,000 from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bunches of green bananas. Her major business challenges include seasonality of green bananas. She is aspiring to educate her children to university level. She resides in her own house and the family has access to electricity but has no access to piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: to buy more bunches of green bananas.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cement, sand, brick, iron etc. to build a bedroom.

loans.name: Aksar Bibi

texts.en:
Aksar Bibi is a 41-year-old woman, residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of five children. Her husband has been running a cosmetics shop for past 10 years. He is the only person responsible for fulfilling the needs of the entire family and managing the household. 

Aksar Bibi's husband wants to purchase different types of cosmetic items: creams, rubber bands, rings or kangans and other things to fulfill the demands of his customers, but due to financial constraints he is not in the position to buy these items. 

To fulfill his business needs, Aksar Bibi has applied for a Kiva loan from BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her husband to buy all these things to fulfill his business needs. This will also be helpful for him and enable him to increase his daily sales and earn more profitable income to manage the business and provide for his family's needs. 

Aksar Bibi is very happy and thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her husband's cosmetics business.

loans.name: Ansar Parveen

texts.en:
Ansar Parveen is a 42-year-old woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of 3 children. Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession. For the past many days, his rickshaw has not been working properly because of which he is unable to generate any amount of income. 

Her husband wants to repair his rickshaw as soon as possible. However due to the lack of money he finds it difficult to cover the cost of repairing his rickshaw. Therefore Ansar Parveen has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband to cover the cost of repairing his rickshaw.

loans.use: to repair her husband's rickshaw.

loans.name: Nazia

texts.en:
Nazia is a 31-year-old woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a housewife. Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession. For the past many days, his rickshaw has not been working properly because of which he is unable to generate any amount of income. 

Her husband wants to repair his rickshaw as soon as possible. However due to the lack of money he finds it difficult to cover the cost of repairing the rickshaw. Therefore Nazia has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband to cover the cost of repairing his rickshaw.

loans.use: to repair her husband's rickshaw.

loans.name: Shahida

texts.en:
Shahida is a responsible mother of eight children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been providing transport facilities by driving a taxi for ten years. He is responsible to fulfill the needs of the entire family. 

Her husband needs to do maintenance on his taxi because the current condition of his taxi is not good. It requires more maintenance charges on a daily basis. Due to insufficient financial means he is unable to do maintenance on his taxi. Therefore Shahida has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

With the help of this loan Shahida's husband can afford the maintenance cost easily. And then he will provide better transport facilities and earn a profitable income. Shahida  also plans to make savings with the profit amount of her husband's income to meet her family's needs in future.

Shahida is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to repair her husband's taxi.

loans.name: Shakeela

texts.en:
Shakeela is responsible mother of six children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been providing transport facilities by driving a taxi for one year. He is responsible for providing for the needs of the entire family. Her husband needs to do maintenance on his taxi because the current condition of his taxi is not good. It requires more maintenance charges on daily basis. 

Due to insufficient financial means, he is unable to do maintenance on his taxi. Therefore Shakeela has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan, Shakeela's husband can afford the maintenance cost easily. This way, he will provide better transport facilities and will be able to earn a profitable income. 

Shakeela  also plans to make savings with the profits of her husband's income to meet her family's needs in future. Shakeela is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to repair her husband's taxi.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy inventories for her husband's general store.

loans.name: Rizwana

texts.en:
Rizwana is a 62-year-old woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her three sons and one daughter. Her husband has been running his own business selling clothes for 10 years. He is the only one responsible for feeding the entire family and managing the household.

He needs to purchase different types of clothes in bulk for reselling purposes, but due to insufficient financial means he is unable to purchase these clothes. Therefore Rizwana is applying for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan in order to assist her husband to purchase these clothes in bulk for his business. He can also increase the size of his business and earn maximum profit with the help of this loan amount. 

Rizwana is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her husband's cloth business.

loans.name: Shabana Naz

texts.en:
Shabana Naz is a 48-year-old woman, residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a mother of 4 children. Her husband has been running a general store for the past two years. He is the only one responsible for fulfilling the needs of his entire family. 

Shabana Naz's husband wants to purchase different kinds of commodities e.g rice, sugar, tea bags, milk and other consumer items for his business purposes. But due to financial constraints, he is not in suitable position to buy all these products for reselling purposes. 

Therefore Shabana Naz has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her husband to buy all these commodities and also will be helpful for him allowing him to earn maximum profitable income to manage his household and business. 

Shabana Naz is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her husband's business.

loans.name: Suraya

texts.en:
Suraya is a 48-year-old woman, residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a mother of 6 children. Her husband has been running a milk sales business for the past 11 years. He is the only one with the responsibility of fulfilling the needs of his entire family. 

Suraya's husband wants to purchase milk and other consumer items for his business purposes. But due to financial constraints he is not in a suitable position to buy milk for reselling purposes. Therefore Suraya has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her husband to buy milk and also will be helpful for him to earn maximum profitable income to manage his household and business.
 
Suraya is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her husband's milk business.

loans.name: William Antonio

texts.es: El joven William nació en una comunidad llamada quilaca, en el municipio de El viejo en el departamento de Chinandega en el año de 1989. Solamente tuvo oportunidad de estudiar primaria y luego decidió trabajar con su padre en agricultura y aprender más las labores ,actualmente esta casado con  Dinora Gutiérrez y no tiene hijos. William se dedica a sembrar maíz y ajonjolí también trabaja en una empresa que se dedica a sembrar maní, trabaja como cpf ya tiene dos años de estar trabajando en esta empresa. En su comunidad no hay luz eléctrica es por eso que el solicita un préstamo para la compra de un sistema solar que será instalado en su casa y ya con luz será diferente  y estaría muy agradecido si le brindan la oportunidad de este préstamo para la compra de este sistema solar.
texts.en:
William was born in 1989 in Quilaca, El Viejo which is in the department of Chinandenga. He only had the opportunity to study up to primary school and he then decided to work with his father in agriculture and learn manual labour. He is married to Dinora Gutiérrez and they have no children.

William makes a living planting corn and sesame but he also works as a security guard for a business that grows peanuts and has been doing that for two years. In his community there is no electric lighting and for this reason he is requesting a loan to buy a solar energy system that will be installed in his home. His home would be different with lighting and he would be very grateful to be given the chance to have this loan to buy the energy system.

loans.use: to buy a solar energy system.

loans.name: Juana Elvira

texts.es:
EL Grupo De Crédito Nuevos Horizontes se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Jipijapa, cantón conocido con el nombre de la sultana del café por los extensos cultivos de café el cual tiene un sabor incomparable, por su gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente. 
En este lugar vive la señora Juana, tiene 54 años de edad, es madre soltera tiene un hijo el cual ya es mayor de edad y aun vive con ella.
Doña Juana para salir adelante ella y su hijo hace mas de 17 años realizo el primero de sus créditos y con esto surtió una pequeña  tienda de víveres en su casa, así con el paso de los días la fue mejorando después empezó a vender artículos de bazar y papelería con lo cual sus clientes y ganancias mejoraron, actualmente también tienen un karaoke y bar el mismo que atiende su hijo con lo cual obtienen ingreso extra que les ayudan a mejorar su calidad de vida, ella trabaja todos los días en su negocio ya que es donde le gusta estar ya que así se mantiene al tanto de su entorno social y al mismo tiempo se gana la vida.
Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir mas su tienda, va a comprar víveres y golosinas para surtir el bar karaoke. Está en el Grupo De Crédito hace más de 17 años y le gusta porque gracias a los créditos ella empezó  su negocio con el cual se gana la vida. Sus sueños  son seguir mejorando con el paso de los días.
texts.en:
The Nuevos Horizontes (New Horizons) group meets every fortnight in the Jipijapa canton. Jipijapa is named after the sultan of coffee and is known for its large coffee crops, which have an incomparable taste, for its food, and for the warmth of its people. 

This is where Juana lives. She is 54 years old and the single mother of one son, who is an adult and lives with her. In order to move forward, Juana and her son took out their first loan over 17 years ago, with which they set up a small grocery store in their home. As time passed, the store improved and, later, they began to sell household items and paper goods which increased the number of customers and their income. They currently also have a karaoke bar that her son looks after which provides them with additional income to help improve their quality of life. 

Juana works every day in her store as it is where she likes to be as she can keep up to date with her social life and earn a living at the same time. She will use this loan to stock her business by purchasing supplies and sweets for the karaoke bar. She has been a member of this group for more than 17 years and she likes it because, thanks to the lenders she started her business, which is how she earns a living. Her dream is to keep improving day by day.

loans.use: to buy supplies and sweets.

loans.name: Baltazara

texts.es:
EL Grupo De Crédito Nuevos Horizontes se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Jipijapa, cantón conocido con el nombre de la sultana del café por los extensos cultivos de café el cual tiene un sabor incomparable, por su gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente. 
En este lugar vive la señora Baltazara, tiene 45 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen 4 hijos, dos mayores de edad y dos de 14 y 6 años, tres de sus hijos aun viven con ella y estudian en universidad, colegio y  escuela. Ellos son de la Provincia Chimborazo pero ya llevan más 30 años radicados en esta linda ciudad. Su esposo es comerciante.
Doña Baltazara junto al esposo se dedican a la venta de frutas, legumbres y verduras, ellos en la madrugada salen de su casa a surtirse de estos productos al mercado de mayoristas para luego salir a recorrer la ciudad y campos cercanos en su carro, trabajan tres días por semana en sus recorridos y los domingos instalan un local en la feria local lugar en el cual muchas personas llegan a surtirse de productos,  llevan más de 25 años con este negocio el cual le permite salir delante de una forma honrada.
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar frutas, verduras y legumbres. Lleva 7 años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan con los créditos. Sus sueños es algún día tener una tienda bien surtida.
texts.en:
The Nuevos Horizontes (New Horizons) credit group meets every 15 days in Jipijapa, a group of houses that goes by the name of 'Sultana del Café' because of its extensive coffee-growing area, a coffee with a unique flavour, and for its gastronomy and the friendliness of the locals. 
   
This is where Mrs. Baltazara lives. She is 45 years old, married and has four children from the union, two of whom are grown up and two others who are 14 and 6 years old. Three of her children are still living with her and are studying at university, college and school. They are from Chimborazo province but settled in this beautiful town over thirty years ago.

Her husband is a shopkeeper. Together with her husband, Mrs. Baltazara sells fruit, vegetables and pulses. Early in the morning, they leave their house to stock up on this produce at the wholesale market then they go around the town and the surrounding countryside in their vehicle. They travel three days a week and on Sundays they set up in the local market, which is a place where many people come and buy produce. They have been running this business for over 25 years and they get by well. 

She will use the loan to buy fruit, vegetables and pulses. She has been with this particular credit group for 7 years and she likes it for the help that it gives her with the loans. Her dream is to one day have a well stocked shop.

loans.use: to buy fruit, vegetables and pulses.

loans.name: Norma

texts.es:
La Señora Norma tiene 49 años, es soltera y no tiene hijos, ella vive con su mama, a quien ella cuida y mantiene ya que es una mujer ya mayor que lucha.
La señora Norma tiene su negocio de ropería desde hace 10 años, también realiza confecciones para eso cuenta con dos máquinas industriales, hace trabajo de costura de telas para las decoradoras, compro un automóvil para salir a vender sus confecciones.        
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de remera, camisa, calzados deportivos, cartera, blusas, vaquero, short y otros productos para poder ofrecer variedad a sus clientes y así generar más ingreso para su familia.
texts.en:
Norma is 49 years old, is single and does not have children. She lives with her mother, taking care of her and supporting her since she is an older but strong woman. Norma has had her clothing store for 10 years now. She also sews and has two industrial sewing machines for this purpose. She does sewing jobs for decorators and bought a car to go and sell her products.

She is requesting a loan to buy t-shirts, shirts, sport shoes, wallets, blouses, jeans, shorts and other clothes, so as to offer a variety of clothes to her customers and thus generate more income for her family.

loans.use: to buy t-shirts, shirts, sport shoes, wallets, blouses, jeans, shorts and other clothes

loans.name: Sabouyouma Group

texts.fr: Diégué est celle qui a levé son bras gauche sur la photo.  Elle est malienne  âgée de 50 ans, son mari est un cultivateur, mère de 5 enfants  dont 1 fréquente l’école.  Elle est ménagère, et n’a pas eu la science d’aller à l’école. Elle fait l’élevage de  moutons.  Elle achète des moutons moins âgés qu’elle élève au bout de quelque mois puis elle les revend à un moment propice. C’est ainsi qu’elle emprunte de l’argent avec le RMCR pour acheter plus de moutons à élever. Elle s’approvisionne sur  le marché de son village et revends ses animaux sur le marché  de la commune. Par vente elle pourrait gagner comme bénéfice 25000FCFA par  mois. Elle soutient sa famille par son bénéfice en payant les frais médicaux,  scolaire et habillement des enfants. Elle a une expérience de 4 ans dans l’élevage. Elle n’a pas rencontré de problème dans l’exercice de ce travail. En plus de l’élevage elle ambitionne de vendre les condiments. En plus de l’intérêt généré, elle est très encouragée par l’engrais organique produit par les bêtes, ceux qui diminuent le cout de ses dépenses en ce qui concerne l’achat d’autre engrais pour leur champ.
texts.en: Diegue is the person with her left arm raised in the photo. She is a 50 year old Malian, and her husband is a farmer. She has five children of whom one goes to school. She is a housewife and was not able to go to school. She raises sheep. She buys the younger sheep and fattens them up for a few months, then she sells them at a favourable time. This is why she borrows money from RMCR to buy sheep for fattening. She buys her sheep at the market in her village and sells them at the town market. From the sales, she can earn up to 25000FCFA per month. With these profits she supports her family by paying health care, school fees, and clothing for the children. She has four years experience in livestock farming. She has not had any problems in this business. In addition to this activity she would also like to sell condiments. Added to the interest that this project has engendered, she is much encouraged by the organic fertiliser that her livestock produce, which lowers the cost of buying other fertiliser for their field.

loans.use: to buy sheep for fattening and resale.

loans.name: Marlene Isabel

texts.es:
EL Grupo De Crédito Nuevos Horizontes se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Jipijapa, cantón conocido con el nombre de la sultana del café por los extensos cultivos de café el cual tiene un sabor incomparable, por su gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente. 
En este lugar vive la señora Marlene, tiene 48 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen 3 hijos, dos mayores de edad y una de 15 años la cual estudian en colegio, todos sus hijos aun viven con ellos. Su esposo es chofer.
Doña Marlene es un ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos y con estos ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos del hogar se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, zapatos y productos de Yanbal,  Avon (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Su forma de venta es puerta a puerta y  también vende en su casa cuando sus clientes quieren algo,  ella sale a recorrer casi  todos los días en sus ratos libres ya que no tiene horario fijo, deja sus productos a  crédito y cobra cada ocho o quince días. Lleva más de 10 años que se dedica a esta actividad la cual le permite ganar algo por su cuenta para beneficio de su familia.
Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos, ropa y zapatos. Lleva más de 10 años en  el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque con el primer crédito comenzó su negocio. Sus sueños son darles la mejor educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The credit group Nuevos Horizontes [New Horizons] meets every fifteen days in the Jipijapa canton, known as the Sultan of Coffee because of the extensive coffee farms where the coffee has an incomparable taste, its gastronomy and the warmth of its people. This is the place Marlene lives. She is 48 years old and married. They have 3 children, two of whom are of age and a 15-year-old daughter who goes to school. All of their children live with them. Her husband is a chauffeur.

Marlene is a housewife who, in order to obtain her own income and help her husband with home expenses, sells clothing of all types, shoes and products from Yanbal, Avon (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes and ladies' accessories). She sells these door to door and from her home when her customers want something. She spends all her time going around selling her products, selling on credit and collecting payments every week or every other week. In this manner she has been making a living from this activity for more than 10 years, which allows her to earn something on her own and for the benefit of her family.

This loan is to buy perfumes, creams, cosmetics, clothes and shoes. She has been in the credit group for more than 10 years and likes it because she started her business with the first loan. Her dream is to give her children the best education.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, creams, cosmetics, clothes and shoes.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
La señora Juana es de Ciudad del Este, es viuda y tiene un hijo con quien vive, y por quien está luchando cada día, para poder seguir con lucha, para poder darle una vida digna.
La señora se dedica a la venta de bebidas, empanadas y otros en su propio local que con mucho sacrificio montó. Ella ha demostrado ser una persona muy responsable y honesta.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar bebidas varias e insumos para hacer sus empanadas. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe que le permitirá crecer.
texts.en:
Juana's from Ciudad del Este.  She's a widow and she has a son who lives with her.  She strives every day to give him a decent life.
