She earns a living selling beverages, empanadas, and other items in her own retail space that she worked hard to set up.  She has shown herself to be a very responsible and honest person.

Juana's requesting this loan to be able to buy a variety of beverages and supplies to make her empanadas.  She's grateful for this opportunity, which will allow her to grow.

loans.use: to buy a variety of beverages and supplies to make her empanadas

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase school supplies, shoes, and uniforms.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy various articles.

loans.name: Rosa Aleja

texts.es:
EL Grupo De Crédito Nuevos Horizontes se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Jipijapa, cantón conocido con el nombre de la sultana del café por los extensos cultivos de café el cual tiene un sabor incomparable, por su gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente. 
En este lugar vive la señora Rosa, tiene 60 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene 7 hijos mayor4es de edad, cinco de ellos aun viven con ella. El marido es comerciante. 
Doña Rosa es una muy buena esposa que realiza el crédito para que su marido lo utilice en su labor, él se dedica a la venta de gafas, gorras, ropa playera, entre otros productos, él se desplaza a playas cercanas como Machalilla, Puerto López entre otras lugares que visita los fines de semana o en feriados que es cuando más turistas llegan a estos lugares y es cuando más ventas realiza, de esta forma el se gana el sustento de su familia, ya son más de 20 años trabajando de esta forma. 
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar gafas, gorras, ropa entre otras cosa que vende. Está desde el inicio en el Grupo de Crédito y le gusta porque así ella puede ayudarle a su marido. Sus sueños son tener un carro para que su marido realice sus recorridos.
texts.en:
The Nuevos Horizontes comunal bank meets every 15 days in the Jipijapa canton.  The canton is known for the name of the sultan of coffee because of its extensive coffee crops that have an incomparable taste, for its cuisine, and for the warmth of its people.

Rosa, age 60, lives in this place.  She is in a common-law marriage, and she has seven grown children.  Five of them still live with her.  Her husband is a merchant. 
 
Rosa is a very good wife who is requesting the loan for her husband to use for his work.  He sells glasses, hats, and beachwear, among other products.  He goes to the nearby beaches like Machalila and Puerto López, among other places.  He visits these places on the week-ends or he sells on holidays, which is when more tourists come to these places.  This is when he makes the most sales.  This is the way he earns support for his family.  He has been working this way for 20 years. 

She will use the loan to buy glasses, hats, and clothes that her husband sells.  She has been in the communal bank since it began.  She likes it because she is able to help her husband this way.  Her dream is to have a car so that her husband can make his rounds.

loans.use: to buy glasses, hats, and clothes that her husband sells.

loans.name: Faiza

texts.en:
Faiza is a 29-year-old woman who lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her three children. Her husband has been working in a public sector organization for many years. He is responsible to fulfill the needs of family. Faiza is also providing sewing services and earning income to contribute with her husband to manage the household.
 
She needs different kinds of goods such as needles, threads, pieces of cloth, machine oil, etc. for her business purpose, but due to insufficient financial means, she is unable to purchase these accessories. Therefore, she has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her to purchase these accessories and also help her to increase her monthly sales and profits by enabling her to provide better sewing services.

Faiza is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase needles, threads, pieces of cloth, machine oil, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Asma

texts.en:
Asma is a responsible mother of three children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been providing transport facilities by driving a taxi for two years. He is responsible for fulfilling the needs of entire family. 

Her husband needs to do maintenance on his taxi because the current condition of his taxi is not good. It requires more maintenance charges on a daily basis. Due to insufficient financial means, he is unable to do maintenance on his taxi. Therefore Asma has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

With the help of this loan, Asma's husband can afford the maintenance cost easily. This way, he will be able to provide better transport facilities and earn a profitable income. Asma also plans to make savings with the profit of her husband's income to meet her family's needs in future.

Asma is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to repair her husband's taxi.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fresh and seasonal vegetable for reselling.

loans.name: Yasmeen Akhtar

texts.en:
Yasmeen Akhtar is a 42-year-old woman, she lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her husband. Her husband has been working in a public sector organization for many years, he is responsible for fulfilling the needs of the family. Yasmeen Akhtar is also providing sewing services and earns an income that she contributes to her husband to help manage the household.
 
She need different kinds of goods such as needles, threads, pieces of cloth, machine oil and other things for her business purposes, but due to insufficient financial means she is unable to purchase these accessories. Therefore she has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner, BRAC Pakistan. 

This loan will enable her to purchase these above accessories and also will help her to increase her monthly sales and her profit by providing better sewing services.

Yasmeen Akhtar is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her tailoring business.

loans.name: Farzana

texts.en:
Farzana is a 51-year-old woman, and mother of two children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband is a fruits and vegetables seller by profession, he sells fruits and vegetables such as apples, bananas, grapes, potatoes, carrots and other things. He is the only one responsible for feeding the entire family and managing the household. 

Farzana's husband needs to purchase different types of fruits and vegetables for reselling purpose so that he can increase the size of business, improve his sales growth and earn maximum profit. But due to his unfavorable financial position, he is not in condition to purchase fruits and vegetables for his business purposes.

Therefore Farzana has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so that she can help her husband to purchase the above items for his business purposes. 

She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her husband's business

loans.name: Shabnam

texts.en:
Shabnam is an active borrower of BRAC Pakistan and a mother of a daughter. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband is a vegetable seller by profession. He sells vegetables e.g. potato, carrot, tomato and other things. He is the only one responsible for feeding the entire family and managing the household. 

Shabnam's husband needs to purchase different types of vegetables for reselling purposes so that he can increase the size of business, improve his sales growth and earn maximum profit. But due to unfavorable financial position, he is not in condition to purchase vegetables for his business purposes.
Therefore Shabnam has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner, BRAC Pakistan. She wants to help her husband to purchase the above items for business purposes.
 
She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her husband's vegetable business.

loans.name: Hamdeya

texts.en:
Hamdeya is 41 years old, and resides in Baniswef, Egypt.  She is married with three school children.  Her husband works as a part time farmer and she takes care of her sick and aging mother. 

The family's monthly income does not cover their expenses.  So two years ago, she started a small poultry project in her house.  After her project's success, she decided to expand her project with a loan from TADE to buy additional kinds and quantities of poultry such as doves, geese and turkeys.

loans.use: to buy additional kinds and quantities of poultry such as doves, geese and turkeys.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fish and fishery products for resale.

loans.name: Kuña Aty Group

texts.es:
17 son las integrantes que forman este grupo, todas ellas ponen todo de sí para ir mejorando día a día. Ellas también están dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza para poder crecer y mejorar cada día por medio del trabajo unido.
Una de ellas es la Sra. Victoria, una humilde agricultura que todos los días empieza su trabajo desde muy temprano. Es una mujer muy sacrificada que siembra todo tipo de hortalizas y que luego sale a vender y que también la gente va a comprar de su huerta. Agradece por la ayuda que está recibiendo, que le permitirá seguir ayudando a su familia.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar semillas y abonos, y de esa forma cosechar todo tipo de hortalizas para mejorar sus condiciones de vida y las de su familia.
texts.en:
There are 17 members in this group, all of whom put their all into being able to improve day by day. They are also in the poverty elimination program to be able to grow and improve each day through their collective work. 

One of them is Victoria, a humble farmer who every day begins her work very early. She is a very self-sacrificing woman who plants all sorts of vegetables and later goes out to sell them, and also people buy them at her farm. She is grateful for the help that she is getting which will allow her to continue to help her family. 

She asks for this loan to be able to purchase seeds and manure, and in this way grow all sorts of vegetables to improve her living conditions and those of her family.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and manure for her crops.

loans.name: Mujeres Luchadoras Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado mujeres luchadoras está en su primer ciclo de programa de comité de mujeres, donde están dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza donde 4 de las 18 señoras se encuentran por debajo de la línea de pobreza, es decir en una pobreza extrema.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Ceferina, quien en su encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza del nivel uno, es decir en una pobreza extrema. Ella comenta que entre el trabajo que ella hace cuenta que se dedica a  la venta de frutas frescas de estación, y con lo cual lucha para poder ayudar a su familia.
La señora Ceferina pide este préstamo para la compra de frutas frescas, como manzanas, naranjas, piñas, pomelos, y otros, de manera a poder seguir con sus ventas, luchando por mejorar cada día. Agradece por la oportunidad que está recibiendo de poder trabajar y luchar por sus seres queridos.
texts.en:
The group called Mujeres Luchadoras is in its first loan cycle in the women's committee program, where they are in the poverty elimination program, where 4 of the 18 woman are below the poverty line, which is to say in extreme poverty. 

One of the members is Ceferina who, in her questionnaire, showed a level of poverty in level one, which is to say extreme poverty. She says that among the work that she does, she sells fresh seasonal fruit, and with which she struggles to be able to help her family.

Ceferina asks for this loan to purchase fresh fruit such as apples, oranges, pineapples, grapefruit, and others, so that she can continue with her sales, struggling to improve each day. She is grateful for the opportunity that she is getting to be able to work and fight for her loved ones.

loans.use: to purchase fresh fruits for sale, such as apples, oranges, pineapples, grapefruit, and others.

loans.name: Luis

texts.es:
Luis tiene 46 años de edad, vive junto a su cónyuge y su menor hijo en casa propia de material noble en la provincia de Cutervo, región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte de Perú, sus pobladores son amables y se dedican principalmente al cultivo de frutales, café, maíz y hortalizas.

El se dedica al cultivo de café variedad catimore el cual es resistente a enfermedades, actividad que realiza hace 4 años, cuenta con experiencia en el rubro del cultivo de café y con buenas referencias en su distrito. Adicionalmente se dedica a la crianza de animales menores como gallinas, cuyes, cerdos, entre otros. El destino del crédito será para la compra de abono y fertilizantes para brindar mantenimiento a su cultivo de café, con esto Luis espera ofrecer un producto de mejor calidad lo que se verá reflejado en un mayor volumen de ventas y por ende obtendrá mayores ingresos para así poder mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Luis, age 46, lives with his wife and his minor son.  He lives in his own house, made from basic materials, in the Cutervo province in the Cajamarca region in the northern highlands of Peru.  The inhabitants there are very friendly, and they devote themselves primarily to growing fruit, coffee, corn, and vegetables.

He grows the Catimore variety of coffee, which is resistant to diseases.  He has been engaged in this business activity for four years.  He has experience in the field of growing coffee, and he has good references in his district.  He also raises small animals like chickens, guinea pigs, and pigs, among others.

He will use the loan to buy compost and fertilizers in order to provide maintenance to his coffee crop.  With this Luis hopes to sell a better quality product, which will bring about a greater volume of sales.  He will then get greater income in order to be able to improve his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: to buy compost and fertilizers in order to provide maintenance to his coffee crop.

loans.name: Francisca Noemi

texts.es:
EL Grupo De Crédito Nuevos Horizontes se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Jipijapa, cantón conocido con el nombre de la sultana del café por los extensos cultivos de café el cual tiene un sabor incomparable, por su gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente. 
En este lugar vive la señora Francisca, tiene 70 años de edad, está separada y de esta relación tienen 4 hijos  mayores de edad, una de ellos  es discapacitada y es la que aún vive con ella. 
Doña Francisca es una mujer muy luchadora que le ha tocado trabajar duro para así ganarse el sustento diario, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, zapatos por catalogo y productos de Avon y Yanbal  (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas), su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, ella sale  tres o cuatro días por semana a vender sus productos y a cobrar ya que deja a crédito y cobra cada semana, lleva más de 15 años con estas ventas con el cual lucha para que no les falte nada a ella y su hija. 
Este crédito es  para comprar ropa, zapatos, perfumes, cremas, cosméticos entre otras cosas que vende. Esta desde el inicio en el Grupo de Crédito y le gusta porque con los créditos sale adelante. Sus sueños son seguir adelante y que nunca les falte nada.
texts.en: The Credit Group "Nuevos Horizontes" meets every two weeks in the Canton Jipijapa, a canton known by the name of "Coffee Sultan" for its extensive coffee crops with a coffee of unparalleled flavor, for its gastronomy and the warmth of its people. Francisca lives here. She is 70 years old, separated and has 4 adult children. One of them is disabled and she still lives with her. Francisca is a hardworking woman who has had to work hard to earn her living. She works selling all types of clothes, shoes by catalog, and Avon and Yanbal products (beauty products, cosmetics, accessories, perfumes and women's accessories). Her way of work is door to door. She goes out three or four days a week to sell her products and collect her money, because she leaves products on credit and gets paid every week. She has been selling these products for 15 years, and she struggles so nothing is lacking for her and her daughter. This loan is to buy clothes, shoes, perfumes, creams, cosmetics, among other things that she sells. Since the beginning, she has been with the Credit Group, and she likes it because she is able to move ahead with the loans. Her dream is to be able to continue prospering and never lack anything.

loans.use: to buy clothes, shoes, perfumes, creams, cosmetics, etc.

loans.name: Gloria Isabel

texts.es:
EL Grupo De Crédito Nuevos Horizontes se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Jipijapa, cantón conocido con el nombre de la sultana del café por los extensos cultivos de café el cual tiene un sabor incomparable, por su gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente. 
En este lugar vive la señora Gloria, tiene 46 años de edad, es soltera y vive en casa de su mamá. Lleva 5 años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque con los créditos ella financia su negocio el cual le permite salir adelante.
Doña Gloria es una mujer muy trabajadora que para obtener sus propios recursos y con estos ayudarle a su mamá con los gastos del hogar se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, ella sale tres veces por semana y también vende en su casa si alguno de sus clientes necesita de alguna prenda, ella deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada ocho días. Tiene 10  años que se dedica a esta actividad con la cual se gana lo suyo y se entretiene ya que le encanta el comercio.
Este crédito es para comprar pantalones, camisas,  ropa de niños. Sus sueños son tener buena salud y seguir adelante.
texts.en:
The Nuevos Horizontes communal bank group meets every two weeks in Jipijapa canton, a canton known by the name of the Sultana of Coffee due to it extensive coffee crops which have an incomparable taste, for its cuisine, and for the warmth of the people. 

Gloria lives in this place. She is 46 years old, single, and lives with her mother. She has been in the communal bank group for 5 years and she likes it because, with the loans, she finances her business which allows her to get ahead. 

Gloria is a very hard-working woman who, to get her own resources, and with these help her mother with the household expenses, works selling all sorts of clothing.  She sells from door to door, she goes out three times each week and also sells from her house if one of her customers needs some clothing. She leaves her products on credit and collects each week. She has been working in this business for 10 years, with which she earns her income and entertains herself because she loves sales. 

This loan is to purchase pants, shirts, and children's clothing. Her dreams are to have good health and continue onward.

loans.use: to purchase pants, shirts and children's clothing.

loans.name: Gregoria Hungria

texts.es:
EL Grupo De Crédito Nuevos Horizontes se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Jipijapa, cantón conocido con el nombre de la sultana del café por los extensos cultivos de café el cual tiene un sabor incomparable, por su gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente. 
En este lugar vive la señora Gregoria, tiene 50 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene 4 hijos mayores de edad, tres de ellos aun viven con ella. El marido no trabaja.
Doña Gregoria es una mujer que le gusta trabajar para cubrir los gastos del hogar, ella se dedica al comercio, vende ropa y  zapatillas por catalogo, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta, ella sale dos o tres veces por semana a ofrecer sus productos y también vende en la casa, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada ocho días. Lleva más de 10 años que se dedica a esta actividad con la cual se gana sus ingresos que les ayuda a salir adelante.
Este crédito es para comprar ropa y zapatillas ya que tiene varios pedidos por entregar. Lleva 10 años en el Grupo de Crédito y le gusta porque con los créditos empezó su negocio. Sus sueños son darle lo mejor a su familia.
texts.en:
The Nuevos Horizontes communal bank group meets every two week sin Jipijapa canton, a canton known by the name of the Sultana of Coffee due to it extensive coffee crops which have an incomparable taste, for its cuisine, and for the warmth of the people. 

Gregoria lives in this place. She is 50 years old and is in a common-law marriage in which she has 4 adult children. Three still live with her. Her husband doesn't work. 

Gregoria is a woman who likes to work to cover the household expenses. She works in sales, selling clothing and shoes from a catalog. She sells from door to door, she goes out two or three times each week to offer her products and also sells from her house. She leaves the products on credit and collects each week. She has been doing this work for more than 10 years, with which she earns the income which helps her get ahead. 

This loan is to purchase clothing and shoes since she has a number of orders to fill. She has been in the communal bank group for 10 years and she likes it because, with the loans, she began her business. Her dreams are to give the best to her family.

loans.use: to purchase clothes and shoes.

loans.name: Uzma Bibi

texts.en:
Uzma Bibi is 43 years old and a responsible mother with two sons and a daughter. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Uzma Bibi’s husband is a rickshaw driver. For many days, his rickshaw has not been working properly and he has been unable to generate any income. Her husband wants to repair his rickshaw as soon as possible, but does not have enough money to cover the cost of repair. 

Uzma Bibi is requesting a loan from the Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband cover the cost of repairing his rickshaw.

loans.use: to help her husband cover the cost of repairing his rickshaw

loans.name: Divino Niño Jesus Group

texts.es:
El grupo está integrado por 20 mujeres, todas ellas muy sacrificadas y luchadoras, que quieren mejorar cada día para ir superando su pobreza por medio del programa de eliminación de la pobreza.
Cada una se destaca por la lucha y sacrifico, especialmente la Sra. Maria quien es vendedora de  frutas, también se debe destacar el trabajo de la fundación paraguaya, quien hace un seguimiento permanente de capacitaciones y verificaciones para que cada una vaya creciendo y mejorando. Ella agradece por la oportunidad que recibe para poder crecer y mejorar cada día.
La Sra. Maria solicita de este préstamo para la compra de verduras tales como locotes, tomates entre otros para poder seguir con sus ventas.
texts.en:
This group is made up of 20 woman, all of whom are very self-sacrificing and determined, who want to improve each day to overcome their poverty through the poverty elimination program.

Each one stands out for her struggle and sacrifice, especially Maria who sells fruits, and also the work of Fundación Paraguaya should stand out, which has an ongoing program of training and verification through which every one grows and improves. She is grateful for the opportunity that she is getting to be able to grow and improve each day. 

Maria asks for this loan to purchase vegetables such as green peppers, tomatoes, and others to be able to continue with her sales.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables such as green peppers, tomatoes and others to sell.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.pt:
Nasceu em Homoine Província de Inhambane tem 38 anos de idade, casado oficialmente pai de 4 filhos menores de idade apenas 3 frequentam a escola, responsabiliza-se pelos seus irmãos que vive em sua casa e outros em Inhambane.
Trabalha como técnico a mais de 12 anos onde ganha um valor que aplica nas despesas da usa casa. Com valor solicitado pretende dar continuidade a sua obra de construção de muro de residência adquirindo material de construção como: areia, cimento, varões e outros que forem necessários. Este é o seu 9º empréstimo na Hluvuku.
Futuramente pretende garantir o ensino dos seus filhos até ao nível superior e adquirir uma viatura.
texts.en: Carlos was born in Homoine, in Inhambane province.  He is 38 years old, legally married, and father of 4 young children.  Three of them attend school.  He also supports his siblings who live with him in his house, and others in Inhambane.  He has worked as a technician for more than 12 years and earns an amount that covers household expenses.  With the amount he is requesting he plans to continue construction of a wall around his residence, purchasing construction materials such as sand, cement, metal bars, and other things he needs.  This is his 9th loan with Hluvuku.  In the future he would like to pay for his children's higher education and purchase a car.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials like sand, cement, metal bars, etc.

loans.name: Armindo

texts.pt:
Nasceu em Inhambane província do mesmo nome tem 60 anos de idade, casado oficialmente pai de 4 filhos maiores de idade, responsabiliza-se pelos seus netos que vivem em sua casa.
É motorista, proprietário de capoeiras de criação de frangos a mais de 12 anos onde ganha um valor que aplica nas despesas da sua casa. Na tentativa de satisfazer os seus clientes solicita um empréstimo para aumentar o volume do seu negócio adquirindo pintos, reacção e vitaminas. Este é o seu 4º empréstimo na Hluvuku.
Futuramente pretende adquirir uma viatura de preferência um Mini Bus ou caixa aberta, para transportar passageiro ou transportar mercadoria respectivamente.
texts.en: Armindo was born in Inhambane, in the province of the same name.  He is 60 years old, married, and father of four adult children.  He also supports his grandchildren who live with him in his home.  He is a driver, and has owned a business raising chickens for more than 12 years.  He earns money to cover household expenses.  In an attempt to meet his customers' needs he is requesting a loan to grow his business by buying chickens, feed, and vitamins.  This is his fourth loan with Hluvuku..  In the future he hopes to acquire a vehicle, preferably a Mini Bux or pick up truck, to transport passengers or merchandise, respectively.

loans.use: to purchase chickens, feed, and vitamins.

loans.name: Juana Mercedes

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito San Andrés se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo y por la alegría de su gente.
En este lugar vive la señora Juana, tiene 58 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene 5 hijos mayores de edad e independientes. El marido es agricultor y trabaja de vaquero. 
Doña Juana es una mujer que le gusta trabajar y con su esfuerzo salir adelante, ella tiene una tienda de víveres en su casa, allí vende todo tipo de productos como arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes, legumbres, verduras, frutas,  artículos de bazar entre otras cosas, trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 20h00 y a veces hasta más tarde, su  marido le ayuda cuando él puede,  tiene 16 años con su tienda con la cual se gana lo suyo que les sirve para salir adelante ya que su marido no gana mucho en lo que realiza.
Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir mas su tienda, va a comprar arroz, azúcar, detergentes, artículos de bazar y otros productos de primera necesidad. Está en el Grupo De Crédito desde el inicio y le gusta por la atención médica gratuita que ofrece la fundación. Sus sueños son tener buena salud para ella y su familia.
texts.en:
The San Andrés communal bank group meets every two weeks in Picoaza parish in the city of Portoviejo. This is a place known for being a very commercial zone, for its San Pedro and San Pablo traditional festivals and for the cheerfulness of the people. 

Juana lives in this place. She is 58 years old and is in a common-law marriage in which she has 5 adult children who are independent. Her husband is a farmer and works as a cowboy. joy
Juana is a woman who likes to work and, with her efforts, get ahead. She has a grocery store in her house. There, she sells all sorts of products such as rice, sugar, oils, detergents, beans, vegetables, fruits, small items, among other things. She works every day from 6:00 am to 8:00 pm and sometimes later. Her husband helps her when he can. She has had the store for 16 years, with which she earns her own income which serves them to get ahead since her husband doesn't earn much in what he does. 

This loan will be used to stock her store more, she will purchase rice, sugar, detergent, small items, and other basic pantry products. She has been in the communal bank group since the beginning and she likes it for the free medical care that the foundation offers. Her dreams are to have good health for herself and her family.

loans.use: to purchase rice, sugar, detergent, small items, and basic pantry products.

loans.name: Victor

texts.en:
Victor is a man who describes himself as focused. He operates a dairy farm where he sells milk. Victor’s business is located in a good area and his primary customers are individuals. He successfully repaid his previous loan.

Victor is requesting a 40,000 KES loan to buy a dairy cow. This will be his second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.  Victor hopes that he will be successful in the future.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is a married woman who describes herself as a risk taker. For the past five years, she has operated a dairy farm where she sells milk. Susan’s business is located in a good area and her primary customers are individuals. 

Susan is requesting a 30,000 KES loan to buy inputs for her farm. This will be her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Susan hopes that she will be successfully in the future.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is a married woman with three children. She describes herself as determined. Joyce operates a business where she sells fruits and vegetables. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are of all types. Joyce’s biggest business challenge is insufficient working capital. 

Joyce is requesting a 70,000 KES loan to buy more stock of fruits and vegetables. This will be her third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Joyce has successfully repaid her previous loans.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is a married woman with four children. She describes herself as honest. For the past 12 years, Christine has operated a retail business where she sells clothes. Her business is located in an area with potential. Christine states that her biggest business challenge is the lack of working capital. 

Christine is requesting a 20,000 KES loan to buy more stock of clothing. This will be her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy clothing

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Lilia works hard to support her family. She has a furniture making business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from farming rice. Lilia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 10 loans from NWTF. She successfully repaid her previous loans and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Lilia is requesting a 9,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy lumber and other materials needed for her furniture making business. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy lumber and other materials needed for her business

loans.name: Las Trabajadoras Del Sector Los Lec Group

texts.es:
Alba es una mujer admirable que lucha todos los días por tener el pan de cada día, es soltera tiene 50 años de edad, vive sola en una comunidad de Sololá.
Alba (es la  señora de en medio la de suéter negro) es una mujer que día con día busca la manera de salir adelante, ella desde hace 7 años se dedica a la compra y venta de productos de catálogo, esta actividad para ella es bastante rentable y Alba le gusta esta actividad porque se relaciona con todas las personas  de su comunidad, ella ahora quiere hacer de su pequeño negocio algo más grande pero para hacerlo necesita un gran capital, capital con la que ella no cuenta en este momento, pero ella ha decidido juntar a un grupo de señoras con la misma iniciativa para solicitar un préstamo que lo utilizara para la compra y venta de productos de catálogo.
El sueño de Alba es poder conseguir este préstamo para poder hacer de su negocio algo mas grande y  que mejore sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Alba is an admirable woman who struggles every day to have her daily bread. She is single, 50 years old, and lives alone in the community of Sololá. 

Alba (she is the woman in the middle, with the black sweater) is a woman who day by day looks for a way to get ahead. For the past 7 years she has worked buying and selling catalog products. The work is fairly profitable for her and Alba likes it because she interacts with all the people in her community. Now she wants to make her small business somewhat bigger but to do this, she needs a lot of capital, and capital is what she doesn't have at the moment, but she has decided to join a group of woman with the same initiative to ask for a loan which will be used to purchase and sell catalog products. 

Alba's dream is to be able to get this loan to be able to make her business bigger and have more income.

loans.use: to purchase and sell catalog products.

loans.name: Ludivina

texts.en:
Ludivina is 58 years old and married with two children. For the past seven years, she has run a general store in the Philippines.  Ludivina works very hard to provide for her family.

Ludivina is requesting a 29,000 PHP loan to buy items to sell such as milk, canned goods, groceries, and other products. In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy milk, canned goods, groceries, and other products

loans.name: Arshad Bibi

texts.en:
Arshad Bibi is a 50-year-old lady and a responsible mother of one son and two daughters. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. 

Her husband has been running his own catering business for past 20 years. Arshad Bibi's husband needs to purchase different types of merchandise such as crockery, wood tables, chairs and tents, etc. for his business. But due to insufficient financial means, he is unable to purchase this merchandise. 

To fulfill the need of her husband, Arshad Bibi has applied for a Kiva loan from BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan she will help her husband to buy these items for his business. That will be good for him to earn more income and this income will support him to fulfill his family's needs.

Arshad Bibi is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase different types of merchandise such as crockery, wood tables, chairs and tents, etc. for her husband's business.

loans.name: Zoreen Bibi

texts.en:
Zoreen Bibi is a responsible mother of three children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been providing transport facilities by driving a taxi for 24 years. He is responsible to fulfill the needs of the entire family. 

Her husband needs to make maintenance on his taxi because the current condition of his taxi is not good. It requires more maintenance on a daily basis. Due to insufficient financial means, he is unable to make maintenance of his taxi. Therefore Zoreen Bibi has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

With the help of this loan, Zoreen Bibi's husband can afford the maintenance cost easily and provide better transport facilities to earn a profitable income. 

Zoreen Bibi also plans to make savings with the profit amount of her husband's income to meet her family's needs in future.

Zoreen Bibi is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to repair her husband's taxi.

loans.name: Kaneez Fatima

texts.en:
Kaneez Fatima is a 57-year-old woman and a mother of six children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. 

Her husband is vegetable seller by profession. He sells vegetables such as potato, carrot, onion, lady fingers, etc. He is solely responsible to feed the entire family and manage the household.

Kaneez Fatima's husband needs to purchase different types of vegetables for reselling so that he can increase the size of his business, improve his sales growth and earn maximum profit. But due to his unfavorable financial position, he is not in a condition to purchase vegetables for his business.

Therefore Kaneez Fatima has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan so that she can help her husband to purchase the above items for his business.
. 
She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables for her husband's business.

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en:
Naseem is a 51-year-old woman residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a mother of eight children. Her husband has been running a general store for past 12 years. He is solely responsible to fulfill the needs of his entire family. 

Naseem's husband wants to purchase different kinds of commodities such as rice, sugar, tea bags, milk and other consumer items for his business purpose. But due to financial constraints he is not in a suitable position to buy all these products for reselling. Therefore Naseem has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her husband to buy all these commodities and also help him to earn maximum profitable income to manage his household and business.
 
Naseem is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase groceries for her husband's business.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.pt:
Nasceu na Província de Maputo tem 57 anos de idade, solteira mãe de 7 filhos maiores de idade, todos frequentam a escola, responsabiliza-se pela sua tia que vive em sua casa.
É negociante a mais de 7 anos de venda de potes no mercado informal vulgo shoprit, onde ganha um valor que aplica nas despesas da sua casa.Solicita um empréstimo para aumentar o volume do seu negócio adquirindo potes. Este é o seu 7º empréstimo na Hluvuku.
Futuramente pretende iniciar um negócio de criação de frangos.
texts.en: Julieta was born in the Maputo province.  She is 57 years old and a single mother of 7 adult children, all of whom attend school. She also supports an aunt who lives with her.  She has had a retail business for more than 7 years selling containers in the informal market known as shoprite, where she earns money to cover household expenses. She is requesting a loan to grow her business by purchasing more containers.  This is her 7th loan with Hluvuku.  In the future she plans to start a business raising chickens.

loans.use: to buy containers.

loans.name: Joao

texts.pt:
Nasceu em Bilene Província de Gaza tem 52 anos de idade, vive maritalmente pai de 5 filhos apenas 2 são maiores de idade e 3 frequentam a escola, não responsabiliza-se por ninguém.
É proprietário de um estabelecimento comercial a mais de 2 anos onde ganha um valor que aplica nas despesas da sua casa. Na tentativa de satisfazer os seus clientes solicita um empréstimo para aumentar o volume do seu negócio adquirindo mercadoria como: arroz, feijão, amendoim e outra que for necessária. Este é o seu 1º empréstimo na Hluvuku.
Futuramente pretende abrir um estaleiro de venda de material de construção
texts.en: Joao was born in Bilene, in the Gaza province.  He is 52 yeas old, lives with his common law wife, and has 5 children, 2 of whom are adults and 3 who are in school.  He does not support anyone else.  He has owned a retail business for more than 2 years where he earns money to cover household expenses.  In order to meet his customers' needs, he is requesting a loan to grow his business by acquiring merchandise such as rice, beans, peanuts, etc.  This is his first loan with Hluvuku.  In the future he plans to open a business selling construction materials.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise such as rice, beans, peanuts, etc.

loans.name: Raul

texts.pt:
Nasceu em Inhambane tem 43 anos, vive maritalmente pai de 4 filhos menores de idade, apenas 3 frequentam a escola, responsabiliza-se pelos seus sobrinhos que vivem em sua casa.
É proprietário de um estabelecimento comercial a mais de 10 anos onde ganha um valor que aplica nas despesas da sua casa. Solicita o empréstimo para aumentar o volume do seu negócio adquirindo mercadoria como: arroz, feijão, sabão e outra mercadoria que for necessária. Este é o seu 4º empréstimo na Hluvuku.
Futuramente pretende expandir o seu negocio, garantir o ensino dos seus filhos até ao nível superior e melhorar e sua obra de residência.
texts.en: Raul was born in Inhambane.  He is 43 years old, and lives with his wife and 4 young children, 3 of whom attend school. He also supports his nephews who live with him.  He has owned a retail business for more than 10 years where he earns an amount that covers household expenses. He is requesting a loan to grow his business by purchasing merchandise such as rice, beans, soap and other items he needs.  This is his 4th loan with Hluvuku.  In the future he plans to expand his business, pay for his children's higher education and make improvements to his home.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise such as rice, beans,  soap, and other items as needed.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Mauricio

texts.es: Mauricio de 52 años de edad vive en casa propia con su compañera de vida y sus dos hijos, el posee desde hace 20 años una tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia, con las ventas que realiza logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de más sopas, huevos, granos básicos, refrescos, golosinas, pan dulce, etc. y así poder tener mejores ingresos para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Mauricio is 52 years old. He lives in his own home with his life's companion and their two children. He has had a store in his residence for 20 years. With the sales, he is able to pay for some of his household expenses. He is asking for a loan to buy more soups, eggs, basic grains, beverages, snacks, sweet bread, etc. This way, he can have better income to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more soups, eggs, basic grains, beverages, snacks, sweet bread, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy clothing, bags, and shoes

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a married man with four children. He describes himself as honest. For the past seven years, John has operated a butcher shop. His business is located in a viable location and his primary customers are locals. John’s biggest business challenge is insufficient working capital. 

John is requesting an 80,000 KES loan to buy more stock of meat. This will be his third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. John successfully repaid his previous loans. He will use the anticipated profit from his loan to pay school fees for his children. John’s business goal is to be successful within five years.

loans.use: buy meat to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy a larger stock of fruit for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy a larger stock of clothes, shoes and handbags for resale.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is a married woman. She has three children. She describes herself as a determined person. She operates a retail business, where she sells flour, sugar, bread and other items. She has been engaged in this business for two years. Her business is located in a good area, and her customers are of all types. She describes her biggest business challenge as insufficient working capital. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy a larger stock of sugar, bread, flour and other items. Her business goal is to expand within five years. This is her first loan from SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy a larger stock of sugar, bread, flour and other items for resale.

loans.name: Shazeela Bibi

texts.en:
Shazeela Bibi is 66 years old and an active borrower of Kiva and BRAC Pakistan. She is a mother of five children and her husband runs an auto spare parts shop. He has been running his business for 30 years. 

Shazeela Bibi's husband wants to expand the size of his business so that he can fulfill the demands of his daily customers and provide better reselling services of auto spare parts, but due to financial problems, he is not in a position to bear these expenses.

Therefore, Shazeela Bibi has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her husband to afford all relevant expenses in the expansion of his business. 

For this financial assistance Shazeela Bibi is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to enable her husband to expand his spare parts business.

loans.name: Shabeena

texts.en:
Shabeena is a 37-year-old woman. Some years ago, she decided to support her family by stitching ladies' suits at her home for the people of her town, as her father's income was barely enough to meet their day-to-day expenses. Shabeena is popularly known in her area for providing high-quality stitching services for ladies' suits.

Due to a shortage of material, she is facing difficulty in meeting daily expenses related to her business. Therefore, she has requested a loan to purchase stitching materials such as threads of different colors, laces, zippers, and buttons. Shabeena hopes that her stitching business will be very successful and will generate a healthy income for her family.

Thank you so much for Kiva’s partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase stitching materials such as threads of different colors, laces, zippers, and buttons.

loans.name: Cipriana

texts.en: Cipriana is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Cipriana is 60 years old. She has a rice farming business in the Philippines. Cipriana applied for a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies. Cipriana has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, Cipriana would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Amna

texts.en:
Amna is a happily married woman. Some years ago, she decided to support her family by starting a beauty parlor business at her home, since her husband's income was barely enough to meet their day-to-day expenses.

Amna is popularly known in her area for her skills as a beautician. However, due to a shortage of beauty products, she is facing difficulty in delivering services to her clients. Therefore, she has requested a loan for this purpose. 

With the requested loan, she wants to purchase creams, face wash, etc.
.
Amna is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase items for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en: Evelyn is 60 years old, married, and has six children, one of whom is in school. She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Evelyn is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies. Evelyn has been growing rice for twenty years, and she earns additional income from raising livestock. She works tirelessly to attain her dream of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Tahira Bibi

texts.en:
Tahira Bibi is a 41-year-old active borrower of BRAC Pakistan. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a mother of two sons and one daughter. One of her sons has been doing a scrap-recycling business; the other is doing his own sound system business.

Tahira Bibi's son needs to buy scrap material in bulk to recycle it, but due to some financial constraints, he is not in a suitable position to buy the scrape in bulk. Therefore, Tahira Bibi has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. 

This loan amount will enable her son to purchase the scrap material in bulk so that he can easily adopt the recycling procedure and earn profitable income from his business.

Tahira Bibi is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan for this financial assistance.

loans.use: to enable her son to buy scrap material in bulk to recycle it.

loans.name: Mangorano Shg Group

texts.en:
Paul is a member of the Mangorano Self Help Group, which joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in 2014 to benefit from trainings such as enterprise development and financial management. He is 54 years old, married, and blessed with two children who attend school. Paul works as a vegetable farmer and he also sells fish. In this photo, he is raising his hand. 

Paul is requesting a loan through Kiva to add more stock of fish to help boost his supply. His loan will ensure that he meets rising demand and earns more profits to provide for his family’s needs. Paul is grateful to Kiva lenders for the great help.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell

loans.name: María Natividad

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito San Andrés se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo y por la alegría de su gente.
En este lugar vive la señora María, tiene 48 años de edad, es soltera, no tiene hijos propios pero tiene un hijo de crianza que es lo que ella mas quiere, el cual ya tiene 17 años y estudia en colegio. 
Doña María una mujer muy trabajadora que le gusta trabajar para salir adelante y con sus ingresos sacar adelante a su hijo, ella tiene en su casa  una pequeña tienda de víveres, allí vende productos de primera necesidad, ella también vende productos Avon  (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas) y productos naturales de la marca Garden, estas ventas las realiza en su tienda, pero en su mayoría las entrega puerta a puerta, de esta forma ella día a día lucha por salir adelante y se le hace más fácil con la ayuda de los créditos. 
Este crédito es para comprar víveres, cosméticos y productos naturales. Esta desde el inicio en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque con ayuda de los créditos sale adelante. Sus sueños son seguir aumentado su negocio.
texts.en:
The San Andrés Credit Group meets every two weeks in the Picoaza parish of the city of Portoviejo. It is known as a very commercial area and for its traditional festivals of San Pedro and San Pablo, as well as for the cheerfulness of its people. 

This is where María lives. She is 48 years old, single and has no children of her own, but she does have a son she has raised and he is what she loves the most. He is already 17 years old and he is in school.  
 
María is a very hardworking woman who likes to work to get ahead and with her income, get her son ahead. She has a house and a small grocery store.  She sells staple products there. She also sells Avon products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfume, and women's accessories) and Garden natural products. She sells from her store, but mostly she delivers door to door. In this way, she fights day to day to get ahead, and the loans make it easier for her.    

This loan is to buy groceries, cosmetics, and natural products. She has been in the credit group from the beginning and she likes it because the loans help her get ahead. Her dream is to keep expanding her business.

loans.use: to buy groceries, cosmetics and natural products.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is a married man. He has one child. He describes himself to be strong and determined. He operates a transport business where he transports customers using his motorcycle. He has been involved in this business for four years. His business is located in a good area, and his primary customers are the general public. He describes his biggest business challenge to be high cost of fuel. 

He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy spare parts for his motorcycle. 

His business goal is to he will own two more motorcycles within five years. He hopes that in the future he will be wealthy. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for his motorcycle

loans.name: Pamela

texts.en:
Pamela is a Kiva borrower. She describes herself to be kind and honest. She operates a retail business where she sells motor vehicle and motorcycle spare parts and also runs an M-pesa (mobile money transfer) business. She has been involved in this business for two years. Her business is located in a viable location, and her primary customers are the general public. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient working capital. 

She will use the 50,000 KES loan to buy more stock of motor vehicle and motorcycle spare parts. Her business goal is to expand and have a larger auto spare parts shop within five years. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of motor vehicle and motorcycle spare parts

loans.name: Suiunbek

texts.ru: Суйунбек 57 лет, женат, есть 4 детей. У Суйунбека высшее образование. В качестве основного источника дохода для своей семьи, он занимается животноводством и полеводством. Благодаря упорному труду Суйунбека, в его хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 24 коровы, 35 овец, 2 лошади, а также земельный надел мерою 2,0 ГА, где он выращивает кукурузу и пшеницу для реализации. Ежемесячный доход Суйунбека составляет 24,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития и расширения бизнеса, он обратился в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 30,000 сомов (KGS) на покупку 2 бычков для откорма и реализации. Доходы от ведения бизнеса, Суйунбек будет направлять на дальнейшее его развитие, также он планирует начать строительство дома для сына.
texts.en:
Suiunbek is 57 years old, married, and has four children. Suiunbek has higher education. As a main source of income for his family, he works with livestock breeding and field crop cultivation. 

Thanks to Suiunbek's persistent work, his farm currently has 24 cows, 35 sheep and two horses, and also a plot of land of 2.0 hectares, where he grows sweet corn and wheat for selling. Suiunbek's monthly income is 24,000 som (KGS).

With an aim to further develop and expand his business, he turned to the bank "Bai Tushum" for a loan in the amount of 30,000 som (KGS) to purchase two steers for fattening and reselling. Suiunbek will direct the income from his business in further developing it. He also plans to start building a house for his son.

loans.use: to buy two steers for fattening up and reselling

loans.name: Gulsada

texts.ru: Гулсада, 39 лет, замужем, мать 3 детей. У нее среднее образование. На протяжении 17 лет она занимается животноводством и полеводством. На сегодняшний день в хозяйстве Гулсады есть 2 лошади, 2 коровы, 30 овец, также 2,0 Га поливной земли, где Гулсада выращивает фасоль. Ее ежемесячный совокупный доход составляет около 10,000 сом (KGS). Гулсада хочет и дальше развивать свой бизнес, поэтому она обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 70,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коровы и 5 овец. Доходы от кредита Гулсада планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение своего хозяйства и хочет накопить средства на образование ее детей.
texts.en:
Gulsada is 39 years old, married and the mother of three children. She has secondary education. For a period of 17 years, she has worked with livestock breeding and field crop cultivation. Currently Gulsada has two horses, two cows and 30 sheep on her farm, and also 2.0 hectares of irrigated land, where she grows haricots. Her total monthly income is around 10,000 som (KGS). 

Gulsada would like to further develop her busienss, and therefore she turned to the bank "Bai Tushum" for a loan in the amount of 70,000 som (KGS) to purchase a cow and five sheep. Gulsada plans to invest the income from the loan in further improving her business and would like to save money for the education of her children.

loans.use: to purchase a cow and five sheep in order to increase her livestock headcount

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock of charcoal

loans.name: Meshack

texts.en:
Meshack is a married man. He has 10 children. He describes himself to be honest. He operates a retail business where he sells shoes, clothes and other items. He has been involved in this business for four years. His business is located in an area fit for the business, and his primary customers are the general public. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient working capital. 

He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes and shoes. 

He hopes that in the future he will be successful. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes and shoes

loans.name: Gadadhar

texts.en:
Gadadhar is 29 years old. He is a differently abled man who lives with his father, mother and siblings in Balangir district, Odisha. He is engaged in vegetable cultivation and wants to start a grocery shop. He is a very hardworking and responsible man. His sibling are in school. He is the oldest within his siblings.

Gadadhar has requested a loan of 20,000 INR to purchase grocery items in bulk to start a small grocery shop. He is thankful to Kiva and its lenders for this support.

loans.use: to start a grocery shop by purchasing grocery items in bulk

loans.name: G.s. La Laguna#3 Group

texts.es: William, tiene 28 años de edad, esta soltero, vive con sus padres en una comunidad de Cofradía, municipio de San Pedro Sula, Cortes. El siempre ha trabajado con su padre en la agricultura. Lleva 8 años de tener sus propios cultivos de café, hortalizas( rábano, culantro fino y zanahoria, ), maíz y frijoles. Esta producción la vende a intermediarios de la zona o en el mercado local. Ha solicitado el quinto ciclo de prestamo en la institución, el cual es por 20,000 lempiras y en forma grupal, con este prestamo va comprar abonos y pago de mano de obra para fertilizar y darle mantenimiento de limpieza a sus cultivos y poder sacar mejor producción.  Su sueño es lograr la compra de un vehículo para su negocio.  El grupo al que pertenece se llama La Laguna#3, integrado por 6 miembros que se dedican a la agricultura y viven en la misma comunidad. El prestamo grupal es por 91,000 lempiras que lo utilizaran para abonar y limpieza de sus cultivos. En la foto se identifica a la izquierda esta al frente esta Jose, sigue Maria y santos de camisa negra a la derecha, y atrás a la izquierda esta William, Arnold  y David camisa a cuadros azul y blanco a la derecha.
texts.en:
William, 28, is single and lives with his parents in Cofradía, San Pedro Sula, which is in the department of Cortes. He has always worked with his father in agriculture. He has had his own crops for 8 years now, growing coffee, vegetables (radish, coriander and carrot), corn and beans. He sells his produce through local retailers or in the local market. 

William has requested his fifth loan cycle with this partner; it is for 20,000 lempiras and takes the form of a group loan. With this loan he will buy ferlitizers and pay for manual labour to fertilize and help maintain and clean his crops in order to improve the production. 

William’s dream is to manage to buy a vehicle for his business. He belongs to the group called La Laguna #3 which comprises 6 members who all make a living in agriculture and live in the same community. The group loan is for 91,000 lempiras, which they will use to fertilize and clean their crops.

In the photo, the front row from left to right is Jose, Maria and Santos who is wearing a black shirt. William is on the left in the back row, followed by Arnold and then David who is wearing a blue and white checked shirt.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pay for the manual labour needed to fertilize, maintain and clean his crops.

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado mujeres emprendedoras está en su ciclo número 9 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan las unas a las otras por salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde todas han mejorado sus condiciones de vida por medio de su esfuerzo.
La Sra. Rosineide, es una de las integrantes del grupo, quien viene esforzándose cada día para poder crecer y ayudar a su familia por medio de los ingresos que tiene. Ella se dedica al humilde trabajo de venta de remedios naturales, que hace de manera ambulante, comenta que es muy sacrificado, pero que lo hace para poder ayudar a quienes quiere.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar remedios naturales para la venta, ya que por medio de ello puede seguir con su trabajo para que cada día vaya creciendo.
texts.en:
The group called Mujeres Emprendedoras is in its ninth loan cycle with the women's bank program, in which they all work and help each other mutually to get ahead.  They're completing the "Poverty Stoplight" survey, with which all of them have improved their living conditions through their efforts.

Rosineide is one of the members of the group.  She keeps working hard every day so she can grow and help her family with her income.  She earns a living in the modest job of natural remedies sales, which she does on foot.  She said it's very demanding work, but she does it to be able to help the people she loves.

She's requesting this loan to buy natural remedies to sell so she'll be able to keep on working and growing every day.

loans.use: to buy natural remedies to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a variety of products.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en:
Being a responsible housewife, Marcelina has been engaged in a hog-raising business to supplement her husband's income. She is 42 years old and has three children attending school. Due to the high cost of commodities and school fees, she aims to improve her business and increase her income to sustain the necessities of her family. 

Having insufficient capital, she would like to avail herself of an additional 15,000 PHP to buy the needed hog feeds, vitamins and vaccines for the proper growth of her hogs. Having this financial assistance, Marcelina believes that someday, she will further improve the business.

loans.use: to buy hog feeds, vitamins and vaccines for her hogs

loans.name: Mountakha

texts.fr:
Mountakha est un jeune qui évolue dans le domaine du commerce il y a maintenant 5 ans. Il est marié et père de famille. Il bénéficie pour la seconde fois d’un crédit à l’IMCEC pour augmenter son fond de commerce. Son commerce qui consiste à vendre des œufs. Il travaille avec les restaurants, les boutiques, les vendeuses de petit déjeuner. Chaque matin à partir de 7h, Mountakha commence la livraison chez ses clients, il ne repassera que le lendemain ou le surlendemain pour récupérer son argent, leur donnant le temps de vendre aussi la marchandise.
Grâce aux crédits, il arrive à mettre de l’argent de coté car il nourrit un grand projet qui est de disposer d’un grand dépôt et d’acquérir aussi un véhicule pour pouvoir faciliter la livraison dans des quartiers environnants.
texts.en: Mountakha is a young man who has been building up a trading activity for five years now. He is married and a father. He is getting a second loan from IMCEC in order to expand his business, selling eggs. He works with restaurants, shops and women who sell breakfasts. Every morning at 7 o'clock, Mountakha begins delivering to his customers and he collects his money either the following day or the day after that, giving his customers the time to sell on their eggs. Thanks to the loans he gets, he manages to put money aside for the big plan he has to have a large warehouse, as well as a vehicle to make his deliveries more easily in the surrounding districts.

loans.use: to buy eggs for resale in shops, restaurants,...

loans.name: Mejumaa

texts.en:
Mejumaa is a Kiva borrower. She has seven children. She describes herself to be reliable. She operates a retail business where she sells cashew nuts. She has been involved in this business for seven years. Her business is located in the market area, and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the inflation of prices. 

She will use the 30,000 KES loan to buy more stock of cashew nuts. She hopes that in the future, she will live a comfortable life. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of cashew nuts

loans.name: Sammy

texts.en:
Sammy is a married man. He has three children. He describes himself to be faithful. He operates a restaurant. He has been involved in this business for 10 years. His business is located in an area with potential. He describes his biggest business challenge to be price fluctuations. 

He will use the 30,000 KES (Kenyan shillings) loan to buy more stock of ingredients for preparing food. He hopes that, in the future, he will expand his business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of ingredients for preparing food

loans.name: Glecer

texts.en:
Glecer is 38 years old and married with four children. Three of her children are in school.

Glecer is in the agricultural business, farming vegetables in the Philippines. Glecer requested a 9,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her vegetable farm.

Glecer has been farming vegetables for 16 years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF, and more recently, from Kiva to sustain it.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream to save enough money so she continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her vegetable farm.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to enhance her husband's poshish (vehicle seat covers) work

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is 60 years old and married with five children. Lolita works very hard to provide for them.

Lolita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 14,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like eggs, canned goods, beverages, groceries, etc.

Lolita has been in this business for seven years now. 

In the future, Lolita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like eggs, canned goods, beverages, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Mahabat

texts.ru: Махабат, 27 лет, замужем. Образование-высшее, занимается полеводством и животноводством. Благодаря упорному труду и терпеливому характеру Махабат, на сегодняшний день она имеет хорошее хозяйство: 4 коровы и 90 овец. Ежемесячная прибыль Махабат составляет 25,600 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, она обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 22 овец. Доходы от кредита Махабат планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение количества скота, что позволит ей закончить строительство дома и кошары.
texts.en:
Mahabat is 27 years old and married. She has higher education and works with field crop cultivation and livestock breeding. Thanks to Mahabat's persistent work and patient character, she currently has a great farm: Four cows and 90 sheep. Mahabat's monthly income is 25,600 com (KGS). 

With an aim to further develop her business, she turned to the bank "Bai Tushum" for a loan in the amount of 100,000 som (KGS) to purchase 22 sheep. Mahabat plans to invest the income from the loan in further increasing the number of livestock, which will allow her to complete the building of her house and barn.

loans.use: to purchase 22 sheep in order to grow her business

loans.name: Telegei

texts.ru: Телегей, 60 лет, вдова, есть сын, он женат, есть ребенок. У Телегей- высшее образование, она на пенсии, в качестве дополнительного дохода для своей семьи, она занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав в 1990 году. Благодаря упорному труду Телегей, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 3 коровы, а также имеет земельный надел размером 1,18 ГА, на котором Телегей пшеницу под внутрихозяйственное потребление и реализацию. Ежемесячный доход Телегей до 20,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку удобрений для обработки почвы. Телегей планирует направлять доход от кредита в дальнейшее развитие ее бизнеса, а также вкладывать в улучшение жилищных условий.
texts.en:
Telegei is 60 years old and a widow. She has a son who is married and has a child. Telegei has higher education. She is on a pension. As an additional income for her family, she works with livestock breeding and field crop cultivation, after having started with this in 1990. 

Thanks to Telegei's persistent work, her farm currently has three cows and she also has a plot of land of 1.18 hectares, on which she grows wheat for own use and for selling. Telegei's monthly income is up to 20,000 som (KGS).

With an aim to further develop her farm, she turned to the bank "Bai Tushum" for a loan in the amount of 50,000 som (KGS) to purchase fertilizers to treat the soil. Telegei plans to use the income from the loan in further developing her business, and also to use the money for improving their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers for land cultivation in order to grow organic products

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
Elma is 40 years old, married and has three children, two of whom are studying. Her spouse is a farmer while she is a vegetable vendor and a hog raiser.

She would like to improve her profits from her businesses so she needs additional capital of PHP 14,000 to buy feed and vaccines for her hogs' sustenance and to buy vegetables to sell. 

She hopes to ensure good sales and profits so she will be able to sustain her children's education needs.

loans.use: to buy feed and vaccines for hog sustenance and to buy vegetables to sell

loans.name: Ana Auxiliadora

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito San Andrés se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo y por la alegría de su gente.
En este lugar vive la señora Ana, tiene 25 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos de 7 y 3 años de edad, el mayor estudia en escuela. El marido es conserje.
Doña Ana es una mujer muy trabajadora que además de dedicarse al hogar también se dedica al comercio, vende ropa y su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, trabaja casi todos los días, ella aprovecha las mañanas para salir a realizar sus recorridos ya que uno de sus hijos esta en escuela y solo tiene que cargar al más pequeño, ella  deja a crédito y cobra por semana. Lleva más de 5 años dedicada a esta actividad con la cual se gana lo suyo y que les sirve para gastos del hogar.
Este crédito es para comprar pantalones, camisas y ropa de temporada playera. Lleva 5 años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que le ha brindado la institución. Sus sueños son darles lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The San Andrés Credit Group meets every fifteen days in the parish of Picoaza in the city of Portoviejo.  It’s a place known for being a very commercial zone, for its traditional Saint Peter and Saint Paul festivals, and for the joyfulness of its people.

Ana lives here. She is 25 years old, and she maintains a common-law-marriage from which she has two children, ages seven and three.  The oldest is studying in school.  Her husband is a custodian. 

Ana is a very hard-working woman who works selling clothing in addition to taking care of her home. She sells door-to-door, working almost every day.  She takes advantage of the mornings to go out to make her rounds, as one of her children is in school and she only has to carry the little one. She delivers on credit and collects weekly.  She has been doing this work for more than five years, and with it she earns her own income, which helps with the household expenses.

This loan is to purchase pants, shirts, and seasonal beach clothing. She has been in the credit group for five years, and she likes it because of the help that the institution has given her.  Her dream is to give the best to her children.

loans.use: to purchase pants, shirts, and seasonal beach clothing.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian is a  Kiva borrower. She has three children. She describes herself to be God-fearing. 

She operates a retail business where she sells clothes and handbags. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located in a good area, and her primary customers are the general public. She describes her biggest business challenge to be price fluctuations. 

She will use the 50,000 KES loan to buy more stock of clothes and handbags. She hopes that, in the future, she will be a market leader. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. She will use the anticipated profits to expand the business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes and handbags

loans.name: Benta

texts.en:
Benta is a Kiva borrower. She describes herself to be kind. She operates a retail business where she sells sugar, cooking oil, soap and other items. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in a marketable place, and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be price fluctuations. 

She will use the 50,000 KES loan to buy more stock of sugar, bread, cooking fat, soap and other items. She hopes that, in the future, she will generate wealth and educate her children. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of sugar, bread, cooking fat, soap and other items

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
La dame qui est accouplée avec le bélier en main sur la photo est Chouané.
Chouané est une femme malienne, âgée de 30 ans, ménagère, mariée et mère de 4 enfants dont  1 est scolarisé, son premier enfant est âgé de 13 ans et le dernier pour le moment est âgé de 2 ans. 
Chouané n’a pas été à l’école, elle fait l’élevage des ovins  dans leur village. Elle emprunte avec le RMCR pour acheter des moutons pour élever en vue de les revendre.  elle a 4 ans d’expérience. Elle achète ces moutons au marché de leur village, puis elle les engraisse. Au bout d’un temps  elle  les  revend dans le même marché. Par tête après la vente, le bénéfice prévisionnel pourrait valoir à  25 000fCFA. Les rêves et les espoirs pour l’avenir sont d’acheter des animaux et les matériaux pour cultiver son champ. Avec le profit  elle améliore les conditions de vie de mes enfants  ( la santé, les frais scolaires). Cette activité me plait parce que nous trouvons nos bénéfices dans ça. L’obstacle fatiguant dans cette activité est souvent la maladie des moutons.
texts.en:
The woman who is holding on to the ram in the photo is Chouané. She is a woman from Mali who is 30 years old, a housewife, married and mother to four children, one of whom is at school; her eldest child is 13 years old and the youngest two. 

Chouané did not go to school and she raises sheep in their village. She is borrowing from RMCR to buy sheep for raising with a view to reselling them. She has four years' experience in this field. She buys sheep at the market in their village then fattens them up. In due course she resells them at the same market. The estimated profit she makes per head after selling the sheep is 25,000FCFA. Her dreams and hopes for the future are to buy animals and materials to farm her field. With the profit she makes she can improve her children's living conditions (health, school fees). She likes this activity because it generates profit. The inconvenience is that the sheep are often ill.

loans.use: to buy sheep for raising and then selling.

loans.name: Benkola Group

texts.fr:
L’ homme qui a le bouc en main parmi les femmes est Gouantoufa
Gouantoufa  est Malien, âgé de 34 ans, marié, sa  femme est ménagère, et père de 3 enfants  âgé de 1 à 8 an non scolarisés d’abord. Il a ait l’école coranique. 
Il est emboucheur des ovins. Il exerce cette activité il ya 4 ans de cela. Il achète des moutons maigres  pour les engraissés Pius il les revend. Il fait recourt au RMCR pour prendre de l’argent afin d’acheter beaucoup de tètes de moutons. Il s’approvisionne au  marché local et fait ses  ventes au comptant  et à crédit au marché public.  Le profit généré lui permet de prendre les charges de ses enfants en soins médicaux, en  nourriture suffisante et en habillements. Son ambition est avoir plus de profit dans cette activité afin de bien s’occuper de sa famille.
texts.en:
The man among the women, his hand on the goat, is Gouantoufa. Gouantoufa is a thirty-four year-old Malian. He is married to a housewife and the father of three children aged one to eight, who do not go to school yet. He went to Koranic school. 

He fattens sheep. He started this business four years ago. He purchases lean sheep to fatten. Then he resells them. He turns to RMCR to borrow money to purchase many heads of sheep. He procures them at the local market and sells them, cash or credit, at the public market. 

The profit he makes allows him to pay his children’s medical expenses, to feed them sufficiently, and to clothe them. His ambition is to make greater profits in this business to take good care of his family.

loans.use: to buy lean sheep to fatten and resell.

loans.name: Amelia

texts.en:
Amelia is a married woman with eight children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Amelia is 42 years old and has four children who are in school.

Amelia has a buy and sell condiments business in the Philippines. Amelia requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy condiments to sell. Amelia has been in this business for 20 years.

In the future, Amelia would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy condiments to sell

loans.name: Jiguiya Group

texts.fr:
Bina est l’homme qui a levé la  main sur la photo. Il est âge  de 30 ans,  Malien, marié et père de 3 enfants qui n’ont pas l’âge d’aller à l’école ; Sa femme est ménagère et s’occupe convenablement de ses enfants.
 Bina lit et écrit en langue national ; C’est ainsi qu’il gère plus facilement ses activités de stockage d’arachides.
Il prend de  l’argent au  R.M.C.R pour  acheter beaucoup de sacs  de graines d’arachide pour stocker. Il  revend son stock en  début de l’hivernage quand les prix des céréales sont à la hausse. Il a 6 ans d’expérience et s’en sort bien car il gagne assez de profit qui lui sert beaucoup dans la famille. Cette année il envisage un bénéfice prévisionnel de 25 000 FCFA  par mois. Bina achète ses produits sur place avec les cultivateurs  de son village et les achemines sur le marché local  à un nombre de kilomètres pour les revendre en gros au commerçant venu des villes. Il trouve que le stockage est très rentable et compte le développé à hauteur de souhait. Le but de ses efforts est d’être un père responsable pour ses enfants en leur offrant tous ceux qu’il faut pour leur bien-être ( santé, éducation,  habillement et nourriture). Bina affirme ne pas rencontrer de problème dans l’exercice de stockage.
texts.en:
Bina is the man with his hand raised in the photo. He is 30 years old, from Mali, married and father to three children who do not yet go to school. His wife is a housewife who looks after her children well. Bina writes and reads in his mother tongue; this enables him to manage his business of stocking groundnut more easily.
