He resells his stock at the beginning of the winter season when the prices of cereals are rising. He has six years' experience and is doing well, since he makes enough profit to look after his family. This year he is expecting to make a provisional profit of 25,000FCFA per month. 

Bina buys his products locally from farmers in his village and transports them to a local market a number of kilometers away, so that he can sell them wholesale to merchants from the towns. He finds that stocking is very profitable and is planning to develop it as much as possible. The aim of his efforts is to be a responsible father to his children by giving them all that he can for their well-being (health, education, clothing and food). Bina states that he does not have any problems with carrying out his stocking activity.

loans.use: to buy bags of cereals to stock and then sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy ingredients for restauration activity.

loans.name: Ines Del Rosario

texts.es: Inés de 55 años de edad vive en casa propia con su hijo, ella se dedica a la venta de repuestos para vehículos desde hace 12 años, su hijo le ayuda en el negocio y con las ganancias que obtienen logra salir adelante, ella esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas repuestos como: amortiguadores, aceite, liquido de frenos, luces, entre otras cosas todo por mayor y asi poder tener mejores ganancias para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Inés is 55 years old and has for the past 12 years run a business selling auto parts. Inés lives in her own home with her son, who helps with the business, and together they have earned enough income to improve their lives. 

Inés is applying for a loan for the purchase of wholesale parts and supplies, such as shock absorbers, motor oil, brake fluid, lights, and other items. Adding these items to her store's inventory will allow Inés to boost her income and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase wholesale parts and supplies, such as shock absorbers, motor oil, brake fluid, lights, and other items.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is thankful that she was granted a 15,000 PHP loan, which she used to pay for spare parts, accessories and the maintenance of her tricycle unit. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, household and business expenditures. 

Marites would like to apply for another 15,000 PHP loan to pay for the registration and the maintenance of their tricycle unit. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain their daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. 

She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given to her for it will surely help fund their daily needs.

Marites dreams to own more tricycles to grow her business. She wants all of her children to finish school allowing them better opportunities in life. 

She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital and pay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for spare parts and the maintenance of her tricycle unit

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy milk, sugar, melon, bananas, flour, sweet potatoes and other ingredients needed

loans.name: Elba Marina

texts.es: Elba de 41 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa para damas y caballeros y también ropa de cama, vende de manera ambulante por los diferentes mercados que están cerca de su lugar de residencia, tiene muchos clientes por los buenos precios y la calidad de los productos, ella esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas mercadería por mayor para poder seguir con sus ventas ya si poder tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Elba, 41, lives in her own house with her husband.  She sells women’s and men’s clothing and sleepwear. She sells on foot throughout the different markets that are located near her place of residence, and she has many customers because of the good prices and the quality of the products.

She is requesting a loan for the purchase of more merchandise at wholesale, so that she can continue with her sales, and thus have better earnings.

loans.use: to purchase women's and men's clothing, and sleepwear.

loans.name: Marta Lilian

texts.es: Marta de 33 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus tres hijas, ella posee una pequeña tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia desde hace 3 años, tiene muchos clientes por los buenos precios y la amabilidad que tiene a la hora de vender, Marta está solicitando un crédito para poder comprar más sopas, huevos, granos básicos, refrescos, golosinas, pan dulce, etc. y así poder tener mejores ingresos para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Marta is 33 years old and lives in her own house with her three daughters. For the past 3 years, she has had a small store located in her residence. She has a lot of customers because of her good prices and the kindness that she uses when selling. Marta is requesting a loan to be able to buy more soup, eggs, basic grains, soft drinks, candies, sweet bread, etc. She will then be able to have better income and a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more soup, eggs, basic grains, soft drinks, candies, sweet bread, etc.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
As a married mother of five children, Gina works hard to support her family.

Gina has a furniture making business in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from a general store.  

Gina is borrowing PHP 29,000 through NWTF to buy raw materials for her furniture making business.

Gina has been sustaining her business activities through her past 27 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream, which is to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for her furniture making business

loans.name: Aiza

texts.en:
Aiza is 26 years old and has one child in school.

Aiza is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Aiza requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Aiza has been raising pigs for four years now, and has borrowed from NWTF seven times in the past to sustain it.

In the future, Aiza would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Morita

texts.en:
Morita is 69 years old and married with eight children, two of whom are in school. Morita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been running the general store for 15 years and also earns income from raising pigs.

Morita has borrowed and repaid 18 loans from Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) before this loan. She has requested a 22,000 Philippine peso loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock of groceries to sell. Morita hopes to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Cecelia

texts.en:
Cecelia is 54 years old and married with four children. Cecelia works very hard to provide for them. Cecelia runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for seven years now. 

Cecelia requested a 15,000 Philippine peso loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) to buy items to sell, such as canned goods, biscuits, eggs, groceries, etc. In the future, Cecelia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, such as canned goods, biscuits, eggs, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Ecariria Welfare Group

texts.en:
Samson, standing on the left-hand side in the photo, is a member of Ecariria Welfare Group. He is 50 years of age and has three children who are in school. 

Samson is a mixed farmer who joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa to learn more about record keeping and financial management.

Samson is taking a loan to help boost and improve his vegetable farming by buying certified seeds, and to add more stock of household items to resell in his shop. This will improve his income to a higher level. 

Samson hopes this will increase his level of income, thus providing for his family with ease.

Samson is grateful to Kiva for their help and support.

loans.use: To buy certified seeds and buy for more stock of household items for resale

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
The person in the photograph is Hannah. She is married and blessed with one child.

Hannah does cabbage farming and runs a kiosk selling foodstuffs such as flour, sugar and salt to earn a living. 

Hannah is taking a Kiva loan so as to add stock to her kiosk. This will help to expand the business and thus meet her customers' rising demand. 

She looks forward to improved profits.

Hannah is grateful to Kiva for their support.

loans.use: To buy stock of flour, sugar and salt to help meet customers' demand.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
This is Mary; she is 35 years old, married and blessed with two children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2013 to get training to boost her enterprise and financial management skills. 

She operates a kiosk and also practices vegetable farming. She is borrowing money to add stock to her kiosk by buying foodstuffs such as salt, sugar, tea leaves and soaps. This will ensure she improves her sales volume, and thus, has more income to cater for her family's needs.

Mary is grateful to Kiva for the great help.

loans.use: to buy more stock of salt, sugar, tea leaves and soaps to boost sales volume.

loans.name: Loise

texts.en:
The person in the photograph is Loise. She is married and blessed with four children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa to gain knowledge of enterprise development and financial management.

She engages in poultry and dairy farming to earn a living. She is borrowing the money to buy poultry feed to help improve her productivity.

She looks forward to improved proceeds that will enable her to cater to her family's expenses such as food and clothing.

Loise is grateful to Kiva for the help and support.

loans.use: To buy poultry feed that will help improve her productivity and income.

loans.name: Marhamat

texts.en:
Marhamat is 33 years old. She is very wise and is a good woman. She lives with her parents in Gafurov district.

Marhamat is a very hard-working woman; she has her own business. Three years ago, she bought a sale point and started to sell discs. Her business is doing well because she is very polite with her clients. Marhamat`s sister helps her.

The purpose of getting a loan is that she wants to buy some discs to sell to improve her business. Her available capital will not allow her to do it, that`s why she needs your understanding and support.

In the future, Marhamat would like to get a larger loan and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy some discs to sell to improve her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more fruits and cereals to sell and increase her income to support her family by providing for their needs.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is a 49-year-old married woman with seven children, two of whom are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Gloria has a nipa (palm fronds) weaving business in the Philippines. Gloria requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy materials like bamboo sticks to use in her business.

Gloria has been in this business for 30 years. In the future, Gloria would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy materials like bamboo sticks to use in her business

loans.name: Dolores

texts.en:
Dolores is 43 years old and married with ten children, four of whom are in school. Dolores works very hard to provide for them.

Dolores runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like rice, canned goods, condiments, groceries, etc.

Dolores has been in this business for 6 years now. 

In the future, Dolores would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like rice, canned goods, condiments, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Merideth

texts.en:
Merideth is married and she works hard to support her family. She has a general store business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from videoke rental. 

Merideth has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) and, more recently, through Kiva. Merideth is borrowing 18,000 Philippine pesos through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell for her general store business. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she can continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Maridy

texts.en:
Maridy is a married woman. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Maridy is 27 years old now.

Maridy has a buy and sell rice business in the Philippines. Maridy has been in this business for six years. 

Maridy requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy sacks of rice to sell.

In the future, Maridy would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida is 44 years old, married, and has six children, two of whom are in school.

Aida is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Aida requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Aida has been in this business for 4 years now, and has borrowed from NWTF 6 times in the past to sustain it.

In the future, Aida would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new rickshaw body for her husband's rickshaw

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Conchita

texts.en:
Conchita is 69 years old and widowed. She works very hard to provide for her daily needs.

Conchita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like eggs, junk food, candies, cigarettes, etc.. Conchita has been in this business for 20 years now. 

In the future, Conchita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like eggs, junk food, candies, cigarettes, etc.

loans.name: Mikheil

texts.en:
Mikheil is 39 years old. He lives with his wife and 4 children in Telavi district. Mikheil is a very hardworking man. He cultivates family-owned land and owns a vineyard.

Mikheil decided to start a husbandry business and requested a loan. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables him to get a loan of 1,400 GEL. With the received credit, he will purchase a cow and will start a husbandry business. His wife will milk the cow every day and will produce dairy products to sell. The Start Up program will help his family to increase income and cover everyday expenses of his 6-member family.

loans.use: to purchase a cow

loans.name: Edward

texts.en:
This is Edward. He is 67 years old and he joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa (HiH EA) in 2012. He is married with 4 children.
 
He practices dairy farming and vegetable farming. He is borrowing a Kiva loan to buy animal feed to boost his farming. This will improve his proceeds thus enabling him provide for his family with ease.

Edward is grateful to Kiva and their lenders and promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: To buy animal feed that will boost his farming proceeds.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay fees for her degree in psychology.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase medicine, pay for medical appointments and get medical tests for his mother.

loans.name: Natalia

texts.es:
Natalia vive en la ciudad de Asunción con sus padres y sus hermanos, trabaja en una entidad bancaria hace 2 años, con el dinero que gana ayuda a su familia y paga sus estudios.
Ella estudia la carrera de administración de empresas, y a través de su carrera quiere poder seguir ayudando a su familia y seres queridos.
El préstamo que solicitó es para pagar su matriculación del año lectivo educativo y pagar un semestre el total de las cuotas, obteniendo un descuento importante con ello, lo que le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
Natalia lives in the city of Asunción, Paraguay with her parents and her siblings.  She works in a bank and has been there for two years.  With the money that she earns she helps her family and pays for her studies.  

She is pursuing a degree in Business Administration.  She wants to be able to continue helping her family and her loved ones by working in her field. 

She is requesting a loan in order to pay for tuition and fees for an entire semester, obtaining an important discount by paying the entire amount up front . This will be of great assistance to Natalia.

loans.use: To pay tuition and fees for an entire semester.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay tuition and fees for her university education.

loans.name: Rolando

texts.es:
Rolando vive con su mamá y una hermana en la ciudad de San Lorenzo, trabaja como empleado en una empresa como vendedor y va a la universidad por la noche estudiando la carrera de Ingeniería Comercial.
Su objetivo es recibir su título y así poder encontrar un lugar de trabajo donde pueda mejorar su ingreso y seguir ayudando a su madre que ya es  una persona mayor.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en el pago de su tesis, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus metas.
texts.en:
Rolando lives with his mother and sister in the city of San Lorenzo.  He works as an sales employee in a business and he goes to the University at night to study Commercial Engineering.  

His goal is to receive his degree and be able to find a job that will improve his income so that he can continue helping his mother, since she is aging. 

He is asking for a loan in order to invest in paying tuition for his thesis, and in this way be able to achieve his goals.

loans.use: To pay the expenses and tuition for completing his thesis.

loans.name: María Serena

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito San Andrés se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo y por la alegría de su gente.
En este lugar vive la señora María, tiene 49 años de edad, es soltera y vive en casa de una hermana. Esta desde el inicio en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque con los créditos se ayuda en su negocio.
Doña María es una mujer que le ha tocado trabajar muy duro para así salir adelante, ella se dedica al comercio, vende ropa de todo tipo, productos Avon (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas) y productos naturales. Trabaja casi todos los días en sus recorridos, lo cual lo realiza en horas de la mañana, ella deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada ocho días, lleva más de  15 años que se dedica a esta actividad con la cual sale adelante.
Este crédito es para comprar ropa, perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y productos naturales. Sus sueños son tener buena salud para seguir en sus ventas.
texts.en:
The San Andrés (St. Andrew) Credit Group meets every 15 days in the Picoaza parish in the city of Portoviejo. The location is known for being a very commercial area, for its traditional San Pedro (St. Peter) and San Pablo (St. Paul) festivals, and for its people’s happiness.

This is where Maria lives. She is 49 years old, single, and lives in a sister’s house. She has been in the Credit Group since its beginning, and she likes it because the loans help her with her business. 

Maria is a woman who has had to work very hard to get ahead. She makes a living in commerce. She sells all types of clothes, Avon products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfume, and ladies’ accessories) and natural products. She works almost every day, doing her rounds in the morning hours. She leaves her products on credit and charges for the products every eight days. She has been in this line of work for more than 15 years, which allows her to get ahead.

This loan is to buy clothes, perfumes, creams, cosmetics, and natural products. Her dream is to have good health to be able to continue doing her sales.

loans.use: to buy clothes, perfumes, creams, cosmetics, and natural products.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 26 years old, married, and together with his spouse they have been blessed with one child. He sells and supplies milk to the residents of Nyahururu town, and it has been profitable for the two years he has been in this business.

He has requested a loan from VisionFund Kenya to buy more stock of milk to sell and supply to his customers. This will enable him to meet the high demand of milk in the area, and he will also increase his income. He will use the generated profits to pay school fees for his children, and also expand his business. 

This is John's second loan term from VisionFund Kenya, and he paid his previous loan successfully. 

His future hopes and dreams are to expand his business and live a better life with his family.

loans.use: To buy milk to sell

loans.name: Emelda

texts.en:
Emelda is a married woman with five children. She is 45 years old and has three children who are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Emelda has a business repacking condiments in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 25 years. Emelda requested a 12,000 Philippine peso loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation to buy onions, garlic, etc., to pack and sell. In the future, Emelda would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy onions, garlic, etc., to pack and sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy brick, cement, sand, re-bar and pay for labor.

loans.name: Nelida

texts.es:
Nelida comenta que quiere terminar la carrera de ciencias contables, abrir su propio estudio contable, y seguir estudiando capacitándose constantemente, debido a que el mercado y la sociedad exigen personas capacitadas.
Comenta que a la vez que estudia, también trabaja y lucha siempre para poder dar a sus seres queridos todo lo que necesitan.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar sus cuotas de la universidad.
texts.en:
Nelida comments that she wants to finish her degree in accounting in order to open her own accounting practice as well as to be able to continue educating herself over time since the market and society demand that people maintain ongoing certification.  

She comments that in addition to her studies she also works and struggles hard always in order to give her loved ones all that they need. 

She is asking for a loan in order to pay for tuition and fees for her college education.

loans.use: To pay tuition and fees for her college education.

loans.name: Angela

texts.es: Ángela de 44 años de edad es divorciada vive en casa propia con su hijo de 17 años de edad quien estudia actualmente, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa de segunda mano desde varios años, su negocio está ubicado en su lugar de residencia y tiene muchos clientes, con las ventas que realiza logra solventar los gastos de su hogar, ella esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas ropa de segunda mano por mayor y así continuar con sus ventas para tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: Angela is 44 years old, divorced, and lives in her own house with her 17-year-old son who is currently studying. For many years, she has made her living by selling second-hand clothes. Her business is located in her residence, and she has a lot of customers. With her sales, she is able to take care of some of her household expenses. She is requesting a loan to buy more second-hand clothes on wholesale, and to continue her sales to have better income.

loans.use: to buy more second-hand clothes on wholesale.

loans.name: Arturo Cruz

texts.es: Arturo de 59 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y su hija, el se dedica a la venta de repuestos para bicicletas desde hace 20 años, su negocio está ubicado en su lugar de residencia y tiene muchos clientes, con las ventas que realiza Arturo puede solventar los gastos que se le presentan en su hogar, el esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas repuestos para bicicletas por mayor para poder seguir con sus vetas y poder tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: Arturo is 59 years old and lives in his own house with his wife and daughter. For 20 years, he has made his living by selling spare parts for bicycles. His business is located in his residence and he has a lot of customers. With his sales, Arturo is able to take care of the expenses that come up around the house. He is requesting a loan to buy more spare bicycle parts on wholesale, to be able to continue his sales and have better income.

loans.use: to buy more spare bicycle parts on wholesale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to improve his humble home by purchasing four windows that are needed in the kitchen, thus guaranteeing security and peace of mind in his home.

loans.name: Lenita

texts.en:
Lenita loves to cook food since she is still single. She practiced it as her hobby until she made it her source of income. Lenita is now engaged in the selling of street foods like barbeque. She has been managing her small business for six years now. 

Lenita says that her income from the business enables her to afford her kid's allowance going to school. 

Lenita wants to increase her income and further develop the business for the future of her kid. With this purpose, she is asking for a loan of 15,000 PHP to buy raw meats, hot dogs, and ingredients for her barbecue business. She hopes to sell more and earn more to further meet her kid's needs when she will enter the college level of education.

loans.use: to buy raw meats, hot dogs, and ingredients for her barbecue business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a dairy  cow.

loans.name: Ronald

texts.en:
Ronald is 34 years old and a father of three. He is raising his family in a rural community. He and his wife work hand and hand to sustain their daily necessities and finance the education of his children. They have been engaged in a general merchandise business within the public market for almost nine years. They aspire to further improve this business in order to satisfy their customers'demand and earns a higher income. 

Having insufficient capital, Ronald is requesting an additional of PHP25,000.00 to buy more stock of school supplies, umbrellas, flashlights, toys and accessories to sell. 

Through hard work and strong determination, they hope that someday they make their business more profitable.

loans.use: to buy more stock of school supplies, umbrellas, flashlights, toys and accessories to sell

loans.name: Lili

texts.en:
Lili is 59 years old. She lives with her son and daughter-in-law in Telavi, East Georgia. The family owns 0.5 hectare of agricultural land, where they grow maize. Lili is a seamstress, and gets orders and sews clothes. 

Lili wants to open a metal workshop. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables her to get a loan of 5,200 GEL. With the received credit, she will open a workshop and her son, who is experienced in this field, will make metal doors and windows. They already have a place where they are going to have a workshop. 

The Start Up program will be a great support for their family as they will generate stable income.

loans.use: to open a workshop and make metal windows and doors

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en:
Leonila is a married woman with six children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Leonila is 40 years old, and five of her children are in school.

Leonila has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. Leonila requested a 6,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy fish to sell.

Leonila has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, Leonila would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell

loans.name: Harbeya

texts.en:
Harbeya is a 44-year-old divorced woman; she lives in Zarqa.  She is a conservative woman, so she asked her daughter to take her place in the photo. 

She wants the best for her first daughter, and she wants to see her be a successful girl. Harbeya wants to let her daughter search for work that will make her become an independent woman. 

But Harbeya`s income is not enough to cover her daughter's education fees, so she applied for an education loan to help her cover the semester fees.

loans.use: To help her cover the semester fees.

loans.name: Kabuku Success Group

texts.en:
The person holding the form is Sarah, a member of the Kabuku Success Group, which joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in 2013 to benefit from business training. Sarah, 24, works tirelessly to achieve financial independence -- her main goal. She credits her success to the training she has received  in enterprise development and financial management from Hand in Hand Eastern Africa. 

Sarah operates a beauty salon to earn a living. She is requesting a Kiva loan to buy more stock of weaves and hair gel to help boost her business by providing quality services. This investment will ensure that she maintains and expands her customer base, thus earn more income. She plans to plough back the anticipated income to help expand her business further.

Sarah is happy for Kiva and all lenders at large for their great support.

loans.use: To buy hair gel and weaves for her beauty salon to provide quality services, thus earn better returns.

loans.name: Ghada

texts.en:
Ghada is a 37-year-old married mother of three children and a Palestinian refugee who lives in a Palestinian refugee camp. She sells home products to help her husband in covering the increasing needs and expenses of their family.

Ghada is an ambitious woman and hard worker. She is trying hard to develop her business in order to improve her family's living conditions inside the camp, especially since her child suffers from a chronic disease and she wants to cover his medical expenses. 

Ghada is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner, Al Majmoua, to increase her business merchandise with a new wide range of home products to satisfy her customers' needs and to attract new ones. She hopes to expand her business more in the future to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to increase her merchandise with a new wide range of home products

loans.name: Zaur

texts.en:
Zaur is a 35-year-old gardener. He is married, and has a son and a daughter. His wife is a housekeeper and takes care of children. Zaur works in service as a gardener for houses; he has taken care of people's gardens for 10 years. He has good experience, but his monthly income is only 170AZN. 

Zaur uses his own tools working in gardens, and takes care of plants properly. He does everything in order to cover the family's demands, but his small income doesn't allow for covering everything. The family used to live in an old house before, and now after many years Zaur was able to collect money and repair the house. 

Now he applied for 800AZN loan in order to repair the bathroom and install a water pump in the house. He hopes that after finishing repairs, his family will be able to live in cozy and warm house provided with water.

loans.use: to repair the bathroom and install a water pump in the house

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothing and shoes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase yucca, potatoes, plantains, oil, etc., at wholesale.

loans.name: Zaur

texts.en:
Zaur is a 39-year-old gardener. He is married and has two beautiful daughters. His wife is a houskeeper and takes care of the family. Zaur has raised seasonal fruits for 17 years and sells them to neighbors. His monthly income is 123 AZN. 

Zaur loves his family very much and wants to provide his family a happy life. The only source of income is gardening, but now Zaur has problems with the irrigational system. His irrigational system in his garden is flawed. 

He applied for an 800 AZN loan in order to buy tools and fix the water system in his garden.

loans.use: to buy tools and fix the water system in the garden

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther, 30, is a loving mother of 2 children (8 and 12 years). She works hard on her 0.34 acre farm to generate income and support her small family. Esther practices dairy farming as well as crop cultivation. She has only been a farmer for a year and she is determined to grow the business and make it a permanent source of livelihood. 

One of the major challenges that Esther faces is lack of proper farm implements. Primitive tools only make life harder for a farmer like Esther, who works in the sweltering afternoon heat. With your loan investment, Esther will acquire modern farm implements that are easier and more effective to use. This will improve the quality of the overall work and the quantity of the harvests, as well.

loans.use: to pay for farming implements

loans.name: María Elizabeth

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito San Andrés se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo y por la alegría de su gente.
En este lugar vive la señora María, tiene 43 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre y de esta relación  tiene un hijo de 9 años de edad el cual estudia en escuela. El marido es albañil.
Doña María es una mujer muy trabajadora que además de dedicarse al hogar también se dedica al comercio y artesanía, ella elabora almohadas y también vende ropa interior, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, ella vende por su localidad y también los fines de semana viaja a otras ciudades como Manta y Jaramijo lugares donde tienen muy buenos clientes que siempre le compran sus productos. Ella elabora las almohadas en las noches cuando ya está desocupada las mismas que luego vende en su casa o en estos lugares antes mencionados. Lleva más de 3 años dedicada a esta actividad con la cual se gana lo suyo que le sirven para salir adelante.
Este crédito es para comprar ropa interior, telas, plumón y otros materiales para elaborar las almohadas. Es socia fundadora del Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que le ha brindado en la institución. Sus sueños son seguir aumentando su negocio.
texts.en:
The San Andrés (St. Andrew) Credit Group meets every 15 days in the Picoaza parish in the city of Portoviejo. The location is known for being a very commercial area, for its traditional San Pedro (St. Peter) and San Pablo (St. Paul) festivals, and for its people’s happiness.

This is where Maria lives. She is 43 years old and is in a domestic partnership. From this relationship, she has a 9-year-old son who is in school. Her husband is a carpenter.

Maria is a very hardworking woman who, in addition to taking care of the home, also makes a living in commerce and craftwork. She makes pillows and sells underwear. She does door-to-door sales. She sells the products in her town and, on the weekends, she travels to other cities like Manta and Jaramijo, places where there are always good customers that buy her products. She makes the pillows at night when she has free time, and then she sells them in her house or in the locations previously mentioned. She has been in this line of work for more than 3 years, which allows her to support herself and get ahead.

This loan is to buy underwear, fabrics, down feathers, and other materials to make pillows. She is a founding member of the Credit Group, and she likes it because of the help that the institution has given her. Her dream is to keep expanding her business.

loans.use: to buy underwear, fabrics, down feathers, and other materials to make pillows.

loans.name: Sharmaine

texts.en: Sharmaine is 19 years old and is from Estrella, Rizal, Nueva Ecija. She has three siblings and they are provided for by their parents through farming. Despite the insufficiency of funds, Sharmaine is very determined to finish college. That is why she wants to avail herself of an education loan of PHP 15,000 from Kiva lenders. She wants to finish her studies so she can have a greater chance of having a stable job. She hopes that lenders will approve her loan.

loans.use: to pay for her tuition fees

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is a 22-year-old promising farmer based in Bingwa village on the outskirts of Siongiroi market, which is found in South Rift Kenya. Joyce is appealing to Kiva lenders to secure a loan investment that will grow her farm business. She is seeking a 41,600 KES loan to pay for a dairy cow. 

Joyce is going for a dairy cow because milk products in Siongiroi have a ready market that offers fair prices. The cow will also deliver calves and produce other by-products that are economically viable and will improve her livelihood.

loans.use: to purchase a cow.

loans.name: Jovilyn

texts.en:
Jovilyn is 41 years old and has six children attending school. She engages herself in selling different snack foods and fruits within the public market. She wants to continue and improve this business but doesn't have enough capital. 

Jovilyn is asking for a loan of PHP 7,000 to buy more flour, rice, milk, coconut, sugar, cooking oil, seasonings and other needed ingredients. Being a patient and industrious mother, she believes the business will further improve someday.

loans.use: to buy more flour, rice, milk, coconut, sugar, cooking oil, seasonings and other needed ingredients

loans.name: Mawopig Group

texts.en:
Revocate lives in the town of Masindi, Uganda. She runs a retail shop that sells general merchandise like sugar and soap. She also earns a salary to top up on her income. She started the business in order to sustain her family's needs and offspring. Revocate hopes to expand her business, however price fluctuations and inadequate capital affect her business. Revocate needs a loan to buy merchandise like sugar and salt to sell.

She is a member of Matwopig where members guarantee each other in order to acquire a loan.

loans.use: to buy general merchandise like sugar and salt to sell

loans.name: Maia

texts.en:
Maia is 48 years old and is from Vani district. She is divorced and lives with her pensioner mother. Maia is involved in agricultural activities. In particular, she owns a plot of agricultural land, where she grows nut trees and maize. She also owns a small vineyard. 

Maia is a very hardworking woman and does her best to insure in a good harvest to sell at a good price. She decided to start an additional business and requested a loan. 

The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo enables her to get a loan of 2,500 GEL. With the received credit she will purchase a stock of clothes and will resell them with the price markup. Maia will generate a stable income and will provide better living conditions for her pensioner mother.

loans.use: to begin trading clothes

loans.name: Musaab

texts.en:
Musaab is a 22-year-old single guy, living with his family that consisting of his mother, stepfather, and his siblings in Baqaa.  Musaab is a student at the university, majoring in management information systems.

His mother works as a teacher in the school, but she cannot help Musaab with his tuition fees because she helps her husband with her children's expenses from her second husband.

Musaab is a persistent and hard-working young man; he does not stop working to provide his daily pocket money and tuition expenses, but it cannot meet all his expenses. Therefore he asked for an education loan to help him cover his university fees.

loans.use: To help him cover his university fees.

loans.name: Myasar

texts.en:
Myasar is a conservative woman so she asked her daughter to take her place in the photo. Myasar is 53 years old, and lives in Baqaa. 

Myasar is a mother of three children, and one of them is Aseel, who is studying graphic design. Myasar applied for an education loan to cover Aseel`s university fees because Myasar's husband is facing financial problems that prevent him from covering Aseel`s semester fees. Myasar needs your support to help her see her daughter graduate and to enable Aseel to find good work. Perhaps Aseel can help her family with household expenses.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter's university fees.

loans.name: Jose David

texts.es:
José, de 37 años de edad, estudio hasta primer grado en la escuela de la comunidad, se creció con sus padres y a los 27 años de edad se casó, su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos y también tiene un negocio de venta de antojitos (enchiladas, pastelitos, yuca y frescos) en la escuela de la comunidad, tienen 3 hijos.

José, trabaja en la siembra de hortalizas como pepino y ejotes, aprendió a trabajar en la agricultura desde que tenía 10 años de edad, también trabaja como jornalero cerca de su hogar, este trabajo lo realiza todos los días, sin un horario fijo.

Está solicitando un crédito para comprar insumos agrícolas para sembrar hortalizas, esto le ayudara a mejorar sus cosechas y así podrá seguir generando los ingresos económicos necesarios para su hogar.

El sueño de José, es mejorar su vivienda ya que actualmente es de barro, también ayudar a sus hijos en los estudios y aumentar el área del cultivo, para seguir generando ingresos económicos en su hogar. Otro de sus sueños es comprar un sistema de riego para lograr mejores cosechas.
texts.en:
José is 37 years old and study up to Grade 1 in the school in his community. He grew up with his parents and at 27 years of age he got married. His wife does domestic work and also has a business selling snacks (enchiladas, pastries, yucca and fruit drinks) in the community school. They have 3 children.

José works growing vegetables like cucumber and green beans. He learned this agricultural work when he was 10 years old. He also works as day labor close to his home. He does this work daily on no fixed schedule.

He is requesting this loan to buy agricultural inputs to grow vegetables. this will help him to improve his harvests and thus continue to generate the economic income needed for his household.

José's dream is to improve his house which currently is made of clay and also to help his children in their studies. He wants to expand the area he grows to continue to generate income for the household. Another of his dreams is to buy an irrigation system to have better harvests.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs to plant vegetables.

loans.name: Shitoyi's Group

texts.en:
Shitoyi is 61 years old and has 6 children. He has been a farmer for more than 30 years and is always said to be a very experienced farmer. Even though Shitoyi is the only one featured in the above picture, he is actually representing his group of 8 farmers in Kakamega North District, Kenya.

Shitoyi started working alongside One Acre Fund a few years ago, in 2010, and decided to do so because he wanted to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods. Since then, he has seen his life improve, especially in the sense that he has learned a lot from farming trainings ever since. This year, he decided to represent his group because he wanted to gain leadership skills.

Shitoyi’s Group will receive farming inputs to plant a total of 4.5 acres of land. Additionally, some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light so, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of 2 solar lights.

loans.use: to buy cost-efficient maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season

loans.name: Shem's Group

texts.en:
Pictured above is Shem, who, as a group leader, is representing his group formed by six farmers in Kakamega North District, Kenya. He is married and is a father to one child. He is known by his community as a very hardworking individual.

Initially, Shem joined One Acre Fund in 2011 because he wanted to get the best quality fertilizer and hybrid seeds. Since he joined the program he says that his life has improved, especially because he has been able to consistently feed his family. With the profits from the coming harvesting season, Shem plans to repair his home.

Between the six farmers in Shem's Group, a total of 3.5 acres of land will be planted using the maize seeds and fertilizer received with the loan. Additionally, some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light so, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of five solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve maize harvests

loans.name: Deni

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! Now it’s time for you to meet one of new Ruma agents, Deni. He just joined Ruma two months ago. Deni lives in Sumedang, located in West Java, about 4-5 hours drive from Jakarta. He lives there with his wife and his only child. 

Deni owns a small stall, selling snacks, drinks and other small items. Deni is really excited to be a part of Ruma’s network because he hopes that these services will bring more customers to his stall and increase his savings.

With the support and assistance from Ruma staff, he is now offering to process mobile payment services for customers as a new service. To do this, he is required to have an Android mobile phone. He is requesting a Kiva loan to help him to purchase this Android phone so he can offer this new service. 

His goal for his business is to become a trusted mobile payment service provider for his community. As seen in the photo, Deni is the one who is standing and smiling. He will be thankful for your kind support.

loans.use: to buy an Android phone so he can provide mobile payment services for his community

loans.name: Atilati's Group

texts.en:
Atilati is 35 years old and has five children. She is a group leader and is representing her group formed by six farmers in the Kakamega North District of Kenya. 

Atilati has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2011. This decision was largely a result of her desire to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods. Although she described her last harvest as excellent, she believes she could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. Atilati also decided to purchase a solar light as part of her loan, which she is very excited about, as it will allow her to provide light during dark hours for her children to be able to study.

Obtaining this loan means that Atilati's Group will be able to receive a total of four solar lights, as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 2.75 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Dara

texts.en:
26-year-old Dara is married and has one young daughter. They are living in a small village of the Prey Prorsorb district of Kratie province. Her main sources of income are from a cassava plantation and fishery. Her secondary source of income is from being a paid worker. She manages to earn almost $7 US a day. 

Dara has been a client of VisionFund, Kiva’s partner, one time before. Now she is applying for a loan of 2,000,000 riels to buy potash and cassava stems for her plantation and to buy a boat to go fishing. She believes that her plantation will be fruitful and that she can send her kid to school in the future.

loans.use: to buy potash and cassava stems and to buy a boat to go fishing

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to improve the roof of her business and house at the same time, with the goal of providing better service to her clients.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 35 years old, married and has two grade school children. To make a living, she engages herself in a retailing business while her husband operates their motorcycle for passenger transportation. Marilyn and her husband help each other to satisfy their children's needs. 

Marilyn is requesting a loan of 10,000 Philippine pesos to buy grocery items, such as beverages, condiments, and many more. She believes that the loan will help her lots to sell more and increase her income. Marilyn will use her income for the education of her children. She hopes they finish their studies and become professionals someday.

loans.use: to buy grocery items, such as beverages, condiments, and many more.

loans.name: Jobito De Jesús

texts.es:
Jobito, de 41 años de edad, estudio hasta primer grado, está casado y su esposa se dedica a los oficios domesticos, tienen 3 hijos, los cuales van a la escuela.

Jobito, se dedica a la carpintería desde hace veinte años, el lo aprendió gracias a su padrastro que fue quien le enseño este oficio.- También se dedica a la siembra de granos básicos, para consumo y para venderlos y cubrir algunos gastos del hogar.
  
El préstamo lo utilizara para comprar madera para la carpintería y unos cuartones para arreglar su casa, ya que pronto se acerca el invierno y no quiere que su familia corra el riesgo de mojarse.

El sueño de Jobito, es que sus hijos estudien y sean profesionales, ya que él nunca tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar.
texts.en:
Jobito, aged 41, studied until first grade, and is now married with three children who are in school. His spouse looks after the household.

Jobito has worked as a carpenter for 20 years, a trade which he learned from his step-father. He also grows basic crops both for personal use and to sell to cover some of the household costs. This loan will be used to buy wood for carpentry and some timber to repair his house, as it will soon be winter and he does not want to risk his family not being protected from the elements.

Jobito's dream is for his children to keep studying and to become working professionals, since he never had the opportunity to study himself.

loans.use: to buy wood for carpentry and some timber to repair his house.

loans.name: Adan

texts.es:
Adan tiene 49 años de edad, es casado, tiene 2 hijos, vive con su familia en el distrito de La Florida ubicado en la provincia de San Miguel, región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte de Perú. Los pobladores de esta zona se dedican a la agricultura y crianza de animales principalmente.

El se dedica a brindar servicio de transporte, cuenta con más de 5 años de experiencia en este servicio y con clientes que brindan buenas referencias personales y laborales de el. Solicita préstamo para realizar reparaciones y mantenimiento de su vehículo ya que actualmente se encuentra en mal estado, dicha inversión le servirá para poder brindar un mejor servicio, con gran influencia en el negocio, Adan espera tener en mejores condiciones su vehículo para poder seguir satisfaciendo de la mejor manera la demanda de dicho servicio en la zona lo que tendrá un impacto positivo en su nivel de ingresos y por ende va a mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Adan is 49 years old. He is married and he has two children. He lives with his family in the La Florida district located in the san Miguel province in the Cajamarca region in the northern mountains of  Perú. The residents in this region are mainly dedicated to agriculture and raising livestock. 

He provides transportation services. He has more than five years of experience. His customers offer good personal and professional references for him. He is requesting a loan for his vehicle's repairs and maintenance since it is currently in a bad state. This investment will allow him to offer better service. With the great influence in business, Adan hopes to put his vehicle in a better condition to continue satisfying the demands for his service in his community. This will have a positive impact on the level of his income and it will improve the quality of life for himself and his family.

loans.use: repair and maintain his vehicle.

loans.name: Nani

texts.en:
Nani, who is a 40-year-old divorced woman, lives in the capital of Georgia. She has a son in school, who has no source of income for himself. Nani is the only breadwinner, and she makes much effort to provide good living conditions and a good education for progressing in life for her son. 

Nani works as a manager at the local cafe and gets a fixed salary. She has a great desire to have her own business that will make her work more productive. Nani requested a loan from local financial institutions and her loan application was approved within the joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. This startup loan program provides soft conditions for business startup loans to people who don't have access to credit products. 

Nani has been approved with the amount of 1,100 USD. She will use it to purchase the cafe shares of the owner, and she will lead the business herself. Nani already has a big list of loyal costumers and will effectively continue her lovely business. The loan will be great support to this motivated woman and her son, as the family's income will significantly increase, and Nani will get the chance to better her style of life as well. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase the cafe where she works and increase productivity.

loans.name: Abdallateef

texts.en:
Abdallateef is studying in a university and majoring civil engineering. After he succeeded in high school, Abdallateef was not able to enter a public university because he earned very little, Therefore, he decided to work alongside his studies so he can enter one of the private universities and pay for his education.

Lately, Abdallateef's family faced some financial problems. He had to help them and give them his semester fees due to his sense of responsibility towards his family. Therefore, Abdallateef had to apply for an education loan to cover the semester fees.

loans.use: to cover the semester fees.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to complete payment for a deep freezer

loans.name: Sokhon's Group

texts.en:
Sokhon, 45 years old and a widow, lives in Keo Seima district, Mondulkiri province with her two children. Her primary source of income is from her small grocery store. She also raises pigs to sell to earn additional income. 

Sokhon is the leader of her group of two and this is her first cycle with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She is requesting 1,000,000 KHR to buy grocery stock for her store. She wishes that her business goes well so that her family will be in better condition.

loans.use: to buy grocery stock

loans.name: Matanat

texts.en:
Matanat is a 50-year-old housekeeper. She is married and has a son and two daughters. Her husband is a mechanic but earns very little money and this doesn't cover the family's demands.

Matanat is a gardener. She raises seasonal fruits and sells them at a local bazaar. Her monthly income is 164 AZN and it's also not enough for the family. Every morning Matanat drives to a local bazaar and sells their harvest because fruits are in high demand. She sells them from the car because she doesn't have her own place at the bazaar.

She applied for a 1,500 AZN loan in order to buy a small place for groceries at the bazaar to sell their harvest.

loans.use: to buy a small place for groceries at the bazaar  sell their harvest

loans.name: Irma

texts.es: Irma tiene 61 años de edad y vive en casa propia con su hija y sus dos nietas, ella posee desde hace 9 años una pequeña tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia, tiene muchos clientes por los buenos precios y la amabilidad que tiene a la hora de vender, con las ventas que realiza y las ganancias que obtiene es como ha logrado salir adelante con su familia, ella está solicitando un crédito para poder comprar más sopas, huevos, granos básicos, refrescos, golosinas, pan dulce, etc. y así poder tener mejores ingresos para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Irma, 61, lives in her own house with her daughter and her two granddaughters.

She has had a small store in her home for nine years.  She has a lot of customers because of her good prices and friendly service.  She has managed to get ahead with her family because of her sales and her earnings.

Irma's requesting a loan to be able to buy more soup, eggs, basic grains, soft drinks, snacks, pan dulce [sweet bread], and so on.  That way she'll earn more income and have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more soup, eggs, basic grains, soft drinks, snacks, pan dulce [sweet bread], etc.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy children's clothing for resale.

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en:
Rosemary is a 56-year-old woman from the Trans-zoia district of Kenya. She has been married to her husband for 37 years and they have 14 children! The youngest child is 6 years while the oldest is 35 years.

Rosemary has been a farmer for as long as she has been a wife. She operates on a small piece of land under her husband's name, keeping dairy and poultry and growing crops and trees. Rosemary is seeking a small loan of KES 10,000 to pay for farm implements. Working with modern tools will make her work move faster and become more efficient. She expects to see major improvements in the quality and quantity of yields led by the use of improved tools.

loans.use: to pay for farm implements

loans.name: Natia

texts.en:
Natia is a 35-year-old married woman. She lives with her husband and 2 school-aged children in Ozurgeti district.

The only source of income for the family is Natia's income.  She trades clothes. Natia wants to purchase a stock of clothes in order to expand the business, as she has orders and does not have enough money to purchase.

The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables her to get a loan of 2,100 USD. With the received credit, she will purchase a stock of clothes and will resell with a price markup. This will give her a chance to make a living for her children. Natia awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of clothes to resell

loans.name: Samuel De Jesus

texts.es: Samuel de 44 años de edad vive en casa propia con su madre, el se dedica desde hace 25 años a la agricultura siembra maíz y frijol, comercializa sus productos en los diferentes mercados que se encuentran cerca de su casa, Samuel está solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, etc. y mejorar el terreno que muestra en la fotografía para poder continuar con su trabajo y tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: Samuel, 44 years old, lives in his own house with his mother. He has worked for 25 years in agriculture, planting corn and beans; he sells his products at the various markets that are near his house. Samuel is asking for a loan to purchase seeds, fertilizer, manure, pesticides, etc. and improve that land that is shown in the photo to be able to continue with his work and have other income.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizer, manure, pesticides, etc. and improve the land.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is aged 46, married with 5 children and 3 attend school in Hoima, Uganda.

She deals in tailoring and gets additional incomes from cattle keeping. She hopes to grow and expand her business to new market areas despite the challenge of seasonality (that is, business is at its peak during the school term period and down in holidays).

Betty will use the loan facility to stock more school uniforms to sell.

loans.use: to stock more school uniforms to sell

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
Carlos es un padre de familia muy trabajador y responsable, él cuenta que gracias a los créditos a los que ha tenido acceso a logrado mejorar su cultivo pues mucho antes de solicitar los préstamos en ADICLA el cultivaba poco pero ahora a incrementado el volumen de su cultivo como también sus ingresos, y con estos ingresos el logro mejorar un cuarto para su familia, él se siente muy satisfecho por lo que ha logrado, el también comenta que el solicita prestamos en ADICLA porque aquí lo atienden con rapidez y facilidad,  Carlos en este momento necesita de un nuevo préstamo porque él quiere  incrementar un poco más su cultivo, pero el en este momento no cuenta con capital suficiente para poder comprar sus semillas y fertilizantes y así poder sembrar.
El sueño de Carlos es poder contar con este préstamo y  hacer que esta inversión le deje nuevamente nuevas ganancias para poder repellar su casa.
texts.en:
Carlos is a very hard-working, responsible, parent. He says that thanks to the loans that he has had, he has been able to improve his crops.  Before requesting the loans from ADICLA, he cultivated very little, but now he has increased his crop volume as well as his income, which enabled him to improve a room for his family.

He feels very satisfied with what he has been able to do, and he comments that he requests loans from ADICLA because they take care of him quickly and easily.  At this point in time, Carlos needs a new loan because he wants to increase his crop a little, but he doesn’t have enough capital to purchase his seed and fertilizer so he can plant. 

Carlos hopes to have this new loan, and make this investment produce new profits for him once again, so that he will be able to stucco his house.

loans.use: to purchase seed and fertilizer.

loans.name: Joseph's Group

texts.en:
Pictured above is Joseph, who, as a group leader, is representing his group formed by 8 farmers in North District, Kenya. He is married, is a father to 4 children, and is known by his community as a very friendly person.

Initially, Joseph joined One Acre Fund in 2011 because he wanted to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods. Since he joined the program he says that his life has improved, especially because he has been able to consistently feed his family. With the profits from the coming harvesting season, Joseph plans to send his children to school.

Between the 8 farmers in Joseph's Group, a total of 5.5 acres of land will be planted using the maize seeds and fertilizer received with the loan. Additionally, some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light so, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of 5 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize

loans.name: Mary Cris

texts.en: Mary Cris, 41 years old, is married and has seven children, three of them in school. Mary Cris works very hard to provide for them. For the past 10 years, Mary Cris has run a general store in the Philippines, selling a variety of items such as sugar, eggs, rice and other groceries. She has requested a PHP 23,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell. In the future, Mary Cris would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Mary Rose

texts.en: Mary Rose, 30 years old, is married and has one child who is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. For the past 8 years, Mary Rose has operated a general store business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries such as snack foods, canned goods, noodles and other miscellaneous items. In the future, Mary Rose would like to save enough money to support her family's financial stability.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries such as snack foods, canned goods, noodles and other miscellaneous items.

loans.name: Rawan

texts.en: Rawan, 21 years old, lives with her family in Zarqaa. An example of a helpful woman, Rawan wants to help her brother, Rakan, to complete his education. He is 19 years old and studying physics. Rawan's family has a low income and they could not cover tuition fees for Rakan. Rawan wants to provide help for her family so she applied for an education loan to cover her brother`s university fees.

loans.use: To cover her brother`s university fees

loans.name: Doris Del Transito

texts.es:
Doris, de 30 años de edad, estudio hasta noveno grado, está acompañada y su pareja trabaja de albañil y algunos días trabaja en la agricultura, tienen dos hijos, los cuales son menores de edad.

Doris, desde hace varios años se dedica a elaborar hamacas y las vende en su pueblo, ella aprendió el trabajo, pues toda su familia se dedica a lo mismo y ella necesitaba darles lo necesario a sus hijos decidió iniciar también en este negocio, ahora les está enseñando a sus hijos, trabaja de lunes a sábado.
  
El préstamo lo utilizara para comprar materiales para elaborar hamacas y también comprará cemento y arena para arreglar su casa, ya que en el invierno el agua entra a su casa, de esa manera su familia vivirá en mejores condiciones de vida.

El sueño de Doris, es trabajar fuerte para darles todo a los dos hijos y que vivan en casa digna y darles el estudio para que cuando estén grandes sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Doris, 30 years old, went to school up to the ninth grade. She is partnered and her partner works as a bricklayer and some days he works in agriculture. They have two children who are young. 

For a number of years, Doris has worked making hammocks and selling them in her town. She learned the work because her whole family does the same work and she needed to give her children what they needed. She decided to take up this business as well, and now she is teaching it to her children. She works from Monday to Saturday. 
  
The loan will be used to purchase materials to make hammocks and also she will purchase cement and sand to make repairs to the house, since in the winter, water comes into the house, and in this way her family will live in better living conditions. 

Doris's dream is to work hard to give her two children everything and that they live in a respectable house and to provide them with an education so that when they are grown, they will be professionals.

loans.use: to purchase materials to make hammocks.

loans.name: Anibal Ariel

texts.es:
Anibal, de 26 años de edad, estudio hasta sexto grado, está casado y su esposa trabaja en los oficios domésticos y tiene un hijo de 3 años de edad. 

Anibal, trabaja en un taller de enderezado y pintura desde hace 5 años, este oficio lo aprendió gracias a su padrastro, para llegar hasta el taller, camina por un camino rural 30 minutos y luego toma el bus, trabaja de lunes a sábado y si hay bastante trabajo, va a trabajar los días domingos.

Anibal, está solicitando un crédito para poder reparar su vivienda, para darles a su hijo y a su esposa mayor seguridad en cuanto a la vivienda.- Con el dinero que le quede, comprará una moto,  para viajar a su trabajo y ahorrar tiempo.

Con el crédito anterior compro el terreno donde hizo su casa.

El sueño de Anibal, es poder mejorar toda la vivienda y poder ayudar siempre a su familia en todo lo que le sea posible, para poder tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Anibal, 26 years old, went to school up to the sixth grade, is married, and his wife takes care of the domestic chores and he has a 3-year-old child.

Aniba has worked at a bodywork and paint shop for the past 5 years. He learned this work thanks to his stepfather. To get to the shop, he walks on a rural path 30 minutes, and then takes a bus. He works from Monday to Saturday, and if there is enough work, goes to work on Sundays. 

Anibal is asking for a loan to be able to repair his house to give his son and wife more security in relation to the house. With the money that remains, he will purchase a motorcycle to go to work and save time.

With the previous loan, he purchased the land where he built his house.

Anibal's dream is to be able to improve the whole house and be able to always help his family in everything that is possible, to be able to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to repair his house.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en: Caroline, 31 years old, is single and has one child. She lives in Masindi, Uganda and runs a mobile money business that transacts sending and receiving money by phone. She started the business to be able to support her family's needs.  Caroline has high hopes of expanding her business, even though competition, network and small capital are problems affecting her returns. She is an honest and hardworking woman who wants a loan to add more float to her mobile money business.

loans.use: to add more float to her mobile money business.

loans.name: Somart

texts.en:
Somart is a married woman with three children who are no longer her dependents. She lives in a rural village in the Dambae district of Kampong Cham province. For 36 years, Somart has been growing cassava to make a living. She also has a cashew nut plantation. 

This will be Somart's sixth loan cycle as a member of VisionFund, Kiva’s partner. She is now seeking a loan of 3,000,000 KHR to plow the field, to buy fertilizer and to hire workers to work on the farm and to harvest. She wishes that the price of cassava will increase so that she can earn more profit.

loans.use: to plow the field, to buy fertilizer and to hire workers to work on the farm and to harvest

loans.name: Cathelen

texts.en:
Cathelen, 43, is such a family-oriented lady. She has been married to her husband Andrew for 31 years. Cathelen and Andrew have six children, two of whom are in boarding schools. 

For her to start helping her husband support the family, she ventured into mixed farming five years ago with her husband's two-acre land as capital. Today, the farm has three goats, three dairy cows, and seven heads of poultry. The farmland is kept green and beautiful by the hundreds of trees planted on it. 

Cathelen is seeking a loan from Kiva lenders to purchase cereal grains. Many farmers in Kenya make an extra living off cereal trade. Farmers lay out capital to aggregate cereal produce, and sell it to far, profitable markets at a decent margin. 

Income from this investment will enable Cathelen to uplift her family's living standards.

loans.use: to purchase cereal grains

loans.name: Islam

texts.en:
Islam is a 25-year-old single man from Khanyounis city. He lives with his family in a small house. His father works as an employee in the public sector, where he gets a low income. The family has agricultural land which they do not use. Islam decided that he will plant it with some seasonal crops, and create a new source of income to the family.

Islam took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to prepare the agricultural land for the new season by buying seeds and seedlings.

By taking this loan, Islam will be able to start his own business and be productive.

Islam appears in the photo

loans.use: to prepare the agricultural land for the new season by buying seeds and seedlings.

loans.name: Prohim

texts.en:
43-years-old Prohim is a married man with one little son who is under 6 years old. He is a resident of the Dambae district of Kampong Cham province. He has been planting cassava for 25 years in order to earn a living. 

Prohim is not a new member. This is his third time being a client of VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). 

He is seeking for a loan of 2,000,000 KHR for his cassava plantation. The portion will be used to hire workers to plow and work on the field, to buy fertilizer and pesticide, and for harvesting. 

He hopes that the plantation will have higher yield so that the family's financial status will be improved.

loans.use: to hire workers to plow and work on the field, to buy fertilizer and pesticide, and for harvesting

loans.name: Elias

texts.en:
Elias is a 34-year-old married man with one child, aged six months; this child does not go to school. He is a tea-growing farmer who works at his plantation for 8 hours a day and 6 days a week. He is also a veterinary doctor who treats animals in his local area. 

He started tea growing in 2009 to increase his income as a veterinary medical person. All this is done in his local area of Kigondo-Katunga and Kakanju in the Bushenyi district. 

This is his first loan from the Institution to buy fertilizer for his plantation to increase the tea output for his clients. Most of his clients are tea traders. His biggest challenge is weather (the dry weather), which is not good for the tea plantations. 

He hopes to educate his children into better people in the near future. 

As a young man of 34 he is so hardworking, and he says his future is well planned since he has started investing at a young age. 

He asks UGAFODE Microfinance to always be there for him and other local people in his area to help them develop their households and attain better standards of living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Nean

texts.en:
Residing in a rural village in Tbaung Khmum district of Kampong Cham province, 34-year-old Nean is married with two children who are in primary school. To manage the family budget, she and her husband have been planting cassava for 16 years. They are able to keep around $6 US for savings. 

Nean has been with VisionFund, Kiva’s partner, two cycles now, and she is pursuing a loan of 4,000,000 riels to buy a piece of land that already has cassava plants in order to expand her business. She hopes that her cassava plantation will be fruitful and that the price of cassava will increase.

loans.use: to buy a piece of land for a cassava plantation

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy household supplies for using with her family

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy household supplies

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Ayah est celui qui est accroupi avec la daba en main sur la photo.
Ayah  est  malien âgé de 60 ans, marié et père de sept (7) enfants âgés de 3 à 30 ans dont trois vont à l’école. Sa femme est ménagère.
Ayah est analphabète, cultivateur depuis son jeune âge mais son rêve est de développer sont activité de cultiver pour le bien être de sa famille. Il fait recourt aux services financiers de RMCR pour augmenter les semences et les nombres de superficie à cultiver. Il achète les semences et les intrants sur les marchés locaux. Après la récolte il vend  ses produits sur les marchés locaux. Les bénéfices prévisionnels mensuels  sont de 130 000 F CFA. Depuis que Ayah prend de l’argent avec le RMCR il n’a pas rencontre de problème  majeur seulement souvent les pluies ne sont pas correctes, malgré  il arrive a se débrouiller  et le revenu influence positivement la vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Ayah is the one who is crouching with the axe in the photo.  Ayah is a 60 year old man from Mali who is married and the father to seven children, ages 3 to 30.  Three of his children are in school.  His wife is a maid.  Ayah is illiterate and has been a farmer from a young age.  But, his dream is to develop his farming activity for the well-being of his family.  

He is requesting financial services from RMCR to increase his seed supply and the amount of area to farm.  He buys the seeds and the fertilizers at local markets.  After the harvest, he sells his products at local markets.  The estimated monthly earnings are 130,000 FCFA.  Since Ayah took out a loan with RMCR, he has not encountered a major problem, only that often the rain is not sufficient.  Despite this, he is able to manage and the revenue positively influences the life of his family.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers for his fields.

loans.name: Nizami

texts.en:
Nizami is married and has four children, two daughters and two sons. For 22 years he has been an IDP (internally displaced person) from the Agdam region, and now he lives in the Absheron region with his family.

He needs a loan of 1,000 AZN to buy metals for improving his business. This is his fourth loan from Kiva. All loans to Nizami closed in time. Nizami is thankful to Komak and Kiva for supporting him again.

loans.use: to buy metals for improving his business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy school supplies, shoes, and uniforms for his young daughter.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 27-year-old single man from Rafah city. He lives with his family in a small house. 

The family has agricultural land that Mohammad has been working for the past three years. He plants seasonal crops using greenhouses.

Mohammad took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to prepare the agricultural land for the new season by buying seeds and seedlings.

By taking this loan, Mohammad will be able to improve his business and increase productivity. Mohammad appears in the photo.

loans.use: to prepare agricultural land for the new season by buying seeds and seedlings.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy fresh fish.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy various articles.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 25 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, trabaja como empleada en un comedor cerca de su lugar de residencia, con lo que obtiene de su trabajo logra salir adelante, la joven vive en casa propia con su esposo y su hija, ella quiere mejorar su vivienda construyendo una pared en la parte de atrás de su casa en el lugar que muestra la fotografía, pero como no tiene de suficiente capital, solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito para poder comprar cemento, arena, ladrillos y pago de mano de obra y asi poder vivir mas cómodos con su familia.
texts.en:
The young woman, whose face has been pixelated, is 25 years old and lives in a high-risk area. She works as an employee in a dining room near her home. With what she obtains from her work, she succeeds in going forward. She lives in her own house with her husband and daughter. 

She wants to improve her home by building a wall in the back of the house, in the place shown in the photograph. Since she doesn’t have enough capital, she requests a loan from Integral to be able to buy cement, sand, and bricks and to pay workers. Thus, she will be able to live more comfortably with her family.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, and bricks and to pay workers.

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es: Miguel de 39 años de edad es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable, quien siempre está buscando la manera de darle a su familia una buena calidad de vida, desde hace mas de 14 años don miguel se dedica a la agricultura especialmente a la siembra de maíz y frijol y la comercializa en los pueblos aledaños, con las ganancias que obtiene logra salir adelante, el esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, etc. y mejorar el terreno que muestra en la fotografía para poder continuar con su trabajo y seguirle dando a su familia lo que necesitan.
texts.en:
Miguel is 39 years old. He is a very hard working and responsible person, who is always looking for a way to give his family a good quality of life. For more than 14 years, Miguel has been dedicated to agriculture, especially to growing corn and beans and to selling his products in neighboring towns. With the earnings he gets, he succeeds in going forward.
