He is requesting a loan to buy seeds, fertilizers, manure, disease controls, etc. and to improve the land shown in the photograph. This will allow him to continue with his work and to continue giving his family what they need.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, manure, disease controls, etc. and to improve his land.

loans.name: Muazama

texts.en:
Muazama is a conscientious woman. She was born in 1960, and lives in the western part of the country. She is married, and her husband is a pensioner. She has two children. Muazama is very responsible and confident person.

For more than eight years, she has been working in a kindergarten. She earns 715 TJS each month, but it is not enough to keep up her normal standard of living.

Muazama is now sick and needs to be treated in a medical clinic. Therefore, she is asking for a loan of 4,000 TJS to get treatment in a medical clinic.

loans.use: To be treated in medical clinic

loans.name: Magna Eufemia

texts.es: Magda de 49 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus cuatro hijos, ella se dedica desde hace 15 años a la siembra de maíz y frijol, comercializa sus productos en los diferentes mercados que están cerca de su casa, gracias a su trabajo es como ha podido salir adelante  y solventar los gastos de su hogar, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de los insumos agrícolas necesarios como: semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, herbicidas, etc. para poder tener un buen cultivo y asi tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Magda is 49 years old. She lives in her own house with her four children. For 15 years, she has been dedicated to growing corn and beans, and she sells her products in the different markets that are near her house. Thanks to her work, she has been able to go forward and pay for her household expenses. 

She is requesting a loan to buy agricultural supplies she needs, including seeds, fertilizers, manure, disease controls, herbicides, etc. so that she can have a good harvest and, thus, have a better income.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, manure, disease controls, herbicides, etc.

loans.name: Dalal

texts.en:
Dalal is 55 years old, a widowed woman who lives with her children in Rusaifeh.

Dalal's husband has been dead for 20 years; at first she was not able to think the right way, then she started to wake up and took the right decision to save her children. 

She holds all the responsibility for raising her children and their education, but she does not have the academic certificate to find a good job. So she bought clothes and products to sell to her neighbors and friends.  With this small business, she was able to provide a living for her children.

Now she applied for a loan to expand her work by buying more products to sell. She will increase her income so she can help her children to complete their education at universities.

loans.use: To expand her work by buying more products to sell

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
Elma is 53 years old and a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

She has a rice retailing business in the Philippines. Elma requested a PHP 18,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more stock of rice to sell.

Elma has been in this business for six years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of rice

loans.name: Dorn's Group

texts.en:
Dorn is 57 years old and a widower. He has four children. Two of them are living with him in a small village of the Dambae district in Kampong Cham province. His children already have their own work as paid workers. 

Dorn has been growing cassava for 40 years, and now one of his children is helping him out. He is able to save around 5 USD per day. 

He has been with VisionFund, Kiva’s partner, for 9 cycles, including this one. 

Leading his group, he is seeking a loan of 2,000,000 KHR for his cassava plantation. It will be used to buy potash and pesticide, to rent a plot of land, and to hire workers to harvest the yield. 

The profit from the plantation will be invested in expanding the plantation

loans.use: to buy potash and pesticide, to rent a plot of land, and to hire workers to harvest the yield.

loans.name: Song

texts.en:
A 35-year-old mother of three children, Song resides in a rural village of the Kampong Speu province’s Borseth district, Cambodia. 

To support her living, she has been farming rice and working as a tailor. Together, they can earn about KHR 55,000 per day from the current business.
  
This is the third loan for Song with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She is now applying for a loan to buy household supplies for her family's use. 

She hopes this loan will enable her to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy household supplies for her family's use.

loans.name: Phon

texts.en:
Living in a rural village of Dambae district in Kampong Cham province, Phon is 34 years of age and married. She has not had any children yet. Her primary source of income is from her cassava plantation, which she has been doing for 16 years. She is  also a rice farmer. 

This is her first time being a member with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), and she is borrowing a loan of 2,500,000 KHR for her cassava plantation. 

She will use it to rent land, hire workers to plow the field, and to buy fertilizer and cassava stems. 

She wishes to keep expanding her business.

loans.use: to rent land, hire workers to plow the field, and to buy fertilizer and cassava stems

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy welding materials for her son's retail business

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy worn clothing

loans.name: Phat

texts.en:
Phat is a 61-year-old widowed rice farmer and a mother of an only child in her care. So far she has been cultivating rice for over 30 years. 

Her child is 23 years old and works as a supervisor in a hotel. Phat would like to buy a motorcycle for her child to commute to work and for family use, but she lacks the money, so she applied for a loan. 

With this loan, she will have enough finances to buy a motorcycle. Phat plans to buy more farmland to cultivate rice.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle for her child to commute to work and for family use.

loans.name: Las Triunfadoras Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LAS TRIUNFADORAS” iniciará el octavo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Collpani, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Virginia es la Secretaria. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: tienda de barrio, venta de CD’s, venta de salchipapas, venta de ropa, salón de belleza, venta de frazadas, venta de verduras, venta de frutas.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Virginia es integrante, ella indica que hace seis años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de su hija que es cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de zapatillas; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió hace varios años aprendiendo a comprar por docena, con un pequeño capital, para que ella pueda vender por menor.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de zapatillas por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente lo comercializará en su puesto de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es casada y tiene cuatro hijos.  
Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The communal group “Las Triunfadoras” (“The Winners”) will begin its eighth cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Centro Focal de Collpani. The group is composed of eight members and is directed by a group of directors, of which Mrs. Virginia is the Secretary. The businesses that the members of the group bring forward are varied. Among them are: a neighborhood store, selling CDs, selling sausages, selling clothing, a beauty salon, selling blankets, selling vegetables, and selling fruit. 

The loan they are taking will benefit the small micro-entrepreneurs, including the member Virginia. She says that they joined Pro Mujer 6 years ago and that they were admitted by an invitation from her daughter who is a client of the institution. At present, she has a business selling shoes. She learned this business some years ago, learning to buy by the dozen with a little capital, so that she can sell them for less. 

The loan that she takes out now is to increase capital to buy shoes wholesale. She will acquire the shoes from the wholesale sellers in the city of La Paz, and then she will sell them in her sales stand. This type of work allows her to generate resources to support her family financially, since she is married and has four children. 

When she was asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she said that she likes the training the institution offers.

loans.use: to buy shoes wholesale.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 28 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, posee una pequeña tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia desde hace 10 años, tiene muchos clientes por la variedad de productos que comercializa, la joven vive en casa propia con su madre, y esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de más sopas, huevos, granos básicos, refrescos, golosinas, pan dulce, etc. y así poder tener mejores ingresos para una mejor calidad de vida junto con su madre.
texts.en:
This young woman, whose face has been pixelated because she is 28 years old and lives in a high-risk zone, has had a small store in the place where she lives for the past 10 years. She has many customers as a result of the variety of products that she offers. She lives in her own house with her mother.

She is requesting a loan to buy more soups, eggs, basic grains, beverages, snacks, sweet bread, etc. in order to increase her income for a better quality of life with her mother.

loans.use: to buy more soups, eggs, basic grains, beverages, snacks, sweet bread, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy condiments.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 20 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riego, se dedica desde hace 3 años a la cultivo de maíz y frijol, comercializa sus productos en los alrededores de la zona donde reside y tiene muchos clientes pro los buenos precios, las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el joven vive en casa propia con su madre y esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, herbicidas, etc. y mejorar el terreno que muestra en la fotografía para poder continuar con sus cultivos ya que esa es su única fuente de trabajo y así tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: This young man is 20 years old, and his face has been blurred because he lives in a high-risk area. For the past three years, he has worked growing corn and beans. He sells his products in the surrounding areas around the place where he lives, and he has many customers thanks to his good prices. With the earnings he obtains, he is able to cover some expenses of his household. This young man lives with his mother in a house that they own. He is requesting a loan to buy seeds, fertilizers, compost, pest control supplies, herbicides, etc. He will also improve the plot of land shown in the photo, so that he can continue growing his crops, since this is his only source of work, and thus he can improve his income.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, compost, pest control supplies, herbicides, etc., and to improve his land.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 23 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, ella tiene un negocio de salón de belleza desde hace 7 años en su lugar de residencia, tiene mucha clientela pues trabaja muy bien, con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar los gastos de su hogar, la joven vive en casa propia con su madre,  y solicita un crédito a INTEGRAL para poder comprar productos para su salón de belleza como: cremas, shampoo, ganchos para el cabello, tijeras, entre otras cosas que necesita y así podrá obtener mejores ganancias que le ayudaran a tener una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
The young woman, whose face has been pixelated, is 23 years old and lives in a high-risk area. She has had a beauty salon business for 7 years in her home. She has many clients, since she does a good job. With the earnings she gets, she succeeds in paying for her household expenses. The young woman lives in her own house with her mother. 

She requests a loan from Integral so that she can buy products for her beauty salon, including lotions, shampoo, hairpins, and scissors, among other things she needs. Thus, she will be able to obtain better earnings that will help her have more financial stability.

loans.use: to buy products for her beauty salon, including lotions, shampoo, hairpins, and scissors, among other things.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en: Robert lives in Masindi, Uganda. He runs a bar and hotel, which he started to support his family. He is a hardworking man who needs a credit facility to renovate his hotel. Robert hopes to improve his business despite the hardships of high license fees and competition that affect his business.

loans.use: to renovate his hotel.

loans.name: Ousmane

texts.fr:
Monsieur Ousmane fait parti des premiers clients de ce guichet. Il a déjà bénéficié de cinq crédits à l’IMCEC. Ousmane s’active dans le domaine de l’agriculture depuis plus de 10 ans, il fait spécialement du stockage de céréales. Il va donc acheter des produits alimentaires agricoles : du mil, de l’arachide, des haricots pour stocker durant quelques mois et pouvoir le revendre à un prix nettement plus intéressant. Les charges familiales lui incombent et l’éducation de ses enfants. Ousmane est très assidu, il travaille de 8h à 18h. Il faut aussi noter que les crédits octroyés depuis le début jusqu’à maintenant lui ont permis de diversifier les produits et services.
Ce qu’il aimerait plus c’est d’accroitre son activité commerciale et augmenter son capital.
texts.en:
Mr. Ousmane is one of the first clients of this branch.  He has already received five loans from IMCEC. Ousmane has been active in the field of agriculture for more than 10 years. He specializes in the storage of grains.  He will buy food products: millet, peanuts and beans to store for a few months and then resell them for a more interesting net price.  

The family costs and the education of his children fall to him. Ousmane is very hard working, he works from 8am - 6:00pm.  Also, the loans that he has been granted since the beginning until now have allowed him to diversify his products and services.  What he would like most is to grow his commercial activity and increase his capital.

loans.use: to buy agricultural products to stock and resell later.

loans.name: Bwasiri Women Group

texts.en:
Teddy lives in Kyenjojo, Uganda and is the mother of five children who are all going to school. She deals in retail, selling general merchandise, and also does farming, growing tea, to supplement her income. She ventured into business to generate income.

Teddy has a dream of building a house for her family despite the challenge she faces of defaulters who fail to pay. She is a member of a village bank where members guarantee each another to get a loan. Teddy intends to use the loan to buy more salt and sugar for her retail business to sell.

loans.use: to buy more salt and sugar for her retail business to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cylinders of gas and a motorcycle.

loans.name: Hai's Group

texts.en:
29-year-old Hai is married with three young children. One of them is in primary school and the other two have not started school yet. They are all living in a rural village in the Dambae district of Kampong Cham province.

To support the family, Hai has been growing cassava for 11 years. She manages to earn roughly 12 USD each day.

In this, her fifth cycle with VisionFund, Kiva’s partner, and as the leader of her group, Hai is seeking a loan of 3,000,000 KHR to buy fertilizer and pesticide and to hire workers to work on the farm and to harvest. Next year, she plans to buy another piece of land for her plantation.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticide and to hire workers to work on her farm and to harvest

loans.name: Guadalupe

texts.es: Don Guadalupe de 35 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y su hijo, el se dedica desde hace 20 años a la siembra de maíz, maicillo y frijol, sus productos los comercializa en los diferentes mercados que están cerca de su casa gracias a las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas logra salir adelante, el esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de fertilizantes abonos, controles de plagas, herbicidas, pesticidas, etc. asi como muestra en la fotografía para poder tener un buen cultivo y darle su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
35-year old Sr. Guadalupe lives in his own house with his wife and son. For 20 years he has been a farmer growing maize, sorghum, and beans. He sells his crops in the different markets near his house. Thanks to the money he earns he is managing to get ahead.

Guadalupe is seeking a loan to buy fertilizer, manure, insecticide, herbicide etc. As can be seen in the photo, by using these products he will get a good crop and then be able to provide his family with a better standard of living.

loans.use: buy fertilizer, manure, insecticide, herbicide etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more thyme seeds for his farm.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is a hardworking 26-year-old farmer from Nyamira region of Kenya. Janet is married: she has been for eight years but she doesn't have kids. What she has, however, is three years of experience in farming, a 3.5-acre piece of land, two dairy cows, poultry, tea and banana crops. 

Janet is seeking a 30,000 Kenyan shilling loan from Kiva lenders to purchase cereal grains. Having a stock of cereals is of great importance to any rural farmer in Kenya: the seeds can be planted and harvested after a season. Cereal grains can be aggregated from other farmers at local prices, transported to urban markets, and sold for a better price. The profit margin will enable the farmer to repay the loan plus interest and still have some money left over for personal use. Returns from this investment will be used by Janet to further grow her business and set her financial obligations straight.

loans.use: to pay for cereal grains

loans.name: Heang's Group

texts.en:
Heang is a resident of the Dambae district of Kampong Cham province. She is a 30-year-old wife and mother of two young children. One of her children is attending primary school. Her main source of income is from planting cassava, which she has been doing for 12 years, and her secondary source of income is from her rice farm.

Heang is leading a group that consists of three women. It is her second loan with Kiva’s partner VisionFund, and she is seeking a 1,000,000 KHR loan to buy fertilizer and pesticide as well as to hire workers to plough the field for her cassava plantation. She hopes to expand the land for growing cassava.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticide as well as to hire workers to plough the field for her cassava plantation.

loans.name: Milagro De Jesus

texts.es: Milagro de 36 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo, ella se dedica a la venta de pan francés, con las ventas que realiza y la ayuda de su esposo logran salir adelante con los gastos del hogar, ella quiere mejorar su vivienda cambiando puertas,  techo y  repellando paredes peor con lo que obtiene de sus ventas no le alcanza para realizarlo por esa razón solicita un crédito para la compra de cemento, arena, puertas, laminas, polines y pago de mano de obra y asi ella y su esposo puedan vivir mas cómodos y seguros.
texts.en:
36-year old Milagro lives in her own house with her husband. She earns her living selling French bread. With the money she earns, she helps her husband with household expenses.

Milagro wishes to improve her house by replacing doors, the roof, and repairing the worst walls. She cannot afford to do this from what she earns so she is seeking a loan to buy cement, sand, doors, roof sheeting, beams, and to pay for the work to be done. Then she and her husband will be more comfortable and safer.

loans.use: buy cement, sand, doors, roof sheeting, beams, and to pay workers

loans.name: Dolores

texts.es:
La señora Dolores vive en una aldea Santa Cruz al norte de Honduras, vive con sus hijos y se dedica a la venta de pollo con tajadas y venta de tortillas,  lo cual los vende en su casa de habitación ya que por la ubicación de su vivienda, su negocio es muy prospero.

Doña Dolores está solicitando el préstamo para la compra de mesas, sillas, manteles, etc. mobiliario para atender de mejorar forma a sus clientes, espera que esta inversión le permita salir adelante con su negocio y su familia.

Doña Dolores uno de sus sueños es hacer una glorieta para la venta de estos productos más acondicionada para dar mejor atención a su clientela.


                                                                                                                                                                                            

Santa Cruz de Yojoa, Honduras -  Enero del 2015
texts.en:
Sra. Dolores lives with her children in the community of Santa Cruz in the north of Honduras. She sells chicken pieces and tortillas from her home. Because of the good location of her house, her business is very prosperous.

Dolores is seeking a loan to buy tables, chairs, tablecloths etc, furniture that will make her customers more comfortable. She hopes that this investment will allow her, her business, and family to get ahead.

One of her dreams is to build an air-conditioned food stand from which to sell her products, and give her customers even better service.

Santa Cruz de Yojoa, Honduras -  January 2015

loans.use: buy tables, chairs, tablecloths etc.

loans.name: Alassane

texts.fr:
L’emprunteur s’appelle Alassane ; il est marié et père de 4 enfants dont l’ainé est âgé de 15 ans. Il est membre à l’IMCEC il n’y a pas longtemps. Il vient demander un crédit afin de renforcer son fond de roulement. Son commerce consiste à vendre des chaussures en plastiques et en cuir. Il possède un traineau dans lequel il met sa marchandise et le promène dans le garage où il vend. Il a une expérience de 10 ans dans ce domaine. Il travaille de 7h du matin à 20h du soir. Il nourrit sa famille grâce à son activité. 
Alassane désire fructifier son capital afin de pouvoir louer un local pour s’y installer.
texts.en:
This borrower's name is Alassane. He is married and has four children, the eldest of whom is 15 years old. He joined IMCEC recently. He just applied for a credit to bolster his working capital. He works as a vendor selling plastic and leather. shoes. He has a cart where he puts his merchandise and brings it  to his sales stand. He has 10 years of experience in this field. He works from 7 AM to 8 PM. He supports his family thanks to this business.
Alassane would like to grow his capital in order to be able to lease a store and start selling there.

loans.use: to buy plastic and leather shoes for resale.

loans.name: Marietta

texts.en:
Marietta and her husband help each other to uplift their living condition. While her husband works as a driver, Marietta runs her piggery business. She started her hog-raising business as her way of helping her husband provide for their needs.

Through her business, Marietta has been able to meet all of her four children's needs in school when they are studying. Now, she wishes to save some of her earnings for the future as they are getting older.

Marietta wishes to continue operating the business as long as she can manage it. Therefore, she is requesting a loan of PHP 50,000 to buy feed and vaccines for the maintenance of her hogs. She will do her best to make her wish come true.

loans.use: to buy feed and vaccines for the maintenance of her hogs.

loans.name: Mehrangez

texts.en:
Mehrangez is a clever person. She was born in 1995. She is living in a remote district. She is single and lives with her parents.

She is a student and is studying at university; her major is making programs and pedagogies. It is her second year of studies. Mehrangez is active in her classes and well known among friends and students.

Her family does not earn enough to pay her university tuition fees. She requested financial support from Kiva to pay for her education.

loans.use: to pay her university tuition fee.

loans.name: Channea's Group

texts.en: Channea, 32 years of age and married, resides in a village in Dambae district of Kampong Cham province. She has two children who are dependent on her. Her main source of income is from her cassava plantation, and the secondary source is from her rice farm. Channea is the leader of her group that has three members. This is her sixth time being a member with VisionFund, Kiva’s partner. She is pursuing a loan of 2,000,000 KHR to hire workers to plough the land, and to buy fertilizer and cassava stems for her plantation. She wants her children to get a good education, and she wishes for her family's living conditions to be improved.

loans.use: to hire workers to plough the land, and to buy fertilizer and cassava stems for her plantation

loans.name: Samut's Group

texts.en:
A villager of Dambae district in Kampong Cham province, 21 year-old Samut is married and blessed with one daughter, whose age is under six years old. She has a cassava plantation, and it enables her to earn around  USD 7.00 per day. 

As a member with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for the fourth time and as the leader of her group, Samut is applying for a 1,000,000 KHR loan for her plantation. It will be spent on hiring workers to plough the field and harvest the crops, and on buying fertilizer and pesticide. 

Her goal is to buy another piece of land for growing cassava.

loans.use: to hire workers to plough the field and harvest the crops, and to buy fertilizer and pesticide.

loans.name: Evan

texts.en:
Evan is 45 years old and from Kigondo, Buhweju District. He is a married man with 10 children and only four of them are school going. He is a principled and hardworking businessman who has a grocery store that is located in the above-mentioned locality. He works in his grocery for six days a week and eight hours a day.

Evan also operates a matooke (green plantain) line of business in Buhweju, and it is run by his wife. He resorted to a grocery after buying a piece of land from his small savings as a matooke trader. He immediately started a grocery to get an income in his family. He also earns a monthly salary as a teacher.

He started his grocery business in the year 2007, and it has been very profitable despite challenges of competition from the mini and large supermarkets around the area. Most of his clients are people from all walks of life in the neighboring area. He is borrowing UGX 3,000,000 only to buy more groceries to sell. 

He hopes to educate all of his children and to be financially stable later. He asks UGAFODE to remain in business and live long.

loans.use: to buy groceries to sell

loans.name: Yasmeen

texts.en:
Yasmeen is 45-year-old woman, who lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her five children. Her husband has been working in a public sector organization for many years, and he is responsible for fulfilling the needs of the family. Yasmeen is also providing sewing services, and earning an income to contribute, along with her husband, to managing the household. 

She needs several kinds of goods, e.g., needles, thread, pieces of cloth, machine oil, etc. for her business purposes, but, due to insufficient financial means, she is unable to purchase these items. Therefore, she has applied for Kiva loan from its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.  This loan will enable her to purchase these above items, and also will be helpful for her to increase her monthly sales and profit by providing better sewing services.

Yasmeen is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase supplies to increase her tailoring business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to finish paying for his motorcycle.

loans.name: Kamil

texts.en:
Kamil is 49 years old and married with a son and a daughter. His wife is a teacher at a local school and earns a small amount of money. Kamil is a gardener and raises seasonal fruits and vegetables. He has worked in this area for twenty years and earns only 180 AZN. He raises a harvest and sells it at a local bazaar or to local restaurants and cafes.

Kamil's garden is small, and he wants to enlarge his garden. He has a small piece of land and wants to raise additional trees, fruits, and vegetables there.

He supplied the ground for the garden, trees, and fruit seeds. Now he needs money to buy and install a garden irrigation system. He applied for a 1,200 AZN loan in order to buy an irrigation system and install it

loans.use: to buy an irrigation system and install it in his garden.

loans.name: Hareb

texts.en:
Hareb is an 18-year-old married man who works in an auto repair shop with a limited salary to cover the needs and expenses of his family. He is an ambitious man and a hard worker who is trying hard to improve their living conditions.

Thus he is acquiring a youth loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to start his own auto repair business and to buy the necessary toolkit to facilitate his business and provide his customers with better and quick service.

Hareb hopes to expand his business more in the future and become totally independent to increase his income and improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to start his own auto repair business and to buy the necessary toolkit

loans.name: Anush

texts.en:
Anush is 52-year-old married woman from a small village called Akhkepri. She lives with her pensioner mother-in-law, husband and son, who works as a tractor driver, and earns approximately 400 GEL. 

To take care of her family’s everyday needs, Anush is engaged in small agricultural business. Her husband sells agricultural products in the local market, and gets a small income from this activity. However, the family finds it hard to cover all daily expenses, and requires a more stable income to improve their living conditions. 

Anush requested a loan for a business start-up. After several unsuccessful attempts, she applied for the credit to MFO Credo. Her request was approved in the framework of the Start Up program, which is joint initiative with Kiva, permitting the rural poor to start or re-start businesses. With the money, Anush will purchase a special tractor and make it work on a private orders. The business will help the family to generate significant income, especially during the season, and that will help them to meet all basic needs more effectively.

Anush and her family rely on the good will of Kiva lenders, and will highly appreciate their support and kindness.

loans.use: to buy a special tractor and establish significant source of income.

loans.name: Margarine

texts.en:
Margarine, 45, is a progressive smallholder farmer from a very remote village in the Kapsowar region of Kenya. Margarine majors in dairy, but also cultivates crops across the steep contours of the mountainous landscapes of the area.

Margarine is seeking a small loan from Kiva lenders to finance the cultivation of more crops on her farm in the coming season. Initial loan repayments towards this loan will come from the dairy income until the crop yields are ready for market.

loans.use: to cultivate crops

loans.name: Peter's Group

texts.en:
Peter, pictured above, has eleven children and is always described as a very friendly person, which is why he was selected to become the group leader of his group. Peter is representing his group of seven farmers in Kakamega North District and is happy to be working with One Acre Fund for the first time this year.

Peter has been a farmer for twenty years and, in order to earn enough to feed his family, he decided to join the One Acre Fund program this season. His loan will not only include farming inputs, but also a solar light, which he is very happy to be getting as that means he will now reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. With the profits from this coming season, Peter is planning to invest in a business.

A total of 3.5 acres will be planted by Peter's Group, and between them they will receive a total of seven solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, as well as a solar light.

loans.name: Nael

texts.en:
Nael is a 27-year-old single man from a village near the city of Nablus. He lives with his family in a small house. Nael is a worker in a furniture workshop. He gets a low income. The family has some agricultural land that Nael would like to plant with some fruits and vegetables.

Nael took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy some farming tools for his new farming business. By taking this loan, Nael will be able to improve the family's living conditions and increase his income. 

Nael appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy some farming tools for his new farming business.

loans.name: Hasan

texts.en:
Hasan is a 25-year-old married man from a village near Nablus.  He lives with his wife and three kids, two sons and one daughter, in a small house.  Hasan works as an employee in a local firm. He also has agricultural land, which Hasan has planted for the past five years.

Hasan took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy more seedlings and fertilizers for his farm.  By taking this loan, Hasan will be able to improve the family's living conditions and increase their income.

Hasan appears in the photo in his farm

loans.use: to buy more seedlings and fertilizers for his farm.

loans.name: Touch's Group

texts.en:
Touch is a single, middle-aged woman, who lives in a rural village of Dambae district of Kampong Cham province. To earn a living, Touch has been growing cassava for 25 years. She is also a rice farmer. 

As a new member of VisionFund, Kiva’s partner, and the leader of her group of three, Touch is seeking a loan of 1,400,000 KHR to buy potash and rice seed for her plantation. She hopes that it will produce a higher yield.

loans.use: to buy potash and rice seed for her farm.

loans.name: Naila

texts.en:
Naila is a 29-year-old woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, with her one child. Her husband has been working for a public sector organization for many years. He is responsible for fulfilling the needs of the family. Naila is also providing sewing services and earning income to contribute with her husband to managing the household. 

Naila is in need of different kinds of goods, e.g., needles, thread, pieces of cloth, machine oil, and etc., for her business, but due to insufficient financial means, she is unable to purchase these accessories. Therefore, she has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her to purchase these accessories and will also help her to increase monthly sales and profit by providing better sewing services.

Naila is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her tailoring business

loans.name: Hen's Group

texts.en:
Fifty-four-year-old Hen is a wife and a mother of five. Only one of her children is living with her in Kang Meas district of Kampong Cham province.

For 36 years, she has been a rice farmer to support the family. She also helps the villagers with harvesting their crops in order to earn additional income. She manages to save around 6 USD a day.

This is her first time being a member with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Leading her group, Hen is seeking a 1,000,000 KHR loan to buy potash for her farmland.

The profit from her rice farm will be used to buy a motorcycle.

loans.use: to buy potash for her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Kang Meas District

loans.name: Chech's Group

texts.en:
32-year-old Chech is a villager from a small town of Dambae district in Kampong Cham province. She is married with five young children. Three of the children are still under six years of age and the other two are primary school students. 

To make a living, Chech has been planting cassava for 12 years, while sometimes being a paid-worker to earn extra income. She manages to save approximately 4 USD daily. This is her fourth loan with VisionFund, Kiva’s partner, and she is leading her group of two. 

Chech is seeking a loan of 1,500,000 KHR to buy potash and insecticide, and to hire workers to plough the land for her cassava plantation. She wishes to expand her plantation land.

loans.use: to buy potash and insecticide, and to hire workers to plough the land

loans.name: Vath's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural village of Dambae district of Kampong Cham province, Vath is 24 years old and married. She has one little daughter that has not started school yet. To finance the family, she has been managing a cassava plantation for six years now. She is able to earn almost 7 USD every day. 

Vath is the leader of her group and she is applying for a loan of 2,000,000 KHR from Kiva's partner (VisionFund) to buy fertilizer and insecticide, and to hire workers to plough the land for her cassava plantation. She wishes that with the profit from this year's yield, she can buy another piece of land for growing more cassava.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and insecticide, and to hire workers to plough the land for her cassava plantation.

loans.name: Muong Phang 22 Group

texts.en:
Mr. Thuong, 24, lives with one sister and two brothers in an old traditional Thai house. Their parents have passed away. They rely on agricultural production for a living. Because of the instability of agriculture, they diversify their activities to include crop cultivation and animal husbandry. They grow rice and vegetables, and they breed chickens, pigs, and fish. They always want to expand production to improve income. 

This is the first time that Mr. Thuong has taken out a loan from the Program. He will use the loan to buy young fish and food for them to expand their fish farming operation. He hopes that his investment will be prosperous so that he can significantly improve the income for the family and better support his sister and brothers. He dreams his and his siblings' lives will be more abundant and that they will soon escape from poverty. In the picture, he stands at the first from the right.

loans.use: to buy young fish and food for the them

loans.name: Aliya

texts.en:
Aliya is a 33-year-old married mother of two children who has been working from her house since 2000, selling women's and children's clothes and underwear, in addition to summer and winter bedsheets and blankets. Aliya is a hardworking woman who supports her husband in covering their family's increasing living needs and children's education fees. Her business is going on just fine, but unfortunately the acquired income is not enough to cover unexpected living needs. 

Today, Aliya is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to do necessary maintenance at her house to keep it a healthy living place, in addition to getting an iron main door for security reasons. She hopes that in the future she can open a separate shop outside her house, where she can display her merchandise in a better attracting way, and improve her selling.

loans.use: To do necessary maintenance at her house to keep it a healthy living place, in addition to getting an iron main door for security reasons

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 26 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, se dedica al cultivo de maíz desde hace 6 años, cuando su cosecha ya esta lista la almacena en los graneros y sacos que muestra la fotografía para luego comercializarlos en los diferentes mercados que están cerca de su casa, el joven vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, herbicidas, etc. y asi poder seguir con su trabajo y tener junto con su grupo familiar una mejor estabilidad económica
texts.en: The young man whose face is pixilated, because he is 26 years old and lives in a high-risk area, has been growing corn for 6 years. When his harvest is ready, he stores it in the grain storage container and sacks that are shown in the photo and later sells it in the various markets that are near his house. He lives in his own house with his family members. He is requesting the loan to buy seeds, fertilizers, manure, pesticides, herbicides, etc. so he can continue with his work and have, along with his family, improved economic stability.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, manure, pesticides, herbicides, etc.

loans.name: Rafael

texts.es:
Rafael es un hombre de 56 años de edad, casado, con hijos independientes, y su negocio es el transporte de material de construcción en camión.
Él es emprendedor, independiente, paciente, constante, responsable y trabajador. Su trabajo lo desarrolla en la zona ‘Kalajahuira’ ubicada al noroeste de la ciudad, se constituye en la zona más grande del municipio, de clima frio y seco con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 2-16 grados centígrados.
Rafael es de tez morena, cabello negro corto, baja estatura, ojos obscuros, complexión física robusta, su lengua materna es al Aymará que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el trabajo que realiza. su vida la comparte con su esposa que se dedica a la venta de comida, sus hijos son independientes y tienen sus familias. Vive en una casa propia construida de ladrillo con techo de calamina que cuenta con electricidad, agua potable y alcantarillado. Su negocio es el transporte de material de construcción; él se encarga de transportar en su camión, tierra, piedras, madera, cemento, todo tipo de material que se usa en la construcción, labor que realiza todos los días de la semana y a toda hora según las necesidades de sus contratistas. “realizo este trabajo casi toda mi vida, comencé como ayudante de volqueta, cargando arena y piedras, posteriormente me independicé y con un préstamo obtuve mi camión que es mi principal herramienta de trabajo…” comenta. Su sueño es ayudar a sus hijos a que sean profesionales, él desea realizar mantenimiento a su camión mediante la compra de 4 llantas, ya que las que tiene actualmente están desgastadas y ya no le brindan la seguridad necesaria para trabajar. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 36 años que viene desarrollando esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Rafael solicita un préstamo para cambiar las llantas a su camión y trabajar de forma segura.
texts.en:
Rafael is a 56-year-old man who is married with children, who now live independently. His business is transporting construction material by truck.

He is an entrepreneur, independent, patient, constant, responsible, and hard working. His work is carried out in the Kalajahuira zone, located northeast of the city. This is the largest zone in the municipality, with a cold and dry climate and a temperature that varies daily between 2- 16 degrees centigrade.

Rafael's skin is dark, his hair black and short, his stature short, his eyes dark, and his physical complexion robust. His mother tongue is Aymara which he speaks among family, while speaking Spanish in the general culture. He shares the work with his wife who sells meals. Their children are independent and have their own families. Rafael lives in his own house, constructed of bricks with a sheet metal roof, and has electricity, potable water, and plumbing. 

 His business involves transporting construction materials. He does this in his own truck, hauling earth, stone, wood, cement, and all types of materials used in construction everyday and at all hours, as required by the contractors. “I have done this nearly all my life,” he says, “starting as an assistant hauler, lugging sand and stones; later, I became independent and, with the help of a loan, I obtained my own truck, which is my principal work tool,” he commented.

This is Rafael's first sequence of loans with this institution during the 36 years he has been developing this activity. That is why he is requesting a loan – to change the tires on his truck so that he can work with greater security.

Rafael's dream is to help his children to become professionals. He wants to conduct maintenance on his truck, purchasing four new tires, because the present tires are worn out and can no longer provide the necessary security for work.

loans.use: to change the tires on his truck and work in a more secure form.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more seedlings and fertilizers for the farm

loans.name: Chanthy

texts.en:
Chanthy is aged 30 and married with three children. Her family lives in a village of the Borseth district of Kampong Spue province, and she earns a living through farming rice, while her husband works as a security guard to earn an extra income for the family. 

Chanthy is an existing client of VisionFund, and she has received loans for two cycles. The past loans have helped her family relieve financial burden to a great extent. 

Now, she is applying for a loan to buy household supplies for her family to use. She hopes to have enough materials for her family to use.

loans.use: to buy household supplies for her family to use.

loans.name: Emmy

texts.en:
Emmy is a 35-year-old married father of three children aged 5, 4, and 1; none are school-going. He is a driver involved in the transport business, where he works for twelve hours a day.

He started the transport business way back in 2009 after completing the driving school program. This transport business is all done on the Ishaka-Mbarara highway located in southwestern Uganda. He started this business to generate his own income and an income for his now-growing family.

Apart from the transport business, he has no other source of income, since he is ever on the road transporting people from all walks of life, since these people are his main clients.

This is his first loan from UGAFODE Microfinance. He is borrowing UGX 1,000,000 to buy construction materials in the form of cement, sand, and shutters to finish construction of his family house, since he is now in a rental house. He hopes the completion will cut expenses spent on rent so he will be able to educate his siblings and children.

His main challenges are traffic officers on the road who halt his car due to excess passengers, yet he needs that extra money if he has to adequately meet his family’s needs. He says he is an honest man of God, and most of his daily customers love his way of doing business. He appreciates UGAFODE and Kiva lenders for being willing to give him a loan to finish his family’s house, since it has been his New Year’s resolution.

Pictured are Emmy with his wife at the house under construction.

loans.use: to buy building materials.

loans.name: Sokun

texts.en:
Sokun, 47, is married and living with her family in a village of the Borseth district of Kampong Spue province, Cambodia. She has three children.

For the last twenty years, Sokun and her husband have been farming rice as the main source of the family’s income to make a living. Together, they can earn about 28,000 KHR per day from the current business.

Sokun has been with VisionFund for three cycles, and now she is applying for a loan to buy fertilizers for her farmland. She hopes to make more income from her current business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farmland.

loans.name: Keav

texts.en:
A citizen from a rural village of Kampong Speu province’s Borseth district, Keav is age 47 years and married. She has one son who is in school. To feed her family, she has worked hard as a rice farmer for 29 years. The current business earns her about 30,000 riels per day. 

Keav has been with VisionFund for seven cycles. The past loans have helped her gradually improve her living conditions. Now she is asking for a loan to buy household supplies for using in her family. She hopes to better her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy household supplies for using in her family

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine, 41, is a dairy farmer from the Koibatek area in the Rift Valley Province of Kenya. Koibatek is known for its hilly landscape and love for dairy farming. 
Christine enjoys dairy farming. She and a small group of farmers joined Juhudi Kilimo, which is Kiva's field partner, to access funds and improve their livelihoods. Christine is seeking a loan to purchase barbed wire and install a fence around her property. To her, putting in a fence is very important as it sets boundaries for outsiders and controls the movement of her farm animals within the property. Due to the steep contour of her farm, the fence will ensure that the cows stay within their fairly-level grazing zones.

loans.use: to purchase barbed wire to fence her farm

loans.name: Benemerito Group

texts.es:
En una comunidad del centro de México donde floreció y se asentó la cultura mazahua, se conformó un grupo para solicitar un préstamo a VisionFund México. Actualmente, aún quedan rastros de la cultura indígena que se percibe en los trajes típicos de colores que llevan las mujeres, la lengua y algunas tradiciones. Los integrantes del grupo "Benemérito" orgullosos de sus raíces, también tienen la fortuna de vivir entre montañas cubiertas de árboles que ofrecen aire fresco a la población y una vista espectacular.

Elvira pertenece al grupo "Benemérito", es una joven muy alegre que vive con Horacio, su pareja, y su pequeña hija de 2 años. Ella se dedica a criar y vender borregos desde hace dos años que fue cuando también solicitó su primer préstamo a VisionFund México. Elvira decidió seguir los pasos de sus padres y la actividad más común del lugar donde vive. Recientemente vendió los 4 animales que tenía y ahora necesita un nuevo préstamo para comprar 4 borregos más para continuar con su negocio.

"Me agrada mucho tener mi préstamo porque me ayuda a tener mi propia actividad" comentó Elvira a quien le gustaría solicitar un monto más alto en un futuro para abrir una pequeña tienda y tener una entrada continua de dinero. Con la venta de borregos sólo puede ver ingresos hasta 4 meses después de adquirir los animales, pero para ella es indispensable tener un poco de dinero cada semana y para lograrlo, sabe que necesita esforzarse un poco más. 

Al hablar acerca de sus sueños, Elvira quisiera tener una casa propia ya que por el momento vive con sus suegros. Además, también tiene la ilusión de volver a la escuela para superarse pues sólo pudo terminar la secundaria. 

Las demás integrantes de "Benemérito" también tienen sus propias actividades para apoyar a su pareja a solventar los gastos de la familia. Trinidad quiere invertir en su tienda de abarrotes; Yolanda, en mercería, estambres y tela; Elena, en la venta de mandiles; Aurea y Teresa, en la cría de becerros: Esther, en la producción de carpetas para proteger documentos y Matilde, en la cría de pollos.

*En la imagen: las integrantes en una calle de la comunidad mazahua. Elvira se encuentra de pie y viste una chamarra negra.
texts.en:
In a community in central Mexico, where the Mazahua culture lived and flourished, a loan group got started to request a loan from VisionFund México. Nowadays, there are still traces of the indigenous culture that can be seen in the colorful traditional dresses that the women wear, the language, and some traditions. The members of the group “Benemérito” are proud of their roots. They also have the good fortune of living among mountains that are covered with trees, which provide clean air to the population and a spectacular view. 

Elvira belongs to the “Benemérito” group. She is a cheerful young woman who lives with Horacio, her partner, and her 2 year-old daughter. She has been raising and selling yearling sheep for two years, when she also requested her first loan from VisionFund México. Elvira decided to follow her parents’ footsteps in the most common line of business in the area where she lives. She recently sold 4 animals and now needs a new loan to buy 4 more young sheep to continue with her business. 

“I am very pleased to have my loan because it helps me to have my own business,” Elvira explained. She would like to request a larger amount in the future in order to open a small store and have a continuous income. With yearling sheep sales, she can only receive income 4 months after acquiring the animals, but for her it’s essential to have a little bit of money every week, and in order to achieve this, she knows she needs to make more effort.

When talking about her dreams, Elvira explains she’d like to have her own house, because for now she lives with her in-laws. She also has a dream of returning to school in order to get ahead, because she was only able to finish junior high school. 

The other members of “Benemérito” also have their own businesses to help their partners provide for the family expenses. Trinidad wants to invest in her grocery store; Yolanda in sewing supplies, yarns, and fabric; Elena in embroidered apron sales; Aurea and Teresa in raising young cattle; Esther in the manufacture of folders to protect documents; and Matilde in raising chickens. 

*In the photo: the members are in a street in the community of Mazahua. Elvira is standing and wearing a black coat.

loans.use: to buy four young sheep.

location.town: Pueblo Nuevo de los Angeles, El Oro.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more seedlings and fertilizers for the family farm.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more seedlings and fertilizers for the farm.

loans.name: Marichu

texts.en:
Marichu is 46 years old and married with three children, all of whom are in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Marichu runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

She has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap, canned goods and other groceries. 

In the future, Marichu would like to save enough money so that she can continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en: Harriet lives in Masindi-Uganda. She is married with four children, three of whom attend school. She sells produce such as groundnuts and has a grinding machine that earns her income. She also does farming to boost her businesses. She always sells her products to the local market. She faces a challenge of bad roads that make transporting her produce difficult. Harriet wants a loan to buy more groundnuts to sell.

loans.use: to buy more groundnuts to sell.

loans.name: Edward

texts.en: Edward lives in Hoima, Uganda. He is aged 34 and married with six children whose ages range from 14 to 5 years. All of the children attend school. He deals in brewing local alcohol called waragi and supplements it with income from farming. He will use the loan to buy more inputs for waragi brewing.

loans.use: to buy more inputs for waragi brewing.

loans.name: Milly

texts.en: Milly is a 38-year-old married female, a hardworking woman who sells general merchandise like salt and soap, among others, in Masindi, Uganda. She needs a loan to complete her house by roofing it. Her major clients are the general public and she hopes to complete her house, though competition and price fluctuations are still a hindrance to her business growth.

loans.use: to complete her house by roofing it.

loans.name: Sinoeurn's Group

texts.en:
21-year-old Sinoeurn is married with two young children. They are living in a village of Dambae district, Kampong Cham province. To support the family, Sinoeurn has been planting cassava for three years. In addition, she owns a rubber plantation that helps bring extra income to the family. 

As a new member of VisionFund, Kiva’s partner, and the leader of her group, Sinoeurn is applying for a 1,400,000 KHR loan to buy fertilizer, pesticide, and to hire workers to work on the cassava plantation. She plans to expand the land for cassava plantation and she hopes that all of her kids will receive all the education they need.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, pesticide, and to hire workers to work on the cassava plantation

loans.name: Vechna's Group

texts.en:
Vechna is a 31-year-old villager of Cheung Prey district of Kampong Cham province. She is married with one young daughter. She has been a rice farmer for 12 years, and she also raises ducks to sell. She manages to save about $7 US per day. 

As a new member and the leader of her group, Vechna is applying for a 1,000,000 riel loan to buy rice seed and duck feed. She hopes that she will have enough capital for future investment in her rice farm.

loans.use: to buy rice seed and duck feed

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Getrude's Group

texts.en:
Getrude, pictured above, has been a farmer for more than 20 years, and is now proud to represent her group of 11 farmers in Kakamega North District. She is 49 years old, married and has 10 children.

Getrude likes to think of herself as a very hardworking individual. She has been working alongside One Acre Fund since 2013 and decided to represent her group because she wanted to help more farmers. She says that being part of the One Acre Fund community has meant that she has been able to consistently feed her family. Getrude plans to use the profits from this coming season to send her children to school.

In total, Getrude’s Group will receive inputs to cultivate 5.5 acres of land. Given that some members of the group will also be purchasing a solar light, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of 9 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize

loans.name: Pen's Group

texts.en:
A resident of Dambae district, Kampong Cham province, Pen is a 49 year old married woman with one child. Her child is already independent from her.

For 31 years, Pen has been growing cassava and cashew nuts in order to support her family. This is her third loan with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Leading her group, she is seeking a loan of 500,000 KHR to hire a worker to plough the field and to buy fertilizer and insecticide for the cassava plantation. She hopes that her plantation will be productive so that she can buy another piece of land for growing cassava.

loans.use: to hire a worker to plough the field and to buy fertilizer and insecticide for the cassava plantation.

loans.name: Kosal's Group

texts.en:
Kosal is a 22-year-old married woman with a little daughter. They are villagers of Dambae district, Kampong Cham province.

Her primary source of income is from planting cassava and she can earn extra from her rice farm. She is able to earn just above 6 USD a day.

As a new member and the leader of her group, Kosal is seeking a 1,400,000 KHR loan to hire workers to plough and work on the cassava farm as well as to buy fertilizer for the plantation. She hopes that her plantation will be fruitful so that her family's financial situation will be improved.

loans.use: to hire workers to plough and work on cassava farm as well as to buy fertilizer for the plantation

loans.name: Jorm

texts.en:
Jorm, 35, lives with her husband and three children in a rural village of the Borseth district, Cambodia. To feed the family, Jorm and her husband earn a living as farmers. They have been farming rice for 16 years. To supplement their income, she also weaves baskets, earning about 30,500 KHR per day to spend for the family’s needs.

This is Jorm’s third loan with VisionFund. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan to buy household supplies such as bowls, pots and glasses etc. for her family to use. She hopes this loan will enable her to have enough materials to use in her family.

loans.use: to buy household supplies

loans.name: John

texts.en:
Rev John, aged 46 years, is married with four children aged 24, 22, 19 and 15. He lives in Nyakabirizi, Igara Bushenyi district in Uganda. This is his first loan cycle with UGAFODE. He is an agriculturalist who deals mostly in plantains and pineapples. He works eight hours a day, six days a week, since he has to spend the Sunday at church preaching the word of God to people. 

He started this agribusiness in 2004 to have an income as his family was growing. Apart from the agriculture he does six days a week, he also earns a salary from the church where he leads service every Sunday. That helps to complement the earnings from the agriculture he does. 

He is borrowing UGX 2,000,000 to buy mulch for his banana plantation and manure for his pineapple plantation. Most of his clients are people from around his area and traders from the capital city, especially hotels and fruit centers. He hopes to educate the two of his four children that are now in school. He is affected by weather, especially the dry season, where the matooke ripens and has a low market. He is so hardworking and gives thanks to the institution for the help that he got and promises to be a good client.

loans.use: To buy organic manure

loans.name: Janeit Group

texts.en:
Hasna is the featured borrower for Janeit Group. She got together with her other group members to take this Al Majmoua loan because they have always been neighbors and friends. They are working hard to develop their businesses and living at the same time.

Hasna is a 44-year-old married Syrian mother of six children who started selling accessories from her house a year ago to help her husband in covering the needs and expenses of their family.  Hasna is a hard worker who is trying desperately to develop her business and improve her family's living conditions. Thus she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to increase her business merchandise with a new collection of special accessories to satisfy her customers' needs, especially in the upcoming Mother's Day. 

Hasna is the lady sitting in the middle. With respect to the other group members, Nabila is a 39-year-old married mother of one child who wants to buy new furniture for her house, while Elham is a 47-year-old single lady who wants to renovate her house. Nabila is the first lady on the left, and Elham is the first lady on the right of the photo.

loans.use: to increase her merchandise with new collection of special accessories

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim is a 27-year-old single Palestinian refugee, who has lived and worked since he was born in a Palestinian refugee camp. Ibrahim has run his business since 2007, and he deals in selling and fixing wheels.

Ibrahim is acquiring a third loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, where he proved to be a good-standing borrower. His current  loan will be invested in buying a special electric air compressor that will improve his business and increase his income, in addition to increasing his business capital with new released wheel types.

Through his previous loans, he developed his working place a lot and increased his business capital. He is working hard to stay capable of improving his business properly and increasing his income.

loans.use: To buy a special electric air compressor that will improve his business and increase his income

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to construct a cowshade

loans.name: Beatrace

texts.en: Beatrace is a 50-year-old, single lady living in Fort Portal, Uganda. She operates a restaurant business and at the same time owns a bar that adds to her income. She is faced with the challenge of low capital, which hinders the progress of her business. Besides that, she has hopes of having a well-established business.  Beatrace has asked for a loan to  buy sodas, beers, posho, g-nuts and beans for her restaurant.

loans.use: to buy sodas, beers, posho, g-nuts and beans for her restuarant

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en: Nancy, 38, comes from a lush farming location known as Bingwa in Siongiroi, Kenya. Here, both crops and animals thrive in the hot wet weather. Nancy owns a small parcel of land where she grows maize among other crops and keeps dairy animals.  Today, she is seeking a loan from Kiva lenders through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase an additional dairy cow. The newly-acquired cow will help utilize pasture and maize stalks in her farmland. The cow will also increase the quantity of milk that Nancy sells in the Siongiroi market.  Income from this investment will be a great booster in her personal and business life.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Jesca

texts.en: Jesca is a 28-year-old single mother of one child. Jesca is in a bar attending to one of her clients. She runs it alongside a restaurant which she started in order to earn a living. Jesca hopes to increase her business stock, though competition is failing her business. She needs a loan to buy a fridge for her restaurant.

loans.use: to buy a fridge for her restaurant.

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en:
Hello world! Meet Jackline, a 26-year-old outfitter from a rural town centre in Kenya known as Siongiroi. Jackline does not just make dresses, she is also a farmer. She has ventured into poultry farming, and now that she has gotten the drill, she is planning to scale the business. 

Jackline is seeking a small initial loan investment of 15,000 KES to purchase more heads of poultry. Having more hens will enable her to make more from the sale of eggs to repay the loan and acquire other crucial items for the business. 

Make a $25 loan to Jackline and you will not imagine the opportunities for growth that you will have opened up to this amazing lady.

loans.use: to purchase poultry

loans.name: Leonard's Group

texts.en:
"Leonard is a 50-year-old proud father of 8 children. He is a group leader, often described as a very reliable person, and is representing his group of 13 farmers in Kakamega North District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2014, Leonard has noticed that he has had more profits from each harvest.

Leonard described his harvest as very good last year, but believes he can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. He is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize, because he will now be able to have light during dark hours for his children to be able to study. With the profits from this season’s harvest, he plans to send his children to school.

With this loan, Leonard’s Group will be able to plant a total of 6.5 acres of land and purchase a total of 11 solar lights."

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Josephine's Group

texts.en:
Josephine's Group is formed by 14 farmers in Kakamega North District and is being represented by Josephine, who is the group leader pictured above. She is 37 years old, is married, and has three children. Josephine has been a farmer for 15 years and is often referred to as a very hardworking individual.

Josephine isn’t new to One Acre Fund, she actually joined the program in 2014 and has since noticed her life has changed; especially in the sense that she has been able to consistently feed her family ever since. This year, Josephine will not only get fertilizer and maize seeds as part of her loan, but will also purchase a solar light. She is very excited about this addition since now she will be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money.

Using this loan, Josephine's Group will purchase a total of 12 solar lights and use the farming inputs received to plant a total of six acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light, as well as hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize.

loans.name: Christopher

texts.en: Christopher deals in produce, mainly buying and selling of maize, beans, and rice in Hoima Uganda. He earns additional income from operating a butchery. He is married with 4 children, 3 children attend school. He desires to expand his business and also educate his children. However, weather changes affect his business. He will use the loan facility to buy more maize to sell.

loans.use: to buy more maize to sell.

loans.name: Patrick's Group

texts.en:
"Patrick is a 42-year-old proud father of 5 children. He is a group leader, often described as a very hardworking individual, and is representing his group of 16 farmers in Kakamega North District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2012, Patrick has noticed that he has had more profits from each harvest.

Patrick described his harvest as very good last year, but believes he can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. He is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize, because he will now be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. With the profits from this season’s harvest, he plans to send his children to school.

With this loan, Patrick’s Group will be able to plant a total of 11.25 acres of land and purchase a total of 10 solar lights."

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy motorcycle spare parts to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock like soap, salt, and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Metrine's Group

texts.en:
Metrine's Group is formed by 11 farmers in Kakamega North District and is being represented by Metrine, who is the group leader pictured above. She is 34 years old, is married and has three children. Metrine has been a farmer for 15 years and is often referred to as a very hardworking individual.

Metrine isn’t new to One Acre Fund; she actually joined the program in 2013 and has since noticed her life has changed, especially in the sense that she has been able to consistently feed her family ever since. This year, Metrine will not only get fertilizer and maize seeds as part of her loan, but will also purchase two solar lights. She is very excited about this addition since now she will be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money.

Using this loan, Metrine's Group will purchase a total of 10 solar lights and use the farming inputs received to plant a total of 5 acres.

loans.use: to purchase two solar lights, as well as hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize.

loans.name: Pauline's Group

texts.en:
Pauline is a 33-year-old proud mother of 5 children. She is a group leader, often described as a very hardworking individual, and is representing her group of 11 farmers in Kakamega North District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2013, Pauline has noticed that she has been able to consistently feed her family.

Pauline described her harvest as good last year, but believes she can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. She is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize, because she will now be able to have an overall improved quality of life. With the profits from this season’s harvest, she plans to save more money for the future.

With this loan, Pauline’s Group will be able to plant a total of 5 acres of land and purchase a total of 8 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation

loans.name: Toeun's Group

texts.en:
A resident of Cheung Prey district, Kampong Cham province, Toeun is a 52-year-old married woman with one child who is in secondary school.

To finance her family, she has been farming rice for 31 years, while her husband is a construction worker. Toeun is able to keep about 5 USD savings daily. This is her first loan cycle with VisionFund, Kiva’s partner.

Leading her group, Toeun is requesting a 1,000,000 KHR loan to buy rice seed for her farmland. She hopes that she will have enough capital to continue her rice farming in the future.

loans.use: to buy rice seed

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs for better growth of her coffee plants.

loans.name: Muong Phang 23 Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Thom, 32, is married and is the mother of a girl and a boy ages 6 and 10 respectively. She lives with her husband and her children in a Thai traditional house and works at agricultural production for a living. Indeed, Mrs. Thom and her husband diversify production into plenty of activities such as cultivating rice, growing vegetables, cassava, breeding chickens, pigs and fish. They are very hard-working farmers and have always wanted to increase and expand production.

This is the first time Mrs. Thom has taken out a loan from the Anh Chi Em Program and she will use the loan to buy young fish and food for the fish. She hopes her investment in fish farming will go well so that she could improve significantly income for her family as well as stabilize earnings from agricultural production.

Mrs. Thom dreams her children will have a sufficient life, study well, have a good job so that they could escape from poverty. In the picture, she wears a white coat and stands at the far right.

loans.use: to buy young fish and food for the fish

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy beef and pork for sale

loans.name: Fouad

texts.en:
Fouad is a 44-year-old single man with special needs. He has been a satellite provider for seven years to cover his needs and expenses.
Fouad is a hard worker and an ambitious man who is trying hard to develop his business.

Today he is acquiring a loan from the Damej program from Al Majmoua, which is specifically for people with special needs, to buy a necessary satellite toolkit. This loan will increase Fouad's income and improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to buy necessary satellite toolkit

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow to help him provide for his family's basic needs.

loans.name: Hasan

texts.en:
Hasan is a 30-year-old married man from Yatta, a village near Hebron. He is a father to five sons. 

Hasan works as a construction worker, where he gets a low and unstable income. This income is barely enough to cover all the family's needs. He wants to improve the family's living conditions, so he decided to start a sheep farm, where he will sell meat and dairy products.

Hasan took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy sheep for his farm. By taking this loan, Hasan will be able to improve the condition of his home and increase his income. 

Hasan appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy sheep.

loans.name: Husein

texts.en:
Husein is a 30-year-old married Palestinian refugee who has lived and worked in a Palestinian camp since he was born. He has been working in selling charcoal since April 2014, and he is working hard on developing this business since it is highly requested in his region, especially during winter to warm up.

In addition to his charcoal selling business, he also works as a taxi driver to increase his income and develop his family's living conditions.

Husein is acquiring his fourth loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua; through this current loan he is going to increase his charcoal capital to increase his selling and income, especially for warming up through the current winter season.

He hopes to expand his business in the future and start a wholesale trade.

loans.use: to increase his charcoal capital to increase his selling and income, especially for warming up through the current winter season

loans.name: Moath

texts.en:
Moath is a 20-year-old single man from Yatta, a village near Hebron. His father works as a construction worker, where he earns a low and unstable income. This income barely covers the family's needs. 

Moath wants to improve the family's living conditions, so he decided to start a sheep farm, where he will sell meat and dairy products. Moath took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy sheep for his farm. 

With this loan, Moath will be able to improve his living conditions and increase his income. 

Moath appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy sheep.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace owns a drug shop in Hoima, Uganda where she has managed to get income. She also gets additional income from farming in order to support her family. She hopes to grow her business and educate her children, though she has a challenge of few customers since people opt to go to hospitals that offer free medical care. She will use the credit to buy more drugs to sell.

loans.use: to buy more drugs to sell

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John used the previous loan to pay school fees for his children. He is a farmer and at the same time operates a retail shop that adds more income for him. His intentions are educating all his five children to higher levels of learning, although the unpredictable weather changes affect his business expansion. 

John has asked for a loan to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Fancy

texts.en:
Hello world! Meet Fancy, a jovial 23-year-old farmer from Temowo village in the South Rift region of Kenya. Fancy loves animals, in particular, her dairy cows! In the picture, she can be seen playing with one. 

Dairy farming is a good business in Siongiroi (a rural market where farmers from Temowo sell their produce). Fancy would like to produce more milk out of her cows in the future. In order to realize her goal, she needs to ensure that the environment in which her cows are subjected to is comfortable and conducive for maximum productivity of the cows. It is for this reason that Fancy is seeking a loan to introduce cow barns at her farm. Having a cowshed in place paves way for the introduction of confined feeding, which enables the cows to save energy and feed more. 

Returns from this investment will enable Fancy to increase the number of cows at her farm and grow her family income above the status quo.

loans.use: to construct a cowshed.

loans.name: Richard

texts.en: Richard is a 26 year old married man with two children, living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He operates a drug shop alongside earning a salary from government. He is faced with challenges of limited capital that hinder the progress of his business. Besides that, he desires to construct a hospital to cause an impact in people's lives. He will use the loan to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children

loans.name: Yemima

texts.en: Yemima is a 27-year-old, hardworking, married woman with five children, four of whom attend school in Hoima, Uganda. She deals in clothes for both old and young people where she has earned income to support her family. She hopes to expand and grow her business and also pay school fees for her children. She will use the loan facility to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: William
