texts.en: William is a 44-year-old hardworking Ugandan married man  with eight children, living in Masindi, Uganda. He earns extra income from carpentry. He desires to improve his farming methods and modernization, but he is challenged by fire outbreaks and pesticides, limiting his capital growth. He wants a credit facility to buy chemicals and weed his garden.

loans.use: to buy chemicals and weed his garden.

loans.name: Kikumbo Mixed Farmers S&c Group

texts.en:
Alice is a 34 year-old married woman with three children living in Kyenjojo, Uganda.  She is a member of the group where each member guarantees the other in order to access a loan. 

She operates a roadside shop where she has spent five years working for at least 11 hours a day. She serves the rural community in her village, which has greatly saved  people from covering longer distances for essential goods like salt and soap. Alice earns supplementary income from farming.  She faces challenges of inadequate capital and price fluctuations. Alice has personal goals of educating her children and building a permanent home for her family.  Alice is requesting a loan to buy salt, soap, sugar to sell.

loans.use: to buy salt, soap, sugar to sell.

loans.name: Lenus

texts.en: Lenus is a 32-year-old married man with two children, living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He offers a service of welding and at the same time has a mobile money transfer business that supplements his income. He is faced with challenges of power shortages that hinder the progress of his business. However, he hopes to expand his business to new areas. He needs a loan to invest in his metal fabrication business.

loans.use: to invest in his metal fabrication business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: a loan helps ROBINA's son to establish a new tailoring shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more clothes for the customers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: so that her son would be able to purchase new spare parts for making sewing machines.

loans.name: Nafraq Bibi

texts.en:
Nafraq Bibi is 51 years old and an active borrower of BRAC Pakistan, residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, with her spouse and six children. Her husband has been running his own tailoring shop in the local market for 12 years, and he is the one responsible for fulfilling the needs of the entire family.

Nafraq Bibi's husband needs to buy different types of tailoring accessories, e.g., pieces of cloth, lace, needles and sewing machine accessories. But due to some financial constraints, he is not in a suitable condition to buy these items for his business. Therefore, Nafraq Bibi has applied for a Kiva loan from Kiva's field partner, BRAC Pakistan. 

With the help of this loan, she will financially assist her husband to purchase tailoring accessories to fulfill his business needs, so that he can earn more profitable income.

For this financial assistance, Nafraq Bibi is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy pieces of cloth, lace, needles and sewing machine accessories for her husband's tailoring business.

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en:
Hassan is a 26-year-old divorced man who has been running a mobile phone shop for six years. His business is going on just fine and he is working hard on developing it as much as he can to make sure he can reply on increasing customer needs and requests.

Hassan is a hard-working man, with a very good reputation in his region. Through his acquired YOUTH loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, he intends to increase his business merchandise with special released mobile phone accessories and prepaid cards.

This is Hassan's first loan cycle as an Al Majmoua borrower. He is intending to keep on developing his business in the future to make sure he can satisfy his customers' needs and requests.

loans.use: To increase his business merchandise with special released mobile phone accessories and prepaid cards

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en:
Mahmoud is a 24-year-old single man from Nablus. He is a worker in a carpentry workshop, where he earns a low and unstable income. This income is barely cover his needs. Mahmoud also has a barn for raising sheep, and he sells meat and dairy products in the local market.

Mahmoud took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy more sheep for his barn. By taking this loan, Mahmoud will be able to improve his living conditions and increase his income.

Mahmoud appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy more sheep for his barn.

loans.name: Achraf

texts.en:
Achraf is a 33-year-old divorced, Palestinian refugee, and father of one child. He has been working in selling home products since March 2013. Achraf is a hardworking man who puts so much effort in developing his family’s living in parallel with his business development.

Achraf is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner, Al Majmoua, to increase his business merchandise with special released home products, highly requested by his customers. This is his first loan cycle as an Al Majmoua borrower.  In the future, he is planning to buy his own shop to save rental expenses. He will make sure that his developed business will cover his child's educational fees.

loans.use: to increase his business merchandise with special released home products, highly requested by his customers.

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en:
Mahmoud is Syrian and a 35 year old married father of one child. Three years ago he opened his own electronics repair shop to cover the needs and expenses of his family. He has fifteen years experience in this domain which has allowed him to prove himself in the market.

Mahmoud is a hard worker and an ambitious man who is trying hard to develop his business. Therefore, he is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to buy the necessary toolkit to facilitate his work and provide his customers with better and quick service.

Mahmoud hopes to expand his business more in the future to increase his income and improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a toolkit necessary for his electronics repair business.

loans.name: Siham

texts.en:
Siham is a 53-year-old Lebanese married woman, living with her husband and three children who attend school. She is the owner of a clothing and accessories store. At the same time, and with the aim of getting more profits, she sells computer equipment. 

Currently, she is asking to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l to purchase products needed. Siham says that she will acquire a large quantity of computer equipment, for which she has big demands, and will hopefully get higher revenues.

loans.use: to acquire a large quantity of computer equipment.

loans.name: Al Hanan 50473 Group

texts.en:
Hanan is the featured borrower for Al Hanan 50473 Group. She joined with her other group members to take this Al Majmoua loan because they have always been neighbors and friends. They are working hard to develop their businesses and make a living at the same time.

Hanan is a 46-year-old married mother of two children. She has worked as an accountant at a company for 11 years, to help her husband in covering the needs and expenses of their family. Hanan also sells Tupperware as a second source of income. Today, she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner, Al Majmoua, to increase her business merchandise with a new collection of Tupperware, in order to satisfy her customers' needs.

Hanan is the lady standing in the middle. With respect to the other group members, Nadia is the name of the lady on the left, and Nadia is the name of the lady on the right in the photo.

loans.use: to increase her merchandise with a new collection of Tupperware.

loans.name: Orifhuja

texts.en:
Orifhuja is a generous man. He was born in 1971. He lives in a remote area. He is married and has four children. 

Orifhuja is a responsible, honest and patient person. He tries to feed his family and works hard. He is a bus driver and he serves customers with orders. He dreams to educate his children at the university in order that they will be educated and work as specialists in their profession. Orifhuja is asking for a 470 USD loan for paying the university tuition of his daughter.

loans.use: to pay his daughter's university tuition.

loans.name: Jebreel

texts.en:
Jebreel is a 25-year-old single man from Khanyounis. His father is a worker and earns a low and unstable income that is barely enough to cover all the family's needs. 

Jebreel has a barn for raising sheep, and he sells meat and dairy products in the local market. He took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy more sheep for his barn. With this loan, Jebreel will be able to improve the his living conditions and increase his income. 

Jebreel appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy more sheep for his barn.

loans.name: Ezekiel's Group

texts.en:
Ezekiel is a 39-year-old proud father of six children. He is a group leader, is often described as a very reliable person, and is representing his group of 10 farmers in Kakamega North District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2012, Ezekiel has noticed that he has had more profits from each harvest.

Ezekiel described his harvest as poor due to bad weather conditions last year, but he believes he can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. He is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize, because he will now be able to have light during dark hours for his children to be able to study. With the profits from this season’s harvest, he plans to invest in a business.

With this loan, Ezekiel’s Group will be able to plant a total of 5 acres of land and purchase a total of six solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Khadijeh

texts.en: Khadijeh is a 45-year-old, single woman living in Lebanon. She lives with one parent and a relative. Khadijeh states that she and her sister work very hard to satisfy their family’s living needs. A year ago, she opened a tailoring store where she creates special clothing designs and performs repairs as well. Because she is quite new in this business, Khadijeh says that she needs assistance, especially monetarily. That is why she is asking today to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Vitas. s.a.l., as she urgently requires brand new tailoring machinery, in addition to other equipment, with the aim of enlarging her shop and serving the largest number of customers.

loans.use: to have brand new tailoring machinery in addition to other equipment

loans.name: Owen

texts.en:
Owen is a hardworking man living in Masindi, Uganda. He does cattle fattening, where he earns income alongside a monthly salary income.

He has high hopes of building houses for rent so as to generate more income.

Prolonged droughts have highly affected his business, thus leading to failure.

loans.use: to buy more cattle for fattening.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to help her husband to buy more hens for getting eggs.

loans.name: Brajeswari

texts.en:
Brajeswari is a 53-year-old a widowed woman. She lives in a small village of Jharsuguda district, Odisha with her two sons, one daughter-in-law, and two grandsons. Both her sons own a motor garage, and her older son is married and has two sons.

Brajeswari owns a grocery shop where she sells basic household items and earns 3,000 INR per month. She helps her sons financially to take care of family responsibility in a good condition.

Brajeswari has requested a loan of 20,000 INR to buy sugar, edible oil, spices, biscuits, chocolates, and ready-made food items in bulk for resale.

She hopes to make a good house for her family.

loans.use: to buy sugar, edible oil, spices, biscuits, chocolates, and ready-made food items in bulk for resale.

loans.name: Nikoloz

texts.en:
Nikoloz is a 42 year old man. He lives with his pensioner mother in Tsalenjikha district. Nikoloz is involved in agricultural activities. In particular, he owns 30 nut trees. He sells the harvested nuts locally. In addition Nikoloz does physical labour to generate income.

As the family income is small, Nikoloz decided to start an additional business and requested a loan. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo enables him to get a loan of 1000 GEL. With the received credit, Nikoloz will purchase bee-hives with bee-colonies and will start producing honey. He is a very hard working man and awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase bee-hives with bee-colonies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy metal roofing and wood.

loans.name: Samer

texts.en:
Samer is a 24-year-old single man, and a Palestinian refugee, who lives in a Palestinian refugee camp. Due to the low financial and social situations of Palestinians in Lebanon, especially those who live in camps, has been working in painting furniture for eleven years, to help in covering the needs and expenses of his family.

Samer is working hard to develop his business and improve his family's living conditions. Thus today, he is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner, Al Majmoua, to buy necessary electronics for his family. He hopes to stay capable of satisfying his family's needs.

loans.use: to buy necessary electronics for his family.

loans.name: Saji

texts.en:
Saji is a 22-year-old single man from a village near Tulkarm. He is a worker and earns a low and unstable income. 

Saji wants to improve his income, so he decided to start his own business which is a barn for raising sheep. Saji took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy sheep for his barn. With this loan, Saji will be able to improve his living conditions and increase his income.

Saji appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy sheep in order to start a sheep raising business.

loans.name: Firas

texts.en:
Firas is a 33-year-old married man from a village near Qalqilia. Firas has a barn for raising sheep. He sells the meat to the local traders. It is a good business, but still needs some improvement.

Firas took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy more sheep for his barn. With this loan, Firas will be able to improve his family's living conditions and increase his income.

Firas appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy more sheep for his barn.

loans.name: Wafaa

texts.en: Wafaa is a divorced Lebanese woman living with her only child. After her break up, Wafaa turned out to become the sole main income provider and had to do her best to feed her child and pay for his school. She has earned her living by producing homemade food for the past four years. Today, she is asking to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l so as to purchase materials for food production. Wafaa truly needs to obtain this loan to grow her business and gain a higher income.

loans.use: to purchase materials for food production.

loans.name: German

texts.es: German de 54 años vive con su esposa y su madre, el posee una panadería ubicada en su lugar de residencia desde hace 10 años, tiene muchos clientes por la calidad con que elabora el pan, su esposa le ayuda en el negocio y con las ganancias que obtiene logra salir adelante con las gastos del hogar, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de harina, azúcar, jaleas de sabores, moldes, etc. Para poder seguir con su trabajo y así tener mejores ingresos para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: German is 54 years old and lives with his wife and his mother. He has had a bakery, located in his house, for the past 10 years. He has many customers, due to the quality of the bread he makes. His wife helps him in the business and with the earnings he manages to make ends meet for the household expenses. He is requesting a loan to buy flour, sugar, jellies in a variety of flavors, bread molds [forms], etc., so that he can continue with his work and have improved income for a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, jellies in a variety of flavors, bread molds [forms], etc.

loans.name: Francoise

texts.en:
Francoise is 35 years old. She is married with four children between the ages of two and 12 years old. Three of her children go to school. 

Francoise is a farmer and she has been growing rice for 17 years. Her husband is also a farmer. 

With the loan from Kiva, she would like to pay her workers. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees of her children and improve her family's welfare.

loans.use: to pay her workers.

loans.name: Kabunyansi Tukwatanise Group

texts.en:
Edson is a hard working married man with 4 children aged 9, 7, 5 and 3 years, living in Kyenjojo-Uganda. He is a member of Kabunyansi Tukwatanise Group where every member guarantees each other in accessing a loan.

Edson acquired his start-up capital from farming and opened up a retail shop dealing in general merchandise to help him look after his family. Edson is requesting a loan to purchase sugar, soap, rice, salt and cooking oil for his shop.

Edson has a personal goal of educating his children and dreams of building a permanent home for his family.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, soap, rice, salt and cooking oil for his shop.

loans.name: Kanda

texts.en:
Meet Kanda, a lovely, hardworking, dark, 36-year-old woman from Kalenjin tribe. She hails from the hilly regions of Rift Valley region of Kenya where she practices maize farming and dairy farming majorly. This location is so remote that there is no piped water system. This forces the constituents, mostly farmers, to go downstream to fetch water. In Kanda's case, she also has to lead her stock down the stream to hydrate. This task becomes taxing over time.

Kanda wants to make her work easier. She is seeking a loan to purchase a water tank. The tank will be installed in the homestead where users can access it conveniently. This will also ensure that farm animals have a constant supply of water for consumption as opposed to timed consumption.

With your support, the water tank will beat a way for future opportunities and improvements in the farmland, such as introduction of irrigation, rain water harvesting, etc.

loans.use: to purchase a water tank.

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.en: Jacqueline is 43 years old. She is married with two children aged between 8 and 12 years. They both go to school. She is a farmer and she has been producing rice for 18 years. Also her husband is a farmer. With the loan from Kiva, she would like to pay laborers. The profits from the business will be used to increase her savings.

loans.use: to pay laborers.

loans.name: Fred

texts.en: Fred is a 43-year-old married man living in Masindi-Uganda. He runs an electronic shop, a business he started to earn a living. He has a dream of completing his house. However, he is challenged by competition. He needs a credit facility to buy electronics.

loans.use: to buy electronics.

loans.name: Twalati

texts.en: Twalati lives in Masindi-Uganda and deals in produce, buying and selling mainly posho, maize and other items. He builds houses to gain more income. He has hopes of completing his house despite of weather vagaries which affect business. He wants a loan to buy more produce to sell.

loans.use: to buy more produce for sell.

loans.name: Aiymkan

texts.ru: Айымкан успешно погасила свой предыдущий кредит и использовала его по назначению. Она очень благодарна всем, кто помог ей в финансировании. На сегодняшний день в хозяйстве Айымкан есть 8 коров, 32 овцы. На собственном земельном наделе мерою 1,00 ГА она выращивает люцерну. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дойной коровы с теленком для увеличения поголовья скота и удоя молока. Доходы от кредита Айымкан планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, она также хочет установит ворота и ограду ее дома.
texts.en:
Aiymkan successfully repaid her previous loan and used it as intended. She is very thankful to those who helped her with the financing. Currently Aiymkan has eight cows and 32 sheep. On her own plot of land of 1.0 hectares, she grows alfalfa.

With an aim to further develop her business, she turned to the bank "Bai Tushum" for a loan in the amount of 50,000 som (KGS) to purchase a dairy cow with offspring to increase the number of livestock and the volume of milk. Aiymkan plans to invest the income from the loan in further increasing the number of livestock. She would also like to install a gate and fence for her home.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow with offspring, in order to increase her herd and the volume of milk for selling

loans.name: Mustafa

texts.en: In addition to farming, Mustafa, who lives in Masindi, Uganda, runs a restaurant to support his family. Now requesting a loan to buy new furniture for his restaurant, Mustafa's dream is to expand into a big hotel, despite the competition.

loans.use: to buy new furniture for his restaurant

loans.name: Shaiyrkul

texts.ru: Шайыркул 57 лет, вдова, есть сын. У Шайыркул среднее образование, она на пенсии, в качестве дополнительного дохода  на протяжении 34 лет занимается животноводством и полеводством. Благодаря упорному труду и целеустремленности Шайыркул, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется земельный участок мерою 2,59 ГА собственной и 1,0 ГА арендованной земли, где она выращивает люцерну и пшеницу для реализации. В хозяйстве есть 8 коров. Ежемесячный доход Шайыркул составляет 11,500 сом (KGS), этих средств катастрофически не хватает на достойную жизнь. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку бычков. Доходы от кредита Шайыркул планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие ее бизнеса, что позволит улучшить благосостояние семьи.
texts.en:
Shaiyrkul is 57 years old, a widow, and has one son. Shaiyrkul has secondary education. She is on a pension. To get an additional income, she has worked with livestock breeding and field crop cultivation for a period of 34 years. 

Thanks to Shaiyrkul's persistent work and purposefulness, her farm currently consist of a plot of land of 2.59 hectares of own land, and 1.0 hectares of rented land, on which she grows alfalfa and wheat for selling. She also has eight cows on her farm. Shaiyrkul's monthly income is 11,500 som (KGS). This money is unfortunately not enough for a decent life. 

With an aim to further develop her business, she turned to the bank "Bai Tushum" for a loan in the amount of 50,000 som (KGS) to purchase steers. Shaiyrkul plans to invest the income from the loan in further developing her business, which will allow her to improve the well-being of the family.

loans.use: to purchase steers in order to increase her income

loans.name: William

texts.en: William is a hardworking man living in Masindi-Uganda. He sells milk and ghee alongside his motorcycle transport business. He started the business to support his family. He faces a challenge in competition. He needs a loan to buy ghee to sell.

loans.use: to buy ghee to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase clothing for her husband's clothing sales business.

loans.name: Nusrat

texts.en:
Nusrat, age 22, is a married woman.  Her husband (also shown in the photo) is running a small general store to make enough to support his family circle. He is making a great effort to support his family. However, he faces a financial problem in the growth of his business. 

For this reason, Nusrat has accessed a Murabaha loan of 25,000 PKR for her husband to buy more packs of biscuits, grains, and cleaning products to meet the demand of customers, time after time. She is positive about her husband’s future earnings and will spend part of income on improving their standard of living.

loans.use: to help her husband to buy more packs of biscuits, grains, and cleaning products, to meet the demands of customers.

loans.name: Shagufta

texts.en:
Shagufta is 30 years old and resides in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a mother of two children. Her husband owns a printing shop, and he is the guardian of the family and responsible for fulfilling the needs of all the family members. 

Shagufta has been running her own beauty salon for the past 12 years. She also contributes her income with her husband to manage the household. She needs to buy different types of cosmetics, i.e., creams, hairbrushes, and other accessories for her beauty salon, but due to financial constraints, she is not able to buy these items for her business. Therefore, Shagufta has applied for a Kiva loan. This loan will help her to buy the relevant items for her business so that she can provide better services to her customers. It will also help her to earn maximum profitable income to fulfill the needs of her business and family.

For this financial assistance, Shagufta is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy accessories for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more garments to resell

loans.name: Saleema

texts.en: Saleema is a 35-year-old married lady and has been running a small general store in her community for many years with the support of her husband, who is also shown in the photo. She offers a variety of grocery items at a reasonable price and has retained many customers who regularly shop at her store. Saleema makes enough to provide for her family. To make her store fully stocked, she requested a loan of 45,000 PKR which she will use to buy rice, sugar, grains, biscuits, oil and flour from the market at lower rates to make her stock available for her customers. In this way, she will be able to meet the increasing demand consistently. Saleema wishes to utilize part of her revenues to provide a good-quality life to her family members.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, grains, biscuits, oil and flour from the market at lower rates to make her stock available for her customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: a loan helps Asma to purchase new cosmetic products such as facial cream, bleach cream, nail polish, hair color and lotion.

loans.name: Shahnaz

texts.en: Shahnaz, age 39, is a married woman. The income generated by her husband is insufficient to cover all the household expenses, so she initiated her business of milk sales. She has been doing it for many years and has become famous for providing good-quality milk in her locality. She also sells animals to the people of her locality to generate an extra amount of income. With the support of Kashf Foundation, she has gradually improved her business. Currently, she is requesting a loan of Rs. 40,000 to purchase another buffalo to inflate her sales and profits.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo to inflate her sales and profits.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is a 46-year-old married woman who has been working in Tupperware sales since 2001. She is a hard working woman who puts so much effort in developing her business to support her husband in covering their increasing living expenses.
Amina is acquiring her third loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to increase her Tupperware stock, especially in preparation for the coming Mother's Day celebration which takes place on 21st of March each year in Lebanon.
Amina hopes to open her own shop in the future instead of using her house to market her merchandise.

loans.use: to increase her Tupperware stock.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 22-year-old single man from a village near Hebron. His father works as an employee at a local firm. Ahmad wants to start his own business, which is a barn for raising sheep. He wants to improve the family's income and help his father with part of the expenses. 

Ahmad took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy sheep for his barn. By taking this loan, Ahmad will be able to improve conditions at home and increase the family's income.

Ahmad appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy sheep for his barn.

loans.name: Sahera

texts.en:
Sahera is a 37-year-old married woman from Jericho. She is a mother to five sons and two daughters. Her husband works as a construction worker and he earns a low income. 

Sahera started a family business, a barn for raising sheep, two years ago. The whole family helps with the business.
 
Sahera took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy more sheep for the family barn, in order to improve the business and increase productivity. 

Sahera appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy more sheep, in order to improve the business and increase productivity.

loans.name: Tecla

texts.en:
Tecla does dairy farming for a living. She has been married for 28 years now to Hosea and they have been blessed with eight children (the youngest is three and the oldest is 28 years). For the couple to provide sufficient financial support to their family, they are striving to increase their net income. 
For Tecla, more income means more cows. She is seeking a loan investment from Kiva lenders to purchase a heifer. She already has four cows named Solat, Jeptut, Maria and Ashian. The additional cow will produce more milk which will bring more revenue than the business earns today. 
Profits from this investment will be used to uplift the family's livelihood and grow their business.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Anwar

texts.en: Anwar is a 23-year-old, Lebanese married woman, living with her husband and only child. She is a private teacher, occupying this job since 2013. She works at her residence where she receives her students to educate them. With her youth loan requested from Kiva partner, Vitas s.a.l,, Anwar wants to buy a laptop, which she will be using to widen her exploration and searching. Anwar tends to expand her knowhow, as well as her students’ knowledge, and to guide them to high educational levels in society.

loans.use: to buy a laptop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy bread, tomatoes, onions, mayonnaise, lunch meats, and other ingredients.

loans.name: Zamira

texts.ru: Замира 53 года, замужем, дети взрослые и самостоятельные. У Замиры среднее образование, с 2006 года она занимается животноводством, выращиванием, заготовкой и реализацией фасоли. В хозяйстве есть 1 корова, 10 овец. На участке мерою 2,10 Га, она выращивает фасоль. Так как вся продукция Замиры экологичная, домашняя и чрезвычайно вкусная, она пользуется большим спросом и число покупателей растет с каждым днем. Замира обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 80,000 сом (KGS) на покупку двух телят и 20 овец. Доходы от кредита она планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины.
texts.en:
Zamira is 53, married, and her children are grown-up and independent.  Zamira has a secondary school education, and, since 2006, has earned her living raising livestock and growing crops; specifically, by preparing and selling beans as a cash crop.  She has 1 cow and 10 sheep on her farm, and grows her beans on a 2.10-hectare plot of land.

As all of Zamira's farm products are organic, homemade and extremely tasty, there is a lot of demand for them, and her number of customers increases every day.  Zamira has requested a loan of 80,000 som from Bai Tushum Bank to buy 2 calves and 20 sheep.  She plans on using her extra income due to the loan to continue to add livestock to her farm in the future.

loans.use: buy 2 calves and 20 sheep to increase her herd

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles appreciates Ugafode and Kiva lenders for the tremendous work they are doing, especially in the rural community. He is a very hardworking 42-year-old married client, and father of six children who are all school going. He deals in agriculture. He works for eight hours a day and six days a week. His agriculture farm is located in Katooma, Kitagata, Sheema district and he started this farm to have a source income of his own. 

He is borrowing UGX 3,500,000 to buy fertilizers and mulches, and use the remaining money to pay for labor in his plantations. He started this business in 2005 and his clients are traders from Mbarara and Kampala, from where he gets money.  He hopes this money will to take his children to school. He is affected buy the bad weather, especially hailstorms that hit his area so much last year, and lack of enough capital. He appreciates UGAFODE and the Kiva lenders for the support. He is hardworking and honest.

loans.use: to buy fertilzer.

loans.name: Enri

texts.en:
Enri is 66 years old and a married man. He lives with his wife in a small village in Tskaltubo district. The only source of income for the family is his 150 GEL monthly pension. Enri and his wife are unemployed. 

Enri owns a hectare of agricultural land, where he wants to build a greenhouse. The start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo enables him to get a loan of 850 GEL. With the received loan, he will purchase all the needed materials to build a greenhouse. He will grow tomatoes and cucumbers to sell locally. 

Enri awaits your support.

loans.use: to build a greenhouse.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Lali

texts.en:
Lali is a 48-year-old married woman from Gardabani district. She has an unemployed daughter and daughter-in-law, and also a son, who is a private worker and generates an insignificant salary. For her role in the family's welfare, Lali started to work as a salesperson at the local store, where she gets 250 GEL monthly. 

According to Credo estimations, the family belongs to the vulnerable poor category. Lali has requested a Credo loan for the start-up of a trading business. Her loan request was approved within the framework of a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program provides business start-up and re-startup loans with soft conditions for the country's rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. 

Lali will purchase stock of clothing at wholesale prices and will sell the clothing at increased prices in her community. As a result of the new business initiative, implemented with the assistance of Kiva, the income of the family will significantly increase. Lali and her family members will be able to create better living conditions and meet all daily costs more effectively.

loans.use: to start a clothing sales business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to help her husband to purchase good quality wood, and packs of polish and nails in large quantities.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.es:
Virginia es una mujer de 39 años de edad, soltera, sin hijos, y su negocio es la elaboración de queso artesanal.
Ella es independiente, emprendedora, fuerte, luchadora, constante, responsable y trabajadora. Su negocio lo desarrolla en la comunidad ‘Cutusuma’ ubicada a 60 kilómetros al oeste de la ciudad, cercana al algo sagrado Titicaca, donde los agricultores acostumbran la siembra de quinua, cebada, papa, haba, oca, de clima frío y seco.
Virginia es de tez morena, cabello negro largo lo usa trenzado, baja estatura, complexión física delgada, su forma de vestir es tradicional (sombrero, manta y pollera), su lengua materna es el Aymará que se habla en el lugar y habla español por cultura general y por el comercio que realiza. Su vida la realiza al lado de sus familiares que se dedican a la agricultura, viven en una casa propia construida de adobe y ladrillo con techo de calamina y cuenta con agua de pozo y electricidad. Su negocio es la elaboración de queso artesanal, sus variedades más comunes son; el queso fresco, el chaqueño y el menonita. “La población consume queso en la medida de sus posibilidades económicas, se emplea este manjar para preparar un plato de comida o para deleitarse con un buen café con pan…” comenta. Su sueño es aumentar su producción de quesos, ella desea realizar la compra de ganado lechero para contar con mayor cantidad de leche para su producción. Esta es su 2 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 21 años que viene desarrollando esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Virginia solicita un préstamo para la compra de ganado lechero para producir mayor cantidad de leche y aumentar su producción quesera.
texts.en:
Virginia is 39 years old, single, and without children. Her business is the making of artisanal cheese.

She is independent, enterprising, strong, consistent, responsible, and hardworking. She has her business in the community of Cutusuma, located 60 kilometers to the west of the city, near the sacred Titicaca Lake, where farmers plant quinoa, barley, potatoes, fava beans, and oca [a root crop similar to potatoes], in an area that has a cold and dry climate.

Virginia is of dark complexion, has long dark hair that she wears in braids, short, and thin. She dresses in a traditional manner (wide-brimmed hat, shawl, and layered skirts). Her native language is Aymará, which is spoken in the area. She also speaks Spanish due to the general culture, and also because of her business. She lives life alongside her family members, who work in agriculture. They live in their own house, built of adobe and brick with a metal roof, which has well water and electricity. Her business is that of making artisanal cheeses. The most common varieties that she makes are: queso fresco, farmer’s cheese, and Mennonite cheese. “The population eats cheese according to their economic possibilities. They use this delicacy to prepare food or to enjoy with a good cup of coffee and bread,” she explains. Her dream is to increase her cheese production. This is her second loan with the institution in the 21 years that she’s had this business. 

Virginia is requesting a loan to buy dairy cattle in order to produce a larger quantity of milk and increase her cheese production.

loans.use: to buy dairy cattle in order to produce a larger quantity of milk and increase her cheese production.

loans.name: Pikria

texts.en:
Pikria is 25-year-old married woman. She lives with her husband and infant son in Kutaisi district. Her husband is a barman and Pikria is a saleswoman at a local clothing shop. 

She decided to start her own business and requested a loan. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables her to get a loan of 2,500 GEL. With the received loan, she will purchase a stock of clothes and will resell the clothes in Kutaisi with a price markup. 

The Start up program will be a great support for the family. Pikria is very experienced in this business and hopes that she will have a good number of satisfied clients.

loans.use: to start a clothing sales business.

loans.name: Doreen

texts.en: Doreen is a 32-year-old single lady, living in Masindi-Uganda.  She runs a retail shop that sells general merchandise like sugar and soap. She has hopes of educating her children. However, she faces a challenge of high transport costs of her merchandise from the wholesalers to her place of work. She wants a loan to buy more sugar and soap to sell.

loans.use: to buy more general mechandise like sugar and soap to sell.

loans.name: Ekomefeamo 1 Group

texts.en:
These members are part of a group called Ekomefeamo 1, and the group is composed of four women, all living in the same neighborhood and involved in different business activities. They sell banku (cooked corn and cassava paste), fish, beans, plantains, yams, maize and groceries. 

Mary is the featured borrower of this group. She is 63 years old, a widow and a mother of four children who are grown but who help her to do her work. She can be seen in the photo standing second the right. She in charge of managing the household expenses. She is asking for a loan in order to purchase five bags of maize from the wholesale market to sell to customers. 

She begins working every day at 8 a.m. and finishes at 5 p.m. She hopes to earn enough revenue in order to further diversify her bueiness and improve the living conditions of her family. 

Together with her friends, she will need a total amount of 7,300 GHS to serve customers better.

loans.use: to purchase five bags of maize from the wholesale market to sell to customers.

loans.name: Santos De Jesus

texts.es: Doña Santos de 31 años de edad es madre soltera vive en casa propia con sus dos hijos, ella se dedica desde hace 10 años a la venta de tortillas, su negocio está ubicado en su lugar de residencia y tiene muchos clientes, gracias a las ganancias que obtiene logra salir adelante con sus hijo, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de maíz por mayor y cal para poder continuar con sus ventas y así poder tener mejores ingresos para tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Doña Santos is a 31-year-old single mother who lives with her two children in her own house. She has been selling tortillas for 10 years. Her business is in her place of residence and she has many customers. Thanks to what she earns, she and her children manage to get by. She is applying for a loan to buy lime and wholesale corn to be able to continue selling so she can make more money to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy lime and wholesale corn

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan tiene 45 años de edad, vive en casa propia de material rústico junto a su esposa y 02 hijos menores de edad en el distrito de Pucará en la provincia de Jaén, región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte de Perú. La comunidad donde vive el cliente es una pequeña zona rural donde los habitantes se conocen y se dedican principalmente a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería.

La actividad que realiza Juan es la de vender animales menores como cuyes, gallinas, patos, entre otros; también es peón agrícola y arrienda 1,5 has para el cultivo de arroz. El préstamo lo utilizará para invertir en compra de cuyes, mejoramiento y acondicionamiento de corrales, lo que le permitirá en un corto plazo mejorar sus ingresos, aumentar sus ganancias y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Juan is 45 years old. He lives in his own house, built from rustic materials, together with his wife and two minor children in the district of Pucará, in Jaén province, in the region of Cajamarca, in the northern highlands of Peru. The community where the borrower lives is a small rural zone where the inhabitants know each other and work chiefly in agriculture, trade and livestock raising. 

Juan's work is selling small animals such as guinea pigs, hens, and ducks, among others. He is also an agricultural worker and rents 1.5 hectares for growing rice. He will use the loan to invest in buying guinea pigs as well as improving and equipping animal pens. This will allow him to improve his income within a short period of time, to increase his profits and ultimately to improve his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: to invest in buying guinea pigs and improving and equipping animal pens.

loans.name: James

texts.en: James, aged 45, is a married father of eight children who earns his income from farming, mainly growing sugarcane. He gets additional income from selling produce. James' major dream is to educate his children and modernize his farm. However, weather changes affect his expected returns. He needs a loan facility to weed his garden and buy chemicals.

loans.use: to weed his garden and buy chemicals.

loans.name: Greda Group

texts.en:
These ladies and the gentleman are part of a group called Greda. The group is composed of four people who live in the same district. They meet once a week to repay loans, deposit savings and receive training. They are involved in the sale of rice, cooking oil, cassava dough, corn dough, tomatoes, gari, eggs, kenkey (cooked corn paste) and fish. 

Vivian is the featured borrower. She is standing to the left in the photograph. She operates a grocery business, selling rice, cooking oil, cassava and corn dough, and has over five years of experience. She is 32 years old and married with four children. Her day goes from 10am until 8pm. She supports her family, and works hard to cover their expenses. 

Together with her friends, Vivian is asking for a loan of 3,800 GHS to buy more inventory to better serve her clients. In the future, she would like to bolster her business and satisfy her customers with the help of the micro-finance institution.

loans.use: to buy grocery items to resell to customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Edén solicita el crédito para comprar materiales y poder realizar el servicio higiénico en su casa.

loans.name: Wael

texts.en:
Wael is a 36-year-old married father of three children. He is a Palestinian refugee who opened his current laundry shop in 1997. Since that time, he has been developing it properly since it is his family's only source of income. Wael is a hard worker, well known in his region for the special services he provides to his customers. He works hard on developing them as much as he can.

Wael is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to buy a newly released laundry machine that will improve his provided services and develop his business properly. He hopes he can remain capable of developing his business in a well-managed way to make sure he can provide his family members with a better living and necessary education.

loans.use: to buy a newly released laundry machine.

loans.name: Renee Lyn

texts.en: Renee Lyn is a 42-year-old married woman and a mother of three children from San Dionisio, Iloilo. She runs a small sari-sari or retail store business selling various goods and items to the people in her place. Renee Lyn has been in the business for more than two years. Renee Lyn is asking for a loan to buy more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, cooking oil, condiments and others. A loan will help her improve her stock, thus attracting more buyers in her store.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, cooking oil, condiments and others

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es:
Luz Marina tiene 41 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, tiene 1 hijo y vive con su familia en el distrito de Oyotún, en una zona rural que se encuentra ubicada en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú. Los pobladores de este distrito se dedican a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería.

Ella se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de animales, cuenta con más de 8 años de experiencia en el negocio y con buenas referencias personales y laborales en el distrito, su negocio está ubicado en su mismo domicilio. Solicita préstamo para la compra de más animales como gallinas, patos, pavos, entre otros, para incrementar el stock de su negocio, dicha inversión le servirá para tener mayor variedad y productividad en animales, con gran influencia en el negocio, con esto Luz Marina piensa incrementar su stock de animales para poder atender los diversos gustos y necesidades de los clientes de la zona.
texts.en:
Luz Marina is 41 years old. She is in a common-law marriage and has one child. She lives with her family in the district of Oyotún, in a rural zone which is located in the province of Chiclayo, in the Lambayeque region, on the northern coast of Peru. The inhabitants of this district dedicate themselves to agriculture, trade and livestock raising. 

Luz Marina works raising and selling animals. She has more than 8 years of experience with this business, and she has good personal and professional references in the district. Her business is located in her own home. She is requesting a loan to buy more animals, such as hens, ducks, and turkeys, among others, in order to increase the stock of her business. This investment will allow her to have greater variety and productivity with her animals, and it will have a significant effect on her business. With it, Luz Marina plans to increase her stock of animals in order to serve the diverse tastes and needs of her customers in the area.

loans.use: to buy more animals, such as hens, ducks, turkeys and others, to increase the stock of her business.

loans.name: Analou

texts.en: Analou is a 33-year-old married woman and a mother of two children from San Dionisio, Iloilo. She is engaged in a retail sales business. She runs a small sari-sari or retail store selling various goods and items to the people in her place. Analou is asking for a loan to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, bread and biscuits. A loan will help her improve her stock, thus allowing her to sell more to her customers. In the future, Analou dreams of making her business a success. Moreover, she wants to save money to pay for her children’s schooling.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, bread and biscuits

loans.name: Zhamila

texts.ru: Жамила, 50 лет, замужем, есть 4 детей. У Жамилы средне-специальное образование. В качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, с 1983 года занимается сельским хозяйством, начав этот бизнес с 5,000 сом (KGS). В хозяйстве Жамилы есть корова, 2 овец, лошадь. На участке мерою 2,0 Га она выращивает арбузы и хлопок. Вся экологически чистая продукция Жамилы пользуется большим спросом и приносит хорошую прибыль. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку клеенки для парника, семян для выращивания экологически чистой продукции. Жамила является лидером группы "Ынтымак", в которой кроме нее состоят еще 2 человека, всего их 3. Доходы от кредита Жамила планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение своего бизнеса и хочет накопить на свадьбу сына.
texts.en:
Zhamila is 50 years old, married and has four children. She has finished a technical college. As a main source of income for her family, since 1983 she has been doing farm work, having launched this business with a starting capital of 5,000 KGS. At present Zhamila owns one cow, two sheep, and one horse. She also has a 2.ha [5 acres] land plot, where she grows watermelons and cotton. Zhamila's environmentally clean produce is in great demand and brings in good revenue.

 In order to develop her business further, Zhamila has applied to the Bai Tushum microfinance institution for a loan in the amount of 100,000 KGS to buy greenhouse film and seeds to grow environmentally clean produce. Zhamila is the leader of the Yuntymak group, which has two other members besides her; there are three members altogether. Zhamila plans to invest the resulting revenues in an additional expansion of her business. She would also like to save up for her son's wedding.

loans.use: to purchase plastic film for her greenhouse and seeds, in order to grow organic products.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira, 37, is married with seven children. Three of her children are in school.

Elvira has a buy-and-sell scrap business in the Philippines, a business she has been in for three years. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

She has requested a loan of 12,000 Philippine pesos through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation. She will use the loan to buy scrap to sell in her business. 

In the future, Elvira would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy scrap to sell in her business

loans.name: Marlon Jose

texts.es: Saber hacer bien su oficio es lo que Don Marlon ha hecho durante 7 años. El con su zapatería ha logrado tener una mejor calidad de vida. Don Marlon ha incrementado su inventario con mucho esfuerzo y ha logrado comprar insumos para la elaboración de calzado, pera esta vez para lograr suplir con la fuerte demanda él solicita un crédito para comprar estos insumos entre ellos, cuero, pega, suelas, tachuelas. Las metas de Don Marlon son seguir trabajando fuerte para que vaya creciendo su negocio.
texts.en: Over the last 7 years, Marlon has learned his trade well.  With his shoemaking business, he has managed to have a better quality of life.  Marlon has increased his inventory with a lot of effort, and he has managed to buy supplies to make shoes.  But at this time, he is requesting a loan to stock up  with supplies to meet the strong demand for his products.  He will use the loan to buy leather, glue, soles, and tacks.  Marlon's goal is to keep working hard so that he can continue to grow his business.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as leather, glue, soles, and tacks

loans.name: Joseph's Group

texts.en:
Joseph is a 52-year-old proud father of eight children. He is a group leader, often described as a very hardworking individual, and is representing his group of 15 farmers in Kakamega North district. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2014, Joseph has noticed that he has been able to consistently feed his family.

Joseph describes his harvest as very good last year, but believes he can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. He is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, as well as fertilizer and maize, because he will now be able to reduce his consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. With the profits from this season’s harvest, he plans to send his children to school.

With this loan, Joseph’s Group will be able to plant a total of seven acres of land and purchase a total of 11 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost-efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Zacharie

texts.en: Zacharie is 32 years old. He is married with three children aged two and five years. Two of them go to school. He is a farmer and he has been producing rice for 16 years.  His wife is a businesswoman. With the loan from Kiva, he would like to pay for labor. The profits from the business will be used to buy a piece of land for farming.

loans.use: To pay for labor

loans.name: Shitawa's Group

texts.en:
Shitawa is a 39-year-old proud father of 10 children. He is a group leader, often described as a very trustworthy person, and is representing his group of 8 farmers in Kakamega North District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2013, Shitawa has noticed that he has had more profits from each harvest.

Shitawa described his harvest as very good last year, but believes he can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. He is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize, because he will now be able to have light during dark hours for his children to be able to study. With the profits from this season’s harvest, he plans to send his children to school.

With this loan, Shitawa’s Group will be able to plant a total of 5.25 acres of land and purchase a total of 2 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Roseline

texts.en:
The person in the photo is Roseline, 35, married and the mother of two children. She does small-scale farming, planting indigenous kale, spinach and broccoli. She also keeps dairy cows. 

Roseline is borrowing money to buy fertilizer to boost her vegetable farming. This will help improve her farm output, thus produce more profits. She plans to use the anticipated income to cater to her family's needs, such as for food and clothing.

Roseline is happy for Kiva and its lenders for their great help.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer to boost crop productivity.

loans.name: Priscila

texts.en:
The person in this photo is Priscila. She is 32 and married and has one child. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa to benefit from training in enterprise and financial management. 

She does vegetable farming to earn a living. She is borrowing money to buy farm inputs, such as fertilizer and pesticide. This investment will help improve her farming, thus increase her crop yield. A higher yield will lead to more supply, thus more income to cater to her family's expenses.

Priscila is grateful to Kiva for its financial assistance.

loans.use: To buy pesticide and fertilizer to boost her farming.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more chairs and cups for the customers.

loans.name: Demetria

texts.en:
Demetria, 49, is married and the mother of three children. She is from San Dionisio, Iloilo, in the Philippines. 

She and her husband have been engaged in a motorcycle transport service for more than nine years. They also operate a small motorcycle repair shop. 

Demetria is asking for a loan to pay the full payment on their new motorcycle. This loan will help them improve their business as well as their income.

loans.use: to pay the full payment on a new motorcycle

loans.name: Wilmer Joel

texts.es:
El señor Wilmer,  vive en una de Santa Cruz  De Yojoa, desde su niñez vive con su esposa y sus 3 hijos, el tiene cultivo de café y cultivo de yuca.

Don Wilmer está solicitando el préstamo para compra de abonos y fungicidas para darles mantenimientos a sus cultivos. Espera que al utilizar este préstamo para  esta actividad su cosecha va hacer de mejor producción y así tendrá mejor venta de su producto y obtendrán mejores ganancias con las cuales el piensa invertir en sus cultivo y otra parte hacerles mejoras a su vivienda. 

El sueño de Wilmer es poder hacer más cultivos y poder darles una buena educación a sus hijos.



Santa Cruz De Yojoa, Honduras - Febrero del 2015
texts.en:
Wilmer has lived in Santa Cruz de Yojoa since his childhood. He lives with his wife and three children. He has coffee and yucca crops. 

Wilmer is applying for a loan to buy fertilizers and fungicides to maintain his crops. He hopes that by using this loan for this purpose, his crops will have have better yields and he will have better sales and make more profit which he plans to use to invest in his crops as well as make improvements on his home. 

Wilmer's dream is to be able to grow more crops and to be able to give his children a good education. 

Santa Cruz De Yojoa, Honduras - February 2015

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and fungicides for his business.

loans.name: Rovshan

texts.en:
Rovshan is a 36 year old, married man with two sons. His wife is a houskeeper and takes care of their children. Rovshan earns money selling construction materials and he has worked in this small business for 16 years. He has good skills but, in his region, this business isn't in high demand and his monthly income is 195 AZN.

Rovshan lives with his family in an old, small house which needs repairing. They don't have their own water pump and Rovshan has to get water from his neighbours all the time. His earnings aren't enough to repair the house water system so he applied for a 1200 AZN loan in order to repair the water tank and install a water pump.

This is his fourth loan and he has a positive client history.

loans.use: to repair the water tank and install a water pump for his house.

loans.name: Mar Joe

texts.en:
Mar Joe is a married man and a father of three children from San Dionisio, Iloilo. He runs a small sari-sari or retail store business selling various goods and items to the people in his place. 

Mar Joe is asking to take a loan to buy more stock like canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, condiments, and cooking oil, among other items. A loan will help him improve his inventory, thus attracting more buyers in his store. 

In the future, Mar Joe has hopes of making his business a success. Moreover, he wants to save money for the future schooling of his children.

loans.use: to buy more stock like canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, condiments, and cooking oil

loans.name: Emelyn

texts.en: Emelyn is a dried-fish vendor from San Dionisio, Iloilo. She is 37 years old, married and has two children. Emelyn has been in the dried-fish vending business for more than five years now. Emelyn is asking for a loan to buy more dried fish to sell. A loan will help her improve her stock, thus allowing her to sell more to her customers. Emelyn hopes to expand her business in the future in order to generate more income. Moreover, she wants to save money for the future schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy more dried fish to sell. A loan will help her improve her stock, thus allowing her to sell more to her customers

loans.name: Henry

texts.en:
Henry is 40 years old. He is married with five children. He has had a mixed farming business for the last eight years and earns a monthly profit of KES 10,000.

Henry has applied for his eighth loan from Visionfund Kenya, which he will use to pay school fees for his children. He hopes this will help him to plough back into his business.

His hopes and dreams for the future are to expand his business and be financially stable..

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Jamson

texts.en:
Jamson used his previous loan to buy cooking oil, soda and beer to sell.

He is a hard working married man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He still runs a retail shop alongside farming. He started this business in order to educate his children and improve his standards of living. He still faces hardships of competition, limited capital and bad debtors but still has dreams of owning a wholesale shop and educating his children to university levels.

He is requesting a loan to buy more sugar, tea leaves, omo and sweets to sell.

loans.use: to buy more sugar, tea leaves, omo and sweets to sell.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is a brilliant woman who has been married for 16 years and has three children. Her husband heads the family, and she supports him in many ways, including provision of the family's basic needs. 

Sarah ventured into farming 16 years ago, around the same time she got married. Today, she owns two acres of land, where she keeps dairy cows and poultry and grows trees and tea.
  
In preparation for the planting season, Sarah is seeking a loan to pay for farm implements. The new implements will replace her old tools. Better and improved tools will make her work on the farm easier and faster. The quality of work achieved by modern tools will be much higher and so will the yields at the end of the season.

loans.use: to buy farm implements

loans.name: Ma. Riza

texts.en:
Ma. Riza, 36, is a married woman with six children. Five of her children are in school. 

Ma. Riza has a food vending business in the Philippines, a business she has been in for five years. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

She has requested a loan of 10,000 Philippine pesos through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation. She will use the loan to buy ingredients for her food production business.

In the future, Ma. Riza would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Geofrey

texts.en:
Geofrey lives in Hoima Uganda. He is aged 51 and married with five children of aged between 12 and 26 years; four of them attend school.

Geofrey operates a retail shop mainly selling general merchandise like salt, sugar and bread among other items. He gets additional income from farming. He has hopes of developing his business and will use the loan to buy more stock like sugar and salt to sell.

loans.use: to buy more stock like sugar and salt to sell.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is aged 29. She is a single mother of one child and gets income from operating a retail shop, mainly for the selling of sugar, salt and soap, among other items. She gets additional income from working in a bank in Hoima, Uganda.

She dreams of building her own house and will use the loan to buy more stock like sugar, salt and bread to sell.

loans.use: to buy more stock like sugar, salt and bread to sell.

loans.name: Magret's Group

texts.en:
Magret is a 46-year-old proud mother of five children. She is a group leader, is often described as a very hardworking individual, and is representing her group of 10 farmers in Kakamega North District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2014, Magret has noticed that she has been able to consistently feed her family.

Magret described her harvest as good last year, but believes she can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. She is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize, because she will now be able to have light during dark hours for her children to be able to study. With the profits from this season’s harvest, she plans to save more money for the future.

With this loan, Magret’s Group will be able to plant a total of 4.5 acres of land and purchase a total of nine solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy construction materials to construct a pila for water conservation and recondition her bathroom, etc.

loans.name: Magaret's Group

texts.en:
Pictured above is Magaret, often described as an extremely hardworking individual. She is 53 years old and has 6 children. As a group leader, she is representing her group of 10 farmers in Kakamega North District, Kenya. 

Magaret is returning this season to work with One Acre Fund again, as this means that she is able to get the best quality fertilizer and hybrid seeds, which is why she decided to join in the first place. Magaret says that she is happy to have made that decision because, since she first joined in 2013, she has had more profits from each harvest, which has improved her day-to-day life significantly. Magaret will use the profits from this season to invest in a business.

The group will use this loan to purchase seeds and fertilizer to plant a total of six acres. Given that some members of the group will also be purchasing a solar light, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of four solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize

loans.name: Constantine

texts.en:
Constantine is a mother of five children, based in Nandi Hills region of Kenya. Seventeen years ago when Constantine got married, she began farming. As the farming activities grew, Constantine was able to chip in and support her husband in supporting the family. Today, Constantine keeps dairy cows and poultry on her one-acre farm. She also holds a job which pays a salary. 

Constantine is seeking a KES 30,000 loan to buy farm tools. These implements are much improved in design and usability as compared to the old ones that she has been using, which need replacement. Your loan investment to Constantine will make the cultivation work, that she does under the searing afternoon heat, much better!

loans.use: to purchase farm tools

loans.name: Octubre Group

texts.es:
Sandra es una mujer de 31 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene un hijo de 10 años, y su negocio es la venta de comida tradicional.
Ella es buena madre, optimista, paciente, responsable y trabajadora. Su negocio lo desarrollan en el barrio ’15 de Octubre’ de la ciudad, un sitio caracterizado por el comercio informal y por la manufactura independiente. De clima cálido, tropical y húmedo con una temperatura ambiente que varía entre 21º y 35º grados centígrados durante el día y todo el año.
Sandra es de tez morena, cabello negro largo lo usa amarrado, ojos obscuros, baja estatura, complexión física robusta, viste a la moda, su lengua materna es el Guaraní que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza (sentada en la silla). Su vida la comparte con su pareja que se dedica al transporte libre y con su hijo que estudia en la escuela, viven en un cuarto alquilado construido de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina y cuenta con agua potable, electricidad y alcantarillado. Su deseo por aumentar sus ingresos económicos generando mayor cantidad de ventas la impulsó a formar una banca de personas con negocios como; comercio de cosméticos, venta de empanadas, venta de ropa de temporada, venta de muebles, tejido a máquina, confección de carteras de cuero, confección de polleras, venta de salteñas, venta de edredones, venta de ollas y servicio de transporte, para solicitar un préstamo y ampliar sus actividades. Su negocio es la elaboración y venta de comida tradicional cruceña, platos como; Chicharrón de Taitetu (Chanchitos de monte “taitetú” frito), locro carretero cruceño (sopa de: carne deshidratada, carne cortada en pedacitos, yuca y huevo), Sopa de Remojado (sopa de huesos), y otros. Labor que realiza todos los días de la semana en horario de almuerzo y cena, en un puesto de venta improvisado en la calle al aire libre, bajo unas sombrillas para cubrirse del sol, unas pocas mesas y unos bancos para sentarse; “quisiera mejorar mi negocio, realizando la compra de mesas y bancos para atender a más gente, porque los clientes no encuentran un sitio donde comer y se van…” comenta. Su sueño es tener un restaurante con todas las condiciones para brindar una buena atención, ella desea ampliar su negocio mediante la compra de mesas, sillas, y juegos de cubiertos para atender a mayor cantidad de clientes y mejorar sus ventas. Esta es la primera secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 1 años que viene realizando esta actividad. 
Es por esos motivos que Sandra solicita un préstamo para la compra de mesas, sillas y cubiertos para atender a mayor cantidad de clientes y mejorar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Sandra, 31, lives with her partner.  She's an optimistic, patient, responsible, and hardworking woman, and a good mother to her son, 10.

Her business is selling traditional food.  She works in the 15 de Octubre neighborhood of the city, an area known as an informal sector and for independent manufacturing.  The climate is warm, tropical, and humid, and the air temperature varies between 21 and 35 degrees centigrade during the day throughout the year.

Sandra (seated in the chair) is dark with dark eyes, and she wears her long black hair tied back.  She's of robust stature and dresses fashionably.  Her native language is Guarani, which she speaks at home; she speaks Spanish for cultural reasons and for business.  She lives with her partner, who works in transportation, and her son, who attends school.  They live in a rented room built of brick and cement with a metal roof, and they have potable water, electricity, and gas.

Sandra's desire to increase her income by generating more sales inspired her to form a bank with people with businesses to request a loan and expand their businesses.  These include cosmetics sales, empanada sales, seasonal clothing sales, furniture sales, machine weaving, leather wallet production, making "polleras" [traditional skirts], "salteña" [meat pie] sales, quilt sales, cookware sales, and transportation services.

Her business is making and selling "taitetú" cracklings (fried boar), Santa Cruz-style "locro carretero" (stew with dehydrated meat, chopped meat, yuca, and eggs), "remojado" soup (bone soup), and other traditional Santa Cruz dishes.

She works every day of the week during lunch and dinner in a sales stall she sets up outside on the street under some umbrellas for protection from the sun and with a few tables and benches for seating.  "I would like to improve my business by buying tables and benches to serve more customers, because they go away if they don't find a place to eat," she said.

Sandra's requesting a loan because she wants to expand her business with the purchase of tables, chairs, and cutlery to serve more customers and improve her sales.  This is her first loan sequence with the institution in the year she has been in this line of work.  Her dream is to have a restaurant with everything she needs to give good service.

loans.use: to buy tables, chairs, and cutlery to serve more customers and improve her sales

loans.name: Ignatius

texts.en: Ignatius lives in Hoima, Uganda. He is aged 37, hardworking, and married with four children, all of whoml attend school. He started the business of buying and selling maize, beans, and rice in order to get income to support his family. He also carries out farming to earn an extra income. He desires to educate his children and will use the loan to buy more maize and beans to sell.

loans.use: to buy more maize and beans to sell.

loans.name: Satarbek

texts.ru: Сатарбек, 54 года, женат, 4 детей. Самому младшему 2 годика. У Сатарбека - средне-специальное образование, он знает как правильно использовать и планировать денежные средства для достижения поставленных целей. В качестве основного дохода для своей семьи занимается животноводством и полеводством. Стартовав 17 лет назад с покупки скота на 15,000 сом (KGS), благодаря упорному труду Сатарбека, в его хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется 12 овец, 3 коровы. Для содержания скота есть все условия: сарай и отгонные пастбища. На арендованном участке мерою 1,0 Га, он выращивает арбузы. Сатарбек обратился в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку семян и удобрений для парника. Он является одним из 3 участников группы "Ынтымак". Доходы от кредита позволят Сатарбеку развить его бизнес и накопить на покупку необходимой в хозяйстве грузовой машины.
texts.en: Satarbek is 54 years old, married, and the father of four children.  His youngest child is just two years old.  Satarbek has a specialized secondary education and he knows how to properly use and invest money to reach the goals that he has set for himself.  As the main source of income for his family, he is involved in animal husbandry and agriculture.  He started 17 years ago when he purchased his first livestock for 15,000 som (KGS).  Thanks to his very hard work, he currently has 12 sheep and three cows on his farm.  He has everything that he needs to take care of livestock: a barn as well as fields to send the animals to pasture.  He also grows watermelons on one hectare of rented land.  Satarbek has turned to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC and requested a loan of 100,000 som (KGS) to buy seeds and fertilizers to be used inside his greenhouse.  He is a member of the "Yntymak" group, which comprises a total of three members.  The earnings from his loan will allow Satarbek to grow his business and to save some money to buy a much needed truck.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and seeds in order to grow organic produce in his greenhouse.

loans.name: Elmira

texts.ru: Элмира, 31 год, замужем, мать 2 детей. На протяжении 4 лет занимается животноводством и полеводством, мастер в своем деле. У Элмиры среднее образование. Элмира достигла больших успехов в своем бизнесе. В хозяйстве имеет 2 коровы, 5 овец. Также есть земельный надел, 1,0 ГА собственной земли, где она выращивает арбузы для реализации. Совокупная прибыль Элмиры составляет около 25,000 сом (KGS). Элмира обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом, в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку удобрений и семян для парника. Она является участником группы "Ынтымак", в которой кроме нее состоят еще 2 человека. Это позволит ей развить бизнес и увеличить доход от бизнес деятельности.
texts.en: Elmira is 31 years old, married, and the mother of two children.  She has been raising livestock and growing crops for four years and she has a good deal of experience in her field of work. She has a secondary education and has managed to achieve great results with her business.  She currently owns two cows and five sheep.  She also grows watermelons for resale on one hectare of her own land.  She makes a total income of about 25,000 som (KGS) per month.  She has turned to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC and requested a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) to buy fertilizers and seeds to be used in her greenhouse.  She is a member of the "Yntymak" group, which comprises a total of three members.  Thanks to this loan, she will be able to develop her business and increase the income she makes from her activity.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers in order to grow organic produce in her greenhouse.

loans.name: Jean Bosco

texts.en:
Jean Bosco is aged 36 years. He is married with four children aged between 1 and 17 years; three of them go to school. He is a farmer and he has been producing rice for 17 years, while his wife is a businesswoman. 

With the loan from Kiva, he would like to pay workers. The profits from the business will be used to renovate his house.

loans.use: to pay workers.

loans.name: Kasozi Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Godfrey is a member of Kasozi Village Bank. He deals in produce, mainly buying and selling maize, beans and rice among other items in Hoima, Uganda. He ventured into farming as a way of supplementing his income. His desire is to expand and capture a wider market and to educate his children. 

He is seeking credit to buy more maize and beans for sale. His main challenge is the price fluctuations of produce.

loans.use: to buy more maize and beans to sell

loans.name: Together Group

texts.en: The borrower, Janet, has been working in retail of soft drinks for the past 23 years. She has been a member of this group for four years. She is 46 years old and an experienced entrepreneur. She is also married with two children, both of whom are in school. Janet sells soft drinks, and she displays her merchandise in a bar at her residence. She is requesting a loan from ID Ghana in order to expand her business. She is going to buy different kinds of drinks and then sell them to customers. She started her business with some money she received from her husband. She also wants to educate and feed her children. She thanks ID Ghana for its support of women entrepreneurs excluded from the traditional banking system, and for granting them loans without any collateral guarantee. She, together with other members, need a total amount of GHS 2,600 to expand their businesses.

loans.use: To buy different kinds of drinks to sell to customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cement, sand, and metal, and to pay for the labor necessary for construction of a perimeter wall.

loans.name: Cholpon

texts.ru: Чолпон, 47 лет, замужем, мать 3 детей. У Чолпон среднее образование, она на пенсии, в качестве дополнительного дохода для своей семьи на протяжении 24 лет занимается полеводством и животноводством. Благодаря упорному труду и целеустремленности Чолпон, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется земельный участок мерою 4,0 ГА, где она выращивает фасоль для реализации оптовым покупателям. Экологически чистые и очень вкусные овощи пользуются большим спросом. Также в хозяйстве есть корова и 20 овец. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коровы и 20 овец. Доходы от кредита Чолпон планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие ее бизнеса, она хочет построить большой сарай.
texts.en: Cholpon is 47 years old, married, and the mother of three children.  She has a secondary education and she receives a pension.  As an additional source of income for her family, she has been raising livestock and growing crops for the past 24 years.  Thanks to her very hard work and her determination, she currently owns four hectares of land on which she grows beans for resale to wholesale buyers.  Her organic and delicious vegetables are in high demand.  She also has one cow and 20 sheep on her farm.  In order to further grow her business, she has turned to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC and requested a loan of 150,000 som (KGS) to buy one cow and 20 sheep.  She is planning to use the earnings from her loan to further grow her business.  She also wants to build a large stable.

loans.use: to buy one cow and 20 sheep for fattening and resale.
